loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: D. Delphine est née vers 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Delphine vit depuis près de 10 ans à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Mariée à KPOKPOLANKPO Iréné un mécanicien auto, Delphine est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Delphine vit seule avec son enfant et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Delphine n’a fait que le cours primaire. Il y a de cela trois ans que Delphine mène comme activité, la vente de mèches et également de sous vêtements par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Delphine s’approvisionne. Delphine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits pour pouvoir mieux les faire écouler en période de fêtes de fin d’année, Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Delphine D. was born around 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Delphine has lived in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou for nearly 10 years. Married to Iréné Kpokpolankpo, an auto mechanic, Delphine is mother to one child who is in school. Delphine lives alone with her child and takes care of the family's expenses by herself. Delphine only went to elementary school. For three years, Delphine has sold hair extensions and underwear through the distribution system. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Delphine is a long-time client of Alidé who has already received two loans through them, loans that she repaid in full. Delphine is requesting a third loan through Alidé so she can buy more stock that she will be able to sell during the end-of-the-year celebrations.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of hair extensions

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with six children. Her eldest is 22 years old and attending university. Her husband is a contractor and he also supports the home. She is 47 years old. 

She owns a stall in the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Sumiat

texts.en:
Sumiat is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband makes a living selling granite and sand, and works hard to support his family. Sumiat is a LAPO client who sells items made of plastic to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting for a loan for NGN 70,000 to buy more plastic items to sell, and extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.  
 
LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To buy more plastics to sell

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Loma de la Cruz esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor futuro para sus familias, y con el trabajo diario lo están consiguiendo poco a poco sintiéndose orgullosas por sus logros, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad que guarda los encantos de su centro histórico y también su combinación de tres culturas ricas en simbolismos, tradición y arte: Cañari, Inca y Española.

La Sra. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Miraflores, tiene 64 años de edad y se encuentra divorciado hace 15 años siendo los motivos que su esposo le planteo el divorcio pensando que le iba a quitar una herencias que tenia que recibir y como se encontraba fuera del país se divorciaron, en su unión conyugal procrearon 4 hijos, sus tres hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente fuera de su hogar, solo su hijo soltero de 27 años vive en su casa y es quien le ayuda en su negocio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Blanca tiene una tienda hace 10 años en la cual labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. trabaja de domingo a domingo y nunca cierra, por que cuenta con su fiel clientela, y si le va bien ya que tiene un gran surtido de mercadería, tiene un gran vinculo de amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y le han beneficiado para surtir un poco mas su negocio, y nos comenta que fue incentiva a ingresar al banco por su amiga Marlene quien socia, con el nuevo préstamo que recibe de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como es arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., ya que todos los productos se encuentran caros y necesita para surtir su negocio, su mayor sueño seria el de poder conservar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank Loma de la Cruz is made up of a group of women who seek a better future for their families and with their daily work, they are little by little managing to feel proud of their achievements. They live in the city of Cuenca. This is a city, known for the charming historic center and also it has a combination of three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition and art: Cañari, Inca y Spanish. Ms. Blanca is a member of the communal bank Loma de la Cruz. She lives in the city of Cuenca, in the Miraflores area. She is 64 years old and she has been divorced for 15 years. The reasons were that the husband stood for the divorce thinking that the inheritance would be taken and since he was abroad, they divorced. During the marriage, they had 4 children. Three of her children are married and live independently, away from home. Only her single, 27 year old son lives at home and he helps with her business. He does not have his own house because he is renting. Blanca has had a store for 10 years. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p. m., working from Sunday to Sunday and never closing because she has a faithful clientele. If things go well now that she has a large selection of merchandise, she will have a good bond of friendship with all of her communal bank partners. She is in her second cycle of working with the loans from the foundation and it has been beneficial for stocking her business a little more. She tells us that she was influenced to join the bank by her friend Marlene, who is a member. With the new loan that she receives from the foundation, she is going to invest in the purchase of products for her store like rice, sugar, noodles etc. Since all of the products are expensive and she needs to stock her store. Her biggest dream would be to keep her health, so she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies, rice, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Izro

texts.en:
Izro, 41, lives in Banga, South Cotabato and has a rice-farming business. He devotes his time to working in his rice field.

Izro heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and that it offers financial support to entrepreneurs like him, and he later joined in October 2008.

Izro’s business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 6,000 Php. This loan has a low interest rate and will be helpful to sustain his business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy yams and plantain bananas

loans.name: Khadijat

texts.en: Selling clothes is a business activity that Khadijat J. loves so much. She loves this business because of her interaction with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is itching for progress and expansion in her business. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Khadijat is 28 years old and married with three children. Her youngest child is two years old. Her children are still young and dependent on her. Her husband also works to support their home. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Benna Tatiana

texts.fr: K. Benna Tatiana est née le 06 Juin 1986 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Benna Tatiana réside depuis son jeune âge au quartier Vodjè à Cotonou. C'est une célibataire sans enfant qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Benna Tatiana a très peu fréquenté. Depuis 8 ans, dans le but de se prendre en charge et d'assurer ses besoins, Benna Tatiana vend des tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Benna Tatiana s'approvisionne dans une boutique au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou. Benna Tatiana a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Benna Tatiana désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients. Mais Benna Tatiana ne dispose pas des moyens financiers nécessaire à l'atteinte de son objectif. C'est pourquoi Benna Tatiana sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Benna Tatiana K. was born on 6 June 1986 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Benna Tatiana has lived in the Vodjè area of Cotonou since she was young. She is unmarried without children, lives by herself, and supports herself on her own. Benna Tatiana had a very limited education. For 8 years, with the goal of providing for herself and meeting her needs, Benna Tatiana has been selling fabric at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She gets her supplies at a store in the Missèbo market in Cotonou. Benna Tatiana has already obtained two loans with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid them both properly. Benna Tatiana wants to raise the level of her business and better satisfy her customers. However, she does not have the necessary financial means to achieve her objective. This is why she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Hajjarah

texts.en: Hajjarah A. is a promising businesswoman and a resident of Bukoto Mulimila Zone. She owns a retail shop at her home. She has operated her business for almost eight years. She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as sugar, packed milk, soda, eggs, safi juice, salt, soap, flour, rice, and so forth to sell. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to improve on her rental houses to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her shop

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is a 31-year old married woman who lives in Prk Kalubihan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and sugarcane plantation businesses. Ailyn’s husband, Eriberto Sr., is a tricycle driver. They have 2 young children who are between 3 and 9 years old. One child is currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ailyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and sugarcane plantation businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000.

Ailyn is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 22,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and had a positive impact in both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan in the amount of Php 24,000, which she intends to use for her general store and sugarcane plantation. Ailyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which include providing them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additonal working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Delfino de 40 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con el último,  ya que los demás son mayores e independientes.  Cada día es nuevo para esta trabajadora mujer que se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra papa y alverjas junto a su esposo e hijo. Sin embargo el trabajo en el campo es cansada, pero le gusta mucho porque sabe como cuidar bien cada planta para que llegue en buen estado hasta la época de la cosecha. Cuando es tiempo de recoger toda su producción de papas y alverjas, toda la familia se dedica a cargar el producto al camión, para luego ser trasladado en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. De esta manera obtiene regulares ganancias, esto le permite vivir cómodamente. Esta laboriosa dama tiene muchos planes para el futuro, entre ellos sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias y seguir adelante. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que el crédito le permita continuar trabajando; además esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de todos los integrantes de su grupo comunal, pues han demostrado ser responsables en el pago de su cuotas. Luz tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de abono e insecticidas, para asegurar sus tierras en la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Luz is 38 and shares her home with her husband Delfino, who is 40. They have five children, all but one of whom live independently. Each day brings hope to Luz, who works cultivating the land to plant potatoes and peas, helped by her husband and son. Though tiring work, Luz enjoys the rewards of tending crops until harvest time, when her family transports the produce to a local wholesale market for sale. She has obtained a stable income from her efforts, and in the future plans to expand cultivation to obtain higher returns. This is her third microloan from MFP, and Luz is very thankful for the opportunities she has had as a result; she is also encouraged by the other members of the communal loan program, who have been responsible in paying off their small loans in a timely way. Specifically, Luz will invest the loan funds in fertilizer and insecticides, to prepare her lands for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for crops

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is the 40-year-old father of four children. He and his wife are farmers who live in Hoima, Uganda. Gideon is the breadwinner for his family of four people and his family lives in a house Gideon constructed through his hard work. He dreams of seeing all his children educated to university level and that would make him see his dream come true.

Given the farmer he is, Gideon is an ever-busy man and is generally a hard worker with the zeal to succeed in agriculture. He, however, faces the challenge of seasonal storms which affect his crops some times but he still maintains agriculture is a good business.

Gideon intends to use the loan to pay for manual labor to till his farmland since, in the rural areas of Uganda, mechanized farming is limited.

loans.use: To pay for manual labor to till his farmland

loans.name: Jenelita's Group

texts.en:
Jenelita C. is from the village of Mabini. She is 49 years old, married and has an adult child. To make a living, Jenelita is engaged in selling dry goods in the local community. Through this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 10,000. 

In 2001, Jenelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jenelita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion. This loan will be the 28th loan taken out by Jenelita from PMPC. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of the business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a farmer in eastern Kenya.  She's been running her mixed farm for 4 years and employs one farm-hand.  Her farming produces kale, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells on the local market.

With this loan (her second from Juhudi Kilimo), she'll buy an insured dairy cow.  In 5 years, Mercy plans to construct rental houses on her plot of land.  The location is good since it's close to the market and the demand is high.  She hopes this will boost her income.

The primary business challenges Mercy cites are pests and crop diseases, as well as high feed prices for livestock.

Mercy is married, 35 years old, and has 2 children (one 10, and the other 2 and a half months).  Her ten-year-old attends school.  She hopes this loan will improve her family's living standard and she will use the revenue from her farming towards her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es soltera y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Martina viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho para comercializarlos en los mercados y una empresa de lácteos, en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales. Martina tiene un carro en la ruta 13 que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de quinua.
Martina es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una empresa.
texts.en:
Martina is single and has three children in school. She travels to the fairs in the region where she buys grain and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho to sell at the markets and to a dairy company. On a few occasions, she will process the grain herself. Martina also has a car that is used for providing transportation along Route 13 of the city. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of quinoa.

Martina is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to open a business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: 45-year-old Emma L. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has an 8-year-old child. Emma raises and fattens hogs for sale and also uses her backyard for planting vegetables that she sells in her community. She also loves cooking so she decided to earn from what she loves doing: she used part of their house to display cooked food that her neighbors and passersby buy from her. Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell and will also buy ingredients for her cooking business. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell and also ingredients for her cooking business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata, who is married and has four children, sells food items and used clothing in Makeni, and is normally assisted by her family members.  Initially, she was financed by her husband when she began trading over three years ago.  Aminata is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more used clothing and food items.  A cool and very determined business woman, she hopes to use the proceeds to educate her children to university level and to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Juan Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Juan Marcelino Ríos se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador ya que atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos y agua.Su núcleo familiar se compone de 5 personas 4 hijos y su esposa, los hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la misma localidad, su esposa trabaja en Managua y  con su salario apoya  los gastos del hogar. Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para la compra de las bebidas gaseosas, jugos y agua así como la compra de pollo y carne para ofrecerla de igual manera y así generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
This client originally hails from Caserío el Paraíso, Mina el Limón road, next to Caserío Minvah. He currently works in the commercial sector, selling fizzy drinks, fried food, etc. He is married with 4 children. His children are studying at the local college. His wife works in Managua and with her salary they are able to pay the household bills. This client has managed to obtain 4 loans, which have enabled him to improve his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase: Pepsi in different containers, bottles, cans, etc., beef, chicken, pork, cooking oil, vegetables, rice and beans

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María reside en San Francisco Gotera, tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos de las edades de 18, 14, 13 años vive junto a su esposo, Posee un negocio de ropa desde hace 10 años y elabora bolsos de hilo plástico, no posee un horario fijo porque le dedica tiempo a la elaboración de los bolsos y luego visita a sus clientes de la zona para ofrecer sus productos. Ella está solicitando un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería y los materiales para la preparación de los bolsos, Con este préstamo María incrementara su inventario de materiales y podrá elaborar mas bolsos,  podrá ofrecer a sus clientes ropa de diferentes estilos, aumentaran sus ventas y sus ingresos serán mayores; Ella aspira tener un negocio grande que pueda ofrecer lo que el cliente necesita y poder darle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan y que mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
37-year old María lives in San Francisco Gotera with her husband and three children aged 18, 14, and 13. She has run a clothing business for ten years and also makes bags from strands of plastic. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule as sometimes she is making the bags and other times she is selling her products to customers in the neighbourhood. María is seeking a loan to buy merchandise and also materials for making the bags. With the money she will increase her inventory of clothing and be able to offer a wider range to her customers. She will also be able to make more bags. In this way she will make more sales and have a bigger income. One day she hopes to have a larger business so she can offer her customers what they need, be able to provide her children with a good education so they can improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and plastic yarn to make bags

loans.name: Julio  Rafael

texts.es: Julio Yépez tiene 28 años y vive con su esposa en San Juan Nepomuceno, desde allí construyeron el sueño de irse a Venezuela a vivir y a trabajar a buscar un mejor futuro; fue así como iniciaron con una tienda en el vecino país, pero gradualmente la situación de allí se puso difícil y decidieron buscar la forma de salir adelante, por eso se regresaron a su pueblo natal e iniciaron el negocio de vender  víveres  traídos  desde Venezuela y así mismo enviaban  artesanía desde San Juan Nepomuceno, a Venezuela  para comercializarla. En la actualidad solicitan su primer credikiva, el cual invertirán en la compra de víveres, como arroz, leche en polvo, aceite, calzado, bolsos y billeteras, con este financiamiento tendrán un capital de trabajo disponible para conseguir a un buen precio los artículos que ellos venden y no tener que traerlos desde el país vecino.  Su sueño es ahora tener un local bien amplio y convertirlo en un depósito de estas mercancías para venderla al por mayor en tiendas y a distribuidores del municipio y de otros ubicados a su alrededor. Con su negocio Julio y su esposa están construyendo el futuro de su familia para cuando vengan los hijos tener todas los condiciones que la educación y la crianza ameritan
texts.en:
Julio Yépez is 28 years old and lives with his wife in San Juan Nepomuceno. From there they built their dream of traveling to Venezuela so that they can live, work, and seek a better future. They opened a store in the neighboring country, but gradually the situation there became difficult and they decided to find a way to move forward. Julio and his wife returned to their hometown and started a business selling provisions brought over from Venezuela as well as buying handicrafts from San Juan Nepomuceno to sell in Venezuela.

Julio is currently requesting his first Kiva loan which will be used to buy provisions such as rice, powdered milk, and oil as well as shoes, purses, and wallets. This funding will provide available operating capital to continue receiving low prices for the goods he sells without having to bring them over from Venezuela. His dream is to have a larger store and convert it into a warehouse where he can sell merchandise in bulk to stores, local distributors, and other entities in the surrounding areas.

With this business, Julio and his wife are able to build a future for their family so that when they are ready to have children, they can provide all the conditions to raise and educate them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, powdered milk, oil, shoes, purses, and wallets

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario  se dedica desde hace ya quince años a la producción de leche y derivados, su familia esta compuesta por el, su esposa además de sus dos hijos, cuenta con doce vacas lecheras tipo holstein además de sus crías, las cuales son atendidas por don Mario  su esposa e hijos desde muy tempranas horas del día, entrega diariamente la leche a un complejo muy conocido de la ciudad de Cochabamba, con el dinero del credito comprara 2 vaquillas que le estan ofreciendo a buen precio y no quiere dejar de pasar esta buena oportunidad, cuenta con terrenos propios donde tiene sembrado alfalfa para la alimentación del ganado, es una persona muy trabajadora, y esta muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Mario has worked in the production of milk and other dairy products for over fifteen years. His family is comprised of himself, his wife and his two children. They own twelve milk producing Holstein cows and their offspring, which are cared for by the family. Mario gets up in the early hours of the morning to deliver the milk to a very well known organisation in the city of Cochabamba. Additionally, Mario also has his own land where he has planted alfafa to feed his cattle. 

With the loan that he is applying for, Mario will buy two heifers that are being offered at a good price, to take advantage of this great opportunity.  He is a very hardworking person and is very grateful to Emprender for the confidence they have placed in him in granting him this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of two heifers

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 58 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Moisés de 57 años y de una de sus hijas, de los 3 hijos que tiene, pues lo otros 2 son mayores e independientes. Esta emprendedora mujer manifiesta con orgullo que ha trabajado durante toda su vida, y en la actualidad atiende su negocio de venta de maíz, quinua, quiwicha, entre otros productos andinos de alto valor nutricional. Ella es muy laboriosa y se despierta cada día con los primeros rayos de luz, pues empieza con la venta ambulatoria en una esquina de una calle muy transitada de su zona, y obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten mantenerse sin problemas. Lo  que no le gusta de su actividad es que no tiene mucho tiempo disponible pues debe estar pendiente de su negocio durante todo el día. Además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene pensado en el futuro  instalar su negocio en un lugar más estable y continuar trabajando con tranquilidad. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Bertha tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de maíz y productos andinos para surtir mejor su negocio; además quiere empezar a pagar la primera letra de su puesto en un mercado de su zona.
texts.en:
Bertha, 58, lives in her own house that is next door to her husband Moses, 57, and one of her 3 daughters.  The other 2 are grown and independent.  This enterprising woman says with pride, that she has worked throughout her whole life and now has a business selling corn, quinoa, and kiwicha, (quiwicha, type of grain), among other Andean crops of high nutritional value.  

Bertha is very hard-working and wakes up every day with he first rays of light.  She begins with street vending on a busy street corner in her neighborhood, and she gets regular income that allows her to stay without problems.  What she dislikes about this activity is she doesn't have much free time as she should be keeping an eye on her business all day.  Also, as a female entrepreneur, in the future, she is thinking of setting up her business in a more stable place to continue working in peace.  

This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to pay her dues on time, not wanting to look bad to people who made this loan possible.  This loan will allow her to continue to progress.  Bertha has planned to invest the requested loan to buy more corn and Andean products to improve her business.  She also wants to start paying the first bill for her stall in a market in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy corn and grain products and also pay the first bill of her stall.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa S. is from the village of Barangay Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Melissa owns and operates a business selling dried fish in the market. Melissa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Melissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Antonia Lucia

texts.es:
Antonia de 57 años, cría pollos y los vende cuando ya están grandes. Vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Cuando estaba sin trabajo la hija le regalo una caja de pollos pequeños para que los criara ya que la hija sabia del negocio le enseño como mantenerlos sanos y gordos. Poco a poco con la primera venta de pollos pudo tener capital para seguir con el negocio y tener un pequeño puesto en el patio de su casa para el criadero de los pollos. Ahora trabaja sola desde muy temprano les da de comer hasta que termina el día. Cada pollo lo vende según su peso y porte. También cose ropa a sus vecinos para tener dinero adicional.    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar balanceado para alimentar a los pollos y telas para comenzar a confeccionar ropa. En el futuro quiere arreglar su casa e incrementar su negocio de pollos.
texts.en:
Antonia, 57, raises chickens and sells when they are large. She lives in a peri-urban area with all of the basic services, located in the perimeter of Guayaquil, an area surrounded by a marsh.

When she was without work, her daughter gave her a small box of chickens to be brought up, as the daughter of the business knew how to keep them fat and healthy. Gradually, with the first sale of chickens, they could have capital to continue the business and have a small stand in the backyard for breeding chickens. Now she works alone from very early until the day ends feeding them. Each chicken is sold by weight and size. She also sews clothing for her neighbors to earn additional money. 

With this loan she wants to buy balanced feed for her chickens and materials to start making clothes. In the future she wants to fix up her home and grow her chicken business.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for her chickens

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
Eleven members form this village loan. They are located in Ruessei Chrouy village in Kandal province. Mr. Chem C., who is 50 years old, has been selected by the village members as their village bank president. Each member will use their money for different purposes. 

Mr. Chem C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate different vegetables. He is also a house builder. With these occupations, he still earns a small income with which to support his family. To increase his income and improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Chem C. would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise. He will use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds for cultivating rice. His wife, Mrs. Phork Sokun, is 42 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory. 
 
This couple has six children: two of them are laborers and the others are students who also support their father's businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem R., 48, sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day. R. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 15 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 8 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Remt is requesting a loan of USD 900 to help her child get married. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to help her child get married

loans.name: Maria Aleyda

texts.es:
Desde hace 17 meses Maria Aleyda y a sus 34 años, deleita con sus comidas rápidas a los habitantes del Municipio de Caldas, en la Vereda la Clara. Espacio  muy reconocido porque es cerca de la Reserva Ecológica Alto de San Miguel o más conocido como el nacimiento del Rio Medellín. “por acá viene mucho turista y debo ampliar mi negocio para así salir adelante con mis tres hijos”, según palabras de Maria Aleyda.

“Mi meta con el negocio es ponerlo bonito, y así vender más para poder brindarle estudio a mis tres hijos, el cual no tienen por el momento” puntualiza Maria. 

La idea de Maria Aleyda con el crédito adquirido es comprar surtido para esta época de vacaciones y hacer unas adecuaciones al kiosco y así empezar muy bien el año.
texts.en:
Maria Aleyda is 34 years old.  For 17 months she has been delighting the residents of Vereda la Clara, in the town of Caldas, with her delicious fast food.  Her business is very well known because it is near the Alto de San Miguel nature reserve which is better known as the source of the River Medellín "lots of tourists come here and I must expand my business so that I can get myself and my three children ahead in life" says Maria Aleyda.

"My goal for the business is to make it look nice so that I can sell more and thereby provide my three children with an education that they don't have right now", María states.

María Aleyda plans to use her loan to stock her business for the holiday period and to do some remodelling work on her kiosk so that she can start the new year well.

loans.use: To stock her business and expand her premises

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: Djuma R.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Etoile,  âgée de 47 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants orphelins de père. Seulement  1 enfant qui étudie, 4 n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers et  deux autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Son mari fut décède suite d’une maladie inopinée.  Elle est vendeuse de boissons (bière Primus et Fanta) à son domicile. Il ya 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle  démarra son business  avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits brassicoles  (10 casiers de Primus, 5 casiers de Fanta) pour augmenter le stock en volume et en valeurs. Le reste  d’argent  de crédit lui servira pour acheter la farine de manioc pour alimentation des enfants. En plus, elle ambitionne  augmenter son épargne et acheter une parcelle pour sa famille. La cliente Djuma R.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Etoile est composé de 38 membres.
texts.en: Djuma R. is an entrepreneur and she is the president of the group, named Etoile (Star). She is 47 years old, a widow, and the mother of 7 children who were orphaned by their father. Only 1 of the children is in school. Four of them are not in school for the lack of financial resources, and two others already have their own homes. Her husband passed away following an unexpected illness. She sells drinks (Primus brand beer and Fanta) from her home. She has 25 years in the business. She started out with her own funds. Later she had the benefit of a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner), amounting to $50. This new loan will be used to purchase more brewery products (10 cases of Primus, 5 cases of Fanta) in order to supplement her inventory, in volume and in value. The remainder of the funds will be used to purchase cassava flour, a source of nutrition for the children. In addition, she hopes to increase their investments with the purchase of a parcel of land for the family. Djuma R. is thankful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Etoile group is made up of 38 members.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cases of Primus, 5 cases of Fanta, and cassava flour.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar K. is a 44-year-old man. He is married and lives with his wife and one adult son, who works as a construction worker at a local company. Both Anvar's daughters are married. Anvar is from Saatli and operates a home appliances store. He started this line of business in 2004. With the help of this business he is able to cover all family expenses. Now the monthly income of the family is around 300 Azeri manats. 

He is a diligent person who tries to work 10-12 hours per day to improve his family's well-being and to improve his business. With this cause in mind, he requested a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN. This is his first loan with AqroInvest and Kiva. He used the loan to purchase new inventory and electrical goods for his store. Anvar is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to repay the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase new electrical goods

loans.name: Nuwagaba

texts.en:
Nuwagaba I. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 41 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. I. is involved in agriculture. He has a banana plantation enterprise and he sells matooke (steamed green bananas) for a living. I. employs one laborer in his shamba (field) and his major customers are the local community. On average, he makes about $87 in monthly profit. In addition, he is also involved in the sale of timber. 

He has been in business for over eight years and needs a loan to upgrade his banana plantation by buying and applying manure and pesticides. I. hopes to be a model farmer in his area due to his determination.

loans.use: Upgrading his banana plantation with manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: Sandra Carolina M. A.,  de veintiséis años de edad, reside en municipio de Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, uno de los municipios mas populosos y en consecuencia de mayor comercio en este país. Sandra junto a su esposo trabajan confeccionando camisas en su misma casa, las cuales en ocasiones incluyen el arte de la serigrafía, es decir estampados de colores sobre las telas de las prendas. Ya son varios los años de experiencia con los que cuenta la cliente en este negocio y por la demanda que están haciendo sus clientes, de mayor cantidad de prendas, es que se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que pueda comprar telas, hilos e incluso darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas de trabajo
texts.en: Sandra Carolina M. A., who is 26 years old, lives in the municipality of Soyapango, in the Department of San Salvador, one of the most populous municipalities that has thereby the most business in this country.  Sandra, along with her husband, works making shirts in her own home, which sometimes includes the art of silk screening, or stamping colors over the fabric of the items.  They have several years of experience with clients in this business, and due to the demand from her clients, mostly for items of clothing, she is asking for a loan with which she would buy fabric, thread, and also do maintenance on her sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make clothing

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha D. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 45 years old. Editha is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Editha sells fish that she has caught. She has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Editha's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additinal fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old.  She is married and has 1 child.   She earns a living by raising and selling pigs. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for 20 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending (banana cue).  

Rebecca is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 45 year old business-lady who sells construction materials.  She is able to raise her four children on her own with the income from her business.  She also earns extra income from her rental units.  Besides all of this, she does farming.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records hence proper management of her business.  She has requested for 80,000 Kes to buy sand, ballast and quarry dust.

loans.use: To buy sand, ballast, and quarry dust.

loans.name: Jeny Yamileth

texts.es: Jeny Yamileth V. L. de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos en el departamento de Santa Ana. Ella posee un puesto donde comercia calzado de todo tipo. Jeny es una madre de familia extraordinaria que desea sacar adelante  a su familia por medio de la dedicación a su actividad laboral; todo el día tiene la mejor sonrisa para los clientes que la visitan les ofrece un buen servicio y siempre tiene a la mano lo que las personas necesitan; a Jeny no le gusta decepcionar a su clientela y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de comprar calzado de todo tipo como: tenis, zapatillas, sandalias, zapato escolar, entre otros; de esta forma tendrá a flote su negocio y mantendrá satisfecho al cliente, además tiene fe que con el esfuerzo que realiza día con día para llevar el sustento a su hogar en un futuro dará a su familia una vida plena que cubra todas sus necesidades.
texts.en: Jeny is 30 years old and lives with her partner and four children in the department of Santa Ana. She has a post where she sells all types of footwear. Jeny is an extraordinary mother who wishes to make headway for her family by dedicating herself to her work. She has the best smile for all of her customers throughout the day, providing them good service, and she always has on hand what people need. Jeny doesn't like to disappoint her customers and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral to purchase all kinds of footwear, such as tennis shoes, slippers, sandals, school shoes and other items. In this way she will keep her business afloat and continue satisfying her customers. Jeny has faith that with all her hard work from day to day to provide for her household she will in the future give her family a full life and cover all their needs.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of footwear, such as tennis shoes, slippers, sandals, school shoes and other items.

loans.name: Marie A.

texts.fr: Née le 12 Septembre 1965, Marie est mariée à Félix, un rebobineur. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs.  Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Marie subvient ensemble avec son mari, aux besoins de la famille. Marie n’a pas été à l’école, mais  a appris la couture, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis vingt ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Marie vend des divers dans son atelier. Marie s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Marie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son atelier de couture à travers l’acquisition d’une machine à broder, et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Marie was born on September 12, 1965 and is married to Félix, an electrical technician. They provide for four children, all attending school, of whom two are their own. Marie lives with her husband and the children. The parents provide together for the family. Marie did not go to school, but learnt dressmaking, an activity that she has passionately done for the past twenty years and that enables her to provide for her needs. Marie has another activity, namely selling various sewing supplies in her workshop. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. It is the second time that Marie applies for a loan from the microfinance institution Alidé. This loan will help her to better equip her sewing workshop (she will buy an embroidering machine) and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy an embroidering machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: The photograph shows Tep in front of her house in Siem Reap Province. Tep makes her daily revenue by sewing clothes to her neighbors and other villagers as well as working as a local farmer in the village. She is a widow with four children. Two of them are employed as workers in Thailand.  Tep will be using her loan to buy additional cloth in order to continue her sewing business. With this loan Tep hopes she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth in order to continue her sewing business.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.en:
Ana Karen is 21 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in the northernmost region of Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents and her 1-year-old son. She is a happy and responsible person. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase pigs. She is starting a business to breed pigs to increase her income and provide for her son. She hopes that she will do well and she is sure that she will do so because "God knows which people who act in good faith and helps them." 

Her dream for the future is to watch her son grow up. She wants to give him a good education for his future. With the support of her loan, God, and her family, she hopes to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Benelyn

texts.en: Benelyn is married and a mother of two school-aged dependents. Benelyn is 32 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. To earn a living, she has a small market and a video-k at home for entertainment. She had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 in this business. Benelyn has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase refreshments to sell. Benelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Benelyn hopes to expand her business and have another store in the town.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She does small-scale farming and sells her produce at the local market.  She is 46 years old and married to David.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su novio en una zona rural de la provincia de Chepén – La Libertad. Andrea es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchos deseos de superación, ella quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y es por ello que pone gran esfuerzo  en su trabajo.

Andrea se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frutas , productos de aseo personal y uso doméstico en una tienda ubicada al interior de su domicilio. Cuenta con este negocio desde hace 10 años , lo que le ha dado experiencia y clientela.

Andrea desea seguir desarrollando su negocio de manera adecuada y aumentar su demanda. Por ello solicita a Epdyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para surtir su tienda con productos de primera necesidad, frutas y abarrotes.

Andrea es una mujer responsable y este préstamo le será de gran utilidad, pues le ayudará a tener  ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea is 49 years old and lives with her boyfriend in a rural zone of the Chepen – La Libertad province.  She is a hard working woman with a great desire to succeed, and who wants to improve her quality of life.  This is why she places such great effort into her work.  Andrea runs a store from her home where she sells groceries, fruit, and personal and domestic use products.  She’s had this business for 10 years and it’s given her good experience and steady customers.

Andrea would like to continue developing her business and increase her customer base.  She’s asking for this loan of 1,000 PEN through Epdyme Alternativa, so that she can stock her store with personal products, fruit, and groceries.

She is a responsible woman and this loan will be of great help in increasing her income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Henrry Martin

texts.es:
Henrry de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona desarrolla  la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

El servicio que brinda Henrry es el alquiler de equipos de sonido para todo tipo de eventos, además es dueño de una orquesta conocida en la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela, por ser conocido y brindar un buen servicio, sus contratos para alquiler de música han aumentado, por eso a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más equipos para implementar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá cubrir su crédito y solventar sus gastos familiares.

Henrry es una persona muy responsable, de confianza y trabajadora por eso su negocio a crecido y su anhelo es que más adelante pueda tener un servicio más completo para organizar eventos y seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Henrry, 40, lives with his wife and children in a house that he owns.  The house has basic services and is located in Olmos, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.  The local people make their living from farming and raising livestock.

Henrry operates an audio equipment rental business.  He supplies equipment for all kinds of events.  He also leads a band that is well-known in the area.  He has a regular set of customers who know they can depend on him to provide a good service and his leasings have increased as a result.  He is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy equipment for the business.  The investment will increase his income enough to allow him to both repay the loan and better provide for his family.  

Henrry is a responsible, hard-working man.  In the future, he wants to expand his services by organizing events, something that would provide M. income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for entertainment business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a father of three children and he has been trained on how to grow rice by his cooperative. He has been growing rice for the past 10 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and bags.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual  labora como comerciante  para apoyar con las necesidades del hogar, ya que ellos tienen hijos que todavía van al colegio y necesitan de su apoyo , don Marcos desde hace varios años se dedica a la ebanistería , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la alza del producto ( la madera ) ya que sus clientes no le hacen muchos encargos por el precio , don Marcos le agradece Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva el apoyo que siempre le brinda para seguir trabajando ya que sin estos fondos no podría crecer como un pequeño comerciante  , donde el cual le permitió con este préstamo comprar una maquina pulidora para darle mayor presentación a su trabajo .
texts.en:
Sr. Marcos lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife with whom he works as a trader in order to meet household expenses, since they still have children going to school who are dependent on them. 

Marcos has been a carpenter for several years. His greatest difficulty is the rise in the cost of wood, since his customers do not provide much of a profit margin in the price they pay for his products. 

He is grateful to Afodenic and to Kiva for the support they always provide, which has enabled him to continue working, for without this funding he would not be able to grow as a small business. This loan will also allow him to buy a polishing machine so he can give a better finish to his work.

loans.use: to buy wood and basic material to make chairs.

loans.name: Sopp Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est formé par 12(douze)femmes qui habitent toutes le village.il existe depuis environ 5ans avec la création du banc villageois.elles pratiquent le commerce d'huile d'arachides,mil,et vendent le petit déjeuner.

la dame Seynabou,mise en médaillon sur la photo est la responsable du groupe.elle est âgée de 35 ans et mère de 04enfants.

Seynabou vend le petit déjeuner au marché. elle a une bonne expérience dans cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant longtemps.

son crédit lui permettra d'acheter des produits(sucre,lait,beurre,œufs,café etc..)pour son activité.

avec ses bénéfices ,elle aidera son mari dans les dépenses familiales. elle assurera une bonne scolarité a ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 12 women living in the same village. The group has been in existence for about five years following the creation of the Banc Villageouis. The group members sell peanut oil, millet and breakfast items.

Ms. Seynabou, whose photo also appears in a separate medallion, is the group’s leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of four.
Seynabou sells breakfast foods at the market. She has a lot of experience in this area as she has been doing it for a long time. Her loan will allow her to buy the products (sugar, milk, butter, eggs, coffee etc…) necessary for her business. Thanks to her income, she will help her husband support the family. She will take care of paying for proper school studies for her children.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, milk, butter, eggs, coffee etc for her food stand

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”PEROLNIYOC”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sofia; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad; la socia trabaja con comercio minorista, la socia acopia productos como maíz y los vende al por mayor, ella trabaja desde hace 8 años vendiendo maíz, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivos y en ellos siembra maíz, también la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia requiere el préstamo en esta ocasión para invertir en la compra de animales menores, la desea comprar cuyes para aumentar los que ya tiene, también comprara pollos para criarlos y venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores como cuyes y pollos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Sofia, 32, belongs to the “Perolniyoc” communal bank located in Urubamba District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  She has a spouse and a 10-year-old son.  She works as a retailer.  She gathers products like corn and sell it at wholesale.  She’s been selling corn for 8 years.  She has fields where she grows corn and she also raises small farm animals.  She needs the loan on this occasion to buy small farm animals.  She wants to buy guinea pigs to add to the ones she already has and will also buy chicks to raise and sell.  She’s asking for the loan to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chicks.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and his wife, Rehema, is a homemaker. He has 3 children with 2 currently enrolled in school. Samuel has operated his own vegetable kiosk for one year. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Samuel will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase vegetables and potatoes to add to his inventory. Samuel aspires to open a second kiosk to reach a larger number of customers in the future. He joined Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and potatoes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and three siblings. He has been involved in the construction field for the past six years. He works on a freelance basis and his job is specialized in floor covering.

Today, he is asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electrical generator for his business. This will help him respond rapidly for his customer’s demands and allow him to complete his tasks punctually.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical generator for his business.

loans.name: Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Akhter has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who has a business of sewing clothes. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine because his current machine doesn't produce good quality work and takes too much time to sew a single dress. The new machine will allow him to complete the orders on time and increase his profits. 

He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Akhter is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and that it will help him increase his sales and income.

Akhter is also a very talented seamstress; she sews clothes for her community clients and is an expert in ladies clothing. She is a very good housewife, too, and performs her tasks very well. 

Akhter is a new loan applicant; she hopes that it will result in good profits for her husband.

Note: In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Akhter.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg rents a booth in the city market, where he sews and sells clothing. Due to the high quality of his work, Gevorg has attracted a large number of clients. In order to maintain the high quality of his clothing, Gevorg needs to purchase a new sewing machine, as the old one doesn't sew properly anymore. With the loan, Gevorg also plans to purchase some new clothing to sell. He will develop his business and increase his working capital, allowing him to pay for his children's education and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Gevorg lives with his wife, school-age son, and two student daughters.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kulumbeni Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kulumbeni Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Agnes is the facilitator of the Kalumbeni Farmers group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Agnes takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a good maize yield harvesting 26 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Agnes will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kalumbeni Farmers group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alira

texts.es: Alira, de 58 años, es mujer amable y trabajadora. Esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive a lado de su esposo en una casa propia desde donde dieron educación a sus hijos y en donde comparte sus días a lado del hombre que le dio todo y ella ayudo en todo para progresar juntos. El trabajo de Alira consiste en la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, de manera mensual trae de la ciudad de Lima mucha variedad de prendas de vestir, acá se encarga de venderlos entre sus amigos y vecinos quienes siempre están a la expectativa de las cosas que trae ya que siempre son de muy buena calidad y están muy a la moda. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos, perfumería y otros de uso personal. Todo este trabajo lo hace en su casa y está muy contenta de ver que el negocio que empezó de a poco hace cuatro años ahora esta dando buenos resultados. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener ingresos a la economía de su hogar, además ahora no tiene que esperar de nadie para poder tener sus propios ingresos. Ahora esta muy tranquila ya que es independiente, desea mantenerse como esta yendo hasta ahora y poder seguir trabajando en busca de un mejor futuro. Este será el crédito número tres con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Esta muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mercadería en mayor cantidad, además empezará con la venta de lencería fina.
texts.en: Alira, 58, is a very friendly and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children who are grown up and independent. She lives with her husband in their own home where they educated their children and where they share their days side by side making progress together. Alira sells beauty products and clothing. Every month she brings a wide variety of garments from the city of Lima, which she then sells to her friends and neighbors who are always waiting for the things she brings since they are of high quality and stylish. She also makes a living selling beauty products like cosmetics, perfumes and other personal-use items. She does all this work from her home and is very content to see her business that she started four years ago is now showing good results. She really enjoys what she does because it allows her to add to the household finances. Now she feels very calm because she is independent and she wants to keep going and continue working in search of a better future. This will be her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to continue with her objectives. She once again promises to make her payments on time as she has done in the past. She is very content to be a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible and stick together. With the loan, she plans to purchase supplies in bulk, and she plans to start selling fine lingerie.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, lingerie and cosmetics.

loans.name: Melaria

texts.en:
Melaria is a 28 year old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling tea in buluk south Sudan for one year.
Melaria is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Crelia Gabriela

texts.es:
Crelia Gabriela tiene 53 años de estado civil Casada, vive con el esposo y el hijo de 19 años de edad, en el  Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores  de venta de comida.

Crelia Gabriela  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz , nora además se dedica a la  venta de comida en el mercado. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la agricultura comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos para tener mayor rentabilidad para su familia  y así un mejor estilo de vida.

 Le gusta salir lavar y arreglar la casa y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Crelia Gabriela, 53, has a common-law husband and a 19-year old son and all live in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The Luz Y Progresso communal bank is in the San Josè de Guayabal, area of Chillanes canton and focuses on sales of food.

Crelia Garbriela is a farmer who plants corn, and she now also sells food in the market.  She buys and sells agricultural products in Chillanes.

She will use the requested loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and urea (a fertilizer).  The loan will help her increase her earnings for her family’s use and also to invest in her business.  Her dream is to raise her income to have more financial support for her family and thus to have a better standard of living.

She likes to go out to wash and to fix up her house, and when the carnival comes.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and urea (a fertilizer)

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a thirty five year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For three years he has been operating a retail shop which has helped him to provide the basics for his family. He has a challenge due to the current hyper-inflation and his dream is to diversify and venture into farming. Patrick needs the loan facility to buy a fridge, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Allah Kandeme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ALLAH KANDEME ont en moyenne 37ans, 5enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales, des habits, du savon et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe ALLAH KANDEME sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. AICHATA, 1ère femme assise à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat du savon

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
Jealyn works hard to support her family. Jealyn is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Jealyn requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jealyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jealyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
I work in the field of pharmaceuticals, that is, pain relievers, anti-parasite medications, toothpaste, toothbrushes, hairpins, threads, needles, buttons and more. This business took many years to create. One needs to visit grocery stores and markets of the community as well as other neighborhoods. I am saving money in order to build my house and to give to my family security.

Loan Use: Buying medicines and miscellaneous products 

Me dedico a la venta de medicamentos de consumo popular, es decir analgesicos, desparacitantes, pastas dentales, cepillos de dientes, ganchos de pelo, hilos, agujas, botones y otros. Esta actividad la realizo desde hace muchos años. Visitas pulperias, mercaditos, de mi comunidades y otras vecinas. Estoy ahorrando para poder construir mi casa, y derle a mi familia la seguridad necesaria.

loans.use: Compra de medicinas de consumo popular y variedades.

loans.name: Mukhammad

texts.en:
Mukhammad has a small store where he sells spare parts. He is a very kind, friendly and hard working person. He has had his business for 4 years ago and it allows him to support his family. He is 28 years old. Mukhammad is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. 

He applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy the spare parts. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel decided to become independent so she installed a salon in one of the rooms of hour home. Thanks to her good work and charisma she's been able to maintain her clients. "Thank God I'm lucky with people and they keep recommending me. What I need is more furniture and equipment for the salon, I'd like your help with a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Isabel decidió independizarse e instaló su estética en un cuarto de su casa, gracias a su buena mano y carisma pudo mantener su clientela. "Gracias a dios tengo mucha suerte con la gente y me siguen recomendando, lo que me está haciendo falta es mas mobiliario y equipo de trabajo quisiera que me ayudaran con $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: To buy furniture and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Laura Susana

texts.es:
Laura started her business eight years ago. She is married and her husband works as a taxi driver, her daughter is 12 years old and is in secondary school. Laura started her business to collaborate with her husband in covering the family's expenses, since his salary was not sufficient to support the family and, with their daughter growing up, the needed to offer her education. With the passage of time, she identified her market and decided to sell children's shoes. Before this she sold clothing, but with this business things have gone better and she has more and more customers.

Laura is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to buy merchandise, since in this season her sales increase because it is the time for children's graduations. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family thank you very much for the support you offer them in continuing with this business and getting ahead.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Laura inició su negocio hace ocho años atrás, ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como taxista, su hija tiene 12 años de edad y esta cursando la secundaria, Laura empezó su negocio para colaborar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ya que el sueldo de él no era suficiente para mantener a su familia y con su hija creciendo tenía que brindarle educación. Con el paso del tiempo, ella fue identificando su mercado y decidió vender zapatos para niños, antes de esto ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pero con este negocio le comenzó a ir mejor y a tener cada vez más clientes.

Laura está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería ya que en esta temporada sus ventas se incrementan por que es época de graduaciones de los niños, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindes para continuar con su negocio y poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie K. is forty-nine yearsold and married with four children.  She runs a business of selling utensils and her business is the only source of income for the family. Amie said that, with her previous loan she was able to increase her income and the family's livelihood has improved.  She can now buy half a bag of rice a month for the family.  Amie still wants to expand her business and extend the service to nearby villages.  Her husband will assist her to carry her business to village markets.

loans.use: Increase her business by offering more types of utensils for sale.

loans.name: Tapuni

texts.en: Tapuni is 31 year old married woman with children. Her business is making and selling banana chips at her own village and shops in town and she earns $150.00-$200.00 a day.  Her first loan used to help out with her business and her family expenditures.  She is also applying for another loan to fix the floor of her house that she uses for the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her banana chips shop and to fix the floor of her house

loans.name: Yasenem

texts.ru:
Mrs. Yasenem K. lives in a village near Saatli, Azerbaijan. She is 42, married and has 2 children. She and her brother (see photo) have an electronics store. The business goes well and Mrs. K. wants to expand it. To finance the expansion, she applied for a loan from NorMicro, a Kiva partner.
