Posseh has been selling palm oil, rice, groundnuts, etc., and has been running this businessman for two years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, groundnuts, etc., in large quantity.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. has been running a salon in Olekuitoriori;Kitengela town for 12 years with a profit margin of KES.4,000 a month. She is married to Enock S. who is a farmer, and she is a mother of four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff and she is applying for her first loan to buy seats for the salon. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children.

In the future Josephine plans to grow her business and start a hair dressing school.

loans.use: to buy seats for her salon.

loans.name: Woza Group

texts.en:
Nelisiwe is 43 years old and widowed with five children between the ages of 15 and 26 years old. She also cares for two grandchildren. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is standing on the far left raising her hand.

Nelisiwe's been in business for six years selling chicken, fruit and chips. She says that the challenge to her business is having customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. Nelisiwe requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy chickens, chips and fruit. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her generate profits and will help her take care of her children. 

In the future, she would like to see her business grow and to have other products to sell and a shelter to sell in. Through WDB she has managed to put her children through higher education, which is expensive, and she will be able to change the style of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens, fruits and chips.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vehicle-washing items for service station.

loans.name: Horoldavaa

texts.en:
Horoldavaa is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, or Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai, a province of Mongolia. His two children who haven't reached school age stay home. He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to buy a car with my earnings."

Horoldavaa manages a cell phone repair business that he established in 2005 in his town. Now he has many regular customers and is planning to continue his business. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phone parts.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone parts.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 52 años es un hombre de naturaleza empresarial, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 17 a 23 años de edad. Desde su adolescencia se movió en el ámbito comercial vendiendo pasabocas y en general mercáncias que le pedían sus pocos clientes, así realizó sus primeros intentos de negocio  y hoy en día vive de la actividad comercial pues vende productos alimenticios, cosméticos, útiles de aseo y variedades, mediante los sistemas de crédito y contado, durante 7 horas diarias; su mayor desafío es ampliar su capital de trabajo para aumentar sus ventas y comprar productos en ofertas para obtener precios que le permitan ahorrar en sus compras. Sus clientes son personas que hacen énfasis en el cuidado de su salud y aunque  Jorge ofrece productos de gran competencia en el mercado, se sostiene por la calidad en su atención y por el cumplimiento en sus pedidos, porque tiene el cuidado de ser oportuno. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará productos naturales y cosméticos para responder a pedidos  que han hecho sus clientes, lo cual garantiza su éxito en la inversión, porque conoce muy bien su mercado y tiene como meta ayudar a mucha gente a cuidar su salud, mediante medidas preventivas, basadas en la sana alimentación y n la complementación de los elementos en los que presente deficiencia el organismo y que justamente integran su oferta.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old.  He is a man to whom business comes naturally.  He lives with his wife and three children who are aged between 17 and 23.

Jorge has been working in commerce since he was a teenager, selling snacks and general merchandise that his few customers ordered from him.  These were his first attempts at business.  Today he lives off his commercial activity as he sells food products, cosmetics, personal care products and a range of other products.  He makes his sales, for cash and on credit, for seven hours every day.  His biggest challenge is expanding his working capital so that he can increase his sales and buy products that are on offer so that he can obtain better prices which will allow him to save money when he makes his purchases.

Jorge's customers are people who place a lot of importance on looking after their health and, although Jorge sells products that are offered by many competitors in the market, he keeps his business running because of the quality of his customer service and because he ensures that he fills his orders in a timely manner.

This Kiva loan is Jorge's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy natural products and cosmetics to fill some orders that his customers have made.  This will guarantee that the investment is successful.  Jorge knows his market very well and his goal is to help a lot of people look after their health, through preventive measures, based on healthy eating and supplementing the elements that their bodies lack.

loans.use: to buy natural products and cosmetics

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en: Norlita is 42 years old and married, with 7 children. She has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut. Norlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a widow with one child. She runs a small business in the central city market selling kid’s clothing. Her vending spot is well known for her wide variety of inventory. The assorted clothing items Dilbar offers for sale in her kiosk are in high demand among her customers. Dilbar has been in this trade for 10 years. Dilbar’s hard work, plain and simple, is the engine that drives her success. She is very consistent in her business planning. Now she is requesting a loan of 9,500 Somoni to increase her assorted merchandise in a recently opened vending location and to expand her trade. One of Dilbar’s long-term plans is to launch her own start-up manufacturing and selling clothing and increase her stock turnover as a result. 
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cutting machines and materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school and one who is still too young. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past year, Mary has operated a business trading cows at the market to cow brokers. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase four cows. In the future, she dreams of establishing a butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase four cows

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old. She is divorced and has a 31-year-old daughter. Alice is living with three additional dependents who are relatives; they help her with her business. 

In 2003, Alice established a business selling plastic bowls, buckets, and dishes. Alice started this business because she wanted to get a means of livelihood for her family. Alice earns about 1,000,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

Alice has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more of the products she sells. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profit by 300,000 SLL. 

In the future Alice plans to open a big shop in the city center where she will be sure to get high sales. She also plans to educate her dependents to the level they wish to attain and build a house. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic bowls, buckets, and dishes for her business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children; two attend school while two are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of high cost of transportation for her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Eutemia tiene 57 años D. edad  es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos, los cuales sigue apoyando 02 D. ellos ya que están en etapa escolar, Eutemia en el transcurso D. su vida se ha dedicado a distintas actividades comerciales, es por ello que  con el fin D. seguir superándose decidió estudiar repostería, con los conocimientos que adquirió deciD. iniciar su propio negocio D. ventas D. postres actualmente ella prepara kekes, empanadas, tortas en otras delicias, donD. luego las ofrece en colegio y tiendas,  gracias a su arduo trabajo a logrado comprarse una moto la cual lo trabaja uno D. sus hijos, también nos manifiesta que realiza tejidos D. chompas, chalinas, etc. donD. genera un ingreso mas para su hogar. Uno D. sus planes D. Eutemia para el futuro es D. instalar una  panadería en su domicilio donD. pueda ofrecer todo tipos D. postres. Con el crédito que solicito piensa invertir en su negocio D. repostería comprando harina, azúcar, huevo, leche, entre otros insumos, ya que tiene pedidos que entregar. Eutemia es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe” grupo que está conformado por 10 personas trabajadores y responsables ya que no han tenido problemas con su pago, ellos se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Eutemia, 57, has a spouse and five children.  Two of them are still in school and dependent on her.  Throughout her life, Eutemia has been engaged in a variety of commercial activities.  Because of this, in order to continue to improve herself, she decided to study pastry making.  With the skills she obtained she decided to start her own business selling desserts.  She currently makes cakes, turnovers, tarts and other delicacies that she then sells to schools and stores.  Thanks to her hard work she was able to buy a motorcycle that one of her sons works.  She tells us that she also knits sweaters, shawls, etc. to generate a little extra income for her home.

One of Eutemia’s plans for the future is to set up a bakery at home where she can sell all sorts of desserts.  She plans to use the requested loan to invest in her pastry business buying flour, sugar, eggs and milk, among other ingredients because she has orders to fill.

Eutemia is a member of the “Virgen D. Guadalupe” communal bank which has 10 hardworking, responsible members who have had no repayment problems.  They commit to continue to work well with the Prosperidad Program.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Doña Irma es una señora con 65 años de edad. Casada y vive con su esposo y un nieto (grandchild). Tiene deseos de superación y por eso trabaja mucho. Es clienta de la Fundación hace varios años y actualmente con los ingresos de su negocio le ayuda a una hija a pagar los estudios universitarios, la cual ya está terminando la licenciatura. Debido a eso, ella busca financiamiento para aumentar sus ventas y no dejar de ayudarle a su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas en las toma de decisiones. Siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de productos omnilife y angelísima, los cuales tiene mucha salida al mercado por ser tan buenos para la salud.
texts.en: Irma is 65 years old. She is married and she lives with her husband and her grandchild. She wants to improve in life and she works hard for this reason. She has been a client of Fundación Mujer for many years. One of her daughters is completing her university studies, and with the money Irma earns from her activity she is helping her daughter paying for university fees. This is why she is requesting a loan: she wants to increase her sales volume in order to continue helping her family. She counts on her daughters’ support in taking decisions. She has always been engaged in selling Omnilife and Angelísima products, two brands of very good health products that sell very well.

loans.use: To buy Omnilife and Angelísima products and then sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nansalmaa, age 52, sells building materials in the market called Bumbat. She has been running her business for three years and is always trying to expand it. Nansalmaa is a very hardworking woman for her family and life. She lives with her daughter and husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Already she has her own permanent customers and they are always satisfied with what they buy from her. Also she creates financial reports of her companies when she has days off. Now she needs some money to purchase a large number of building materials from her suppliers to increase her working capital. It is beneficial to her business activity and income.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of building materials from her suppliers to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben has been managing his corn field patiently to earn a living. He has had this kind of business for almost 12 years. He is 39 years old, married and has been blessed with six children.

Ben aims to improve their living situation and to educate his six children but due to shortage of capital he couldn't find ways to start improving his business. With his situation nowadays, he is encouraged to join the program suited for his farming business. Ben is requesting additional loan in the amount of P27,000 to be used in be use in acquiring farm inputs needed in his corn farming business. He believes that through the additional capital and full-time management of the corn field, his yields will increase and he would be able to sell his crops at a higher price which will give him the hope to educate all his children and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to be use in acquiring farm inputs needed in his corn farming business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She is a farmer. When available from the rice field, she raises pigs and ducks at home to earn her living. Her husband is a cameraman and a motor-taxi driver. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Lim is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his motor-taxi business more efficiently. By doing so, she will enable her husband to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Lim's husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is engaged in agriculture. Unable to find sufficient financial means to develop the business, Heghine has applied for a loan. With the requested loan, Heghine plans to purchase livestock and seeds. With the help of this loan, Heghine expects to increase her income, which will allow her to expand her farm in the future. 

Additional income also means improved living conditions for Heghine and her family. Heghine lives with her husbund, a child and her father.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and seeds

loans.name: Miyoke A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Miyoke A Group in Western Kenya! Jane is the facilitator of the Miyoke A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest 7 1/2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Miyoke A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Jane with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es: Jorge Eduardo, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y 5 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su siembra de maíz, el comprara abonos, fungicidas y herbicidas para mantener su cultivo. El cuenta con la siembra ya establecida en muy buenas calidades y lo que quiere es obtener de ella los mejores resultados. El con la venta del maíz producido pretende generar el máximo de ganancias para seguir adelante  con las responsabilidades del hogar y mejorar cada día su bienestar económico.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge Eduardo is 46 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and their five children, who are his top priority.  

With this loan he will purchase products to help with his corn crop such as fertilizer, fungicides and herbicides to maintain his crop.  His crop is well established and he wants is to get better results from it.  He hopes to sell his corn for the maximum profit in order to meet his responsibilities at home and improve his financial well-being each day.  This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan with other banks, but FEDECOSUR has provided a loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help him sow corn.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 31 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. Romeo sell boutique items (rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, body lotion, cooking oil, etc). His business is well organized. He starts from 7am until 5pm every day and has two years of experience.

Romeo has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more cooking oil, body lotion, rice, sugar and so on to sell. With this profit from the loan, he will reinvest in his business and save money for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, body lotion, etc.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El señor Eugenio es cliente antiguo y desea crédito por segunda vez se dedica a la venta de ropa para su nueva tienda en la ciudad de el Alto vive con sus  hijos, pero su esposa se encuentra de viaje por motivos de trabajo no por mucho tiempo. El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería por mayor para la compra de ropa, el sr. Eugenio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que le dan la oportunidad de salir adelante,  crecer en su negocio ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para sustentarse.
texts.en:
Eugenio is an established client who is asking for a loan for the second time. He works selling clothing for his new store in the city of Alto. He lives with his children, and his wife occasionally travels for work reasons. 

This loan will be used to buy clothing at wholesale prices. He feels very happy and grateful for the opportunity that is given, having the opportunity to get ahead, and to grow the business as this is the only activity that he has to support himself.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Agée de 39 ans, ÉDITH est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille  polygame dans la ville  de Koutiala. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire une longue étude, EDITH s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à 15 ans, telles l’achat vente de condiments, la petite restauration( vente de brochettes de bœuf.), etc. 
Dans le souci de remédier aux ruptures qu’elle subit régulièrement et qui la fait perdre la clientèle, ÉDITH  décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elle est à son 3ème prêt et les 2  précédents ont été bien remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, différentes sortes de condiments: poivres, sel de cuisine, Sounbala, légumes, huile, gombo séché et des poissons séché et fumé. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et effectue sa vente à son domicile  à une clientèle de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA, qu’elle envisage  utiliser  pour payer les  intérêts du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité. 
EDITH  ambitionne de devenir grossiste de condiments au grand marché de Koutiala. .

loans.use: Achat de condiments

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a cacao farmer in San Jose. Juan, aged 62, and his wife Damiana brought up seven children, five of who have set up cacao farms close to their parents’ land. Juan, a cacao farmer of 30 years, has been acting as a certain hub for his kids’ entrepreneurial activity revolving around cacao by passing down know-how and an example of how cacao farming can be instrumental to sustaining a family. 

Juan is very diligent with maintenance of his cacao farm, which results in increasing yields. Cacao farms are literally in the middle of the jungle, as they require shade and nutrients from timber trees to keep producing cacao for many decades, making cleaning necessary every three to four months. Moreover, cleaning makes for easier access to trees and helps fight fungal diseases that spread through the pores in cacao pods. 

Maya Mountain Cacao’s buying day in San Jose is Sunday. The sight of the long trail leading to the road from their farms, when Juan and his sons descend from their farms with full buckets of wet cacao, is nothing short of extraordinary.  “I depend on cacao, it gives me some income – not much, but it helps,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. In the future, Juan hopes to plant more trees in his own farm to have more income for his wife and himself. Like many farmers in San Jose, Juan is bilingual and speaks Mopan Maya as well as English.

loans.use: To invest in cleaning his 2 acres and helping his sons clean their plots.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 74 years old and widowed with six children.  She does crop farming to earn a living.  She also owns a retail shop where she earns extra income.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because she has been trained on business management skills.
Her desire is to practice large-scale farming for more income generation in the future. She needs a loan of 53, 156 KES to buy fertilizer, seedlings and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer,seedlings and farm inputs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55-years-old and married with nine children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods like rice, snack foods and other groceries.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like rice, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Gnima's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes d’un engagement sans faille après plus de quatre années elles sont encore dans le programme voyant que c’est un atout pour les permettre à changer leurs conditions de vie. Elles sont très solidaires entre elles et vivent dans le même village depuis des années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce qui est accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Gnima (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants  (04 garçons et 04 filles).Elle vend dans sa maison au village divers produits à savoir le sucre, le thé vert, le savon de fabrication traditionnelle. Elle achète sa marchandise au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité   pour la revente dans son village et environ. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires environnants pour revendre en détaille dans sa cantine.
-	Pour 01sacs de sucre de 17 500F Cfa 
-	Pour un carton de 10 paquets de thé vert 
-	Et un carton de savon d’une cinquantaine de morceaux

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et surtout de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women with unwavering commitment. After four years, they are still in the program. They see how it is helping them change their living conditions. They have lived in the same village for many years, and share a sense of solidarity. The group members work primarily in small-scale commerce and rain-fed agriculture.

Gnima (who is seated on the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is 50 years old, married, and a mother of eight children (four boys and four girls). She works selling various goods from her home and in the market, such as sugar, green tea, and soap made the traditional way. She buys her goods from the weekly markets in her area and resells them in her village and surrounds. She has a good experience with this business.

With this loan, she plans to buy one sac of sugar at 17,500 francs CFA, one carton of ten packets of green tea, and one carton of fifty soaps.

Earnings will allow her to take care of her family's daily expenses, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, green tea, and soap

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités  d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales, des habits et de la boisson.
 Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 11ème prêt solidaire. MARIAM, 1ère  femme debout à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  700Kgs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat  des céréales

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina con 36 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como: aves de corral ,porcinos, caprinos y ovinos, la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos en el interior de su vivienda. De esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.

Agustina es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para realizar arreglos en el interior de su vivienda.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz G., born in Bahia de Caráquez, has lived in Guayaquil, Ecuador for 10 years now with her parents and brothers. She is 44 years old and has two children. Luz’s business sells household items and candy, and it is run out of her house. She has been in business for 15 years and works from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm. When her husband is not driving his taxi, he helps out with the business. Luz would like an $800 loan so that she can buy a display case and buy products that her clientele requests. Ms. G. and her husband demonstrated that they can run an efficient business and that they have a proper understanding of financial management. Luz reports that she does not want to be forced to borrow from a loan shark because they charge outrageous interest rates and impede the progress of her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for household item market

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city, has 3 children. This 46-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 8 years. Ofelia sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. 
Now she needs a loan amount of $2000 to be busy with selling the street clothes and industrial goods.

loans.use: To be busy with selling the street clothes and industrial goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase resources needed to expand her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her onion business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu B. is forty years old and married with four children. She sells fish in the open-air market in Magburaka. She also takes her business to the village market on special days.

Kadiatu's previous loan enabled her to buy two baskets of fish at a time, thus increasing her profit. As she will complete her previous loan repayments in August, she would like to take out another loan to further expand her micro-business.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell in the village market

loans.name: Tiomai

texts.en: Tiomai F. is 47 years of age and has four children.  Along with her husband, they want a better future for their children.  They work hard on maintaining their vegetable garden so that they can sell its fruits in the market. According to Tiomai, S.P.B.D. arrived in her life at the right time, when she really needed the help financially. It is through the S.P.B.D loan that has allowed her to buy the materials she needed in order to run her business smoothly. Nowadays, she’s able to manage her family needs and also make her weekly loan payment.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, cloves, crowbars, baskets,  and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Tzetzka

texts.en: Tzetzka K. is registered as a private agricultural producer and breeds eight cows. She is married, and her husband works as a molder. They live in a house in the village of Medkovetz. Their two kids are grown and live separately.  Tzetzka K. needs to buy one more cow and is applying for a $775 loan.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is in her late thirties and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She makes a living in two ways: selling new and used clothing to the women of her community, and preparing lunches that she sells from her house.  Eugenia sells clothing by walking up and down the streets of her community to see if anyone would like to make a purchase. She leaves early in the morning and returns at about 11 o’clock to begin preparing lunches with the help of a young assistant. Eugenia has applied for a loan to buy clothing in bulk and ingredients she uses to prepare and sell her delicious food.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to sell in her community, and to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Ahammd Zalghy

texts.en: Ahammd Zalghy lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 2 sons. He lives with his own family. He is a tailor and he started this business when he was in Pakistan 7 years ago. He is a good tailor; he has lots of clients. He wants to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to buy new sewing machines and complete his stock so that he can make a good income. Ahammd is happy with this process of loans that helps poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
Kumri A. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 49 years old, married and has 7 children. Kumri has a high school diploma. She takes care of the house and her business is cattle rearing. Kumri has a cow; the milk from this cow is used for the family and also for sale. She sells milk at a market to whole sale buyers. Kumri plans to purchase one more cow in order to increase the volume of milk, thereby increasing her profits. If there is additional milk, Kumri would be able to sell more and receive greater income. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Алиева Кумри жительница города Яван. Возраст 49 лет ,замужем имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка занимается животноводством. имеет корову, молоко которой использует для семьи и на продажу. Продает молоко на рынке оптовым покупателям. планирует купить еще одну корову для того чтобы увеличить объем получаемого молока, тем самым увеличив свои доходы. то есть если у нее будет дополнительное молоко она сможет продавать больше и получать больший доход. погасить кредитклиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is 45 years old and is married with 5 children. He grows peanuts and pigeon peas.  Because of a previous loan from SMT, he was able to harvest 8 bags of peanuts and peas, whereas he could only harvest 2 bags of peanuts and peas before he received the loan.  Abubakar would like to improve his farm to generate additional income so that he can pay for his children’s future college expenses.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to hire labourers and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To improve his farm by purchasing fertilizer for his crops and by hiring labourers to harvest such crops.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the coordinator of a recently created group of five women - all mothers with families that live in the low-income Cruce MeL. community of Yamasá.

Elizabeth has two daughters aged two and four. She explains that her husband works part-time as a heavy truck driver for a company but he doesn’t earn enough money to cover all of the family’s expenses.

Elizabeth plans on using her loan to buy men’s and women’s clothing to resell in the community. She says that she’ll travel to Santo Domingo, the capital, to get the goods at very low prices so that her business will be profitable. Elizabeth says that she’ll put her best foot forward to make her business successful and be able to repay the loan.

Elizabeth has requested a loan together with the following women:

Rosa J., who will prepare homemaD. food to sell in the neighborhood.

Andrea L. F., who wants to start selling women’s clothing.

Florinda M. will buy men’s clothing to sell in the community.

Sandra Margarita C. S. hopes to open a small grocery store

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing to start a small business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina T. is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and has a child who is currently in senior high school. Sabina operates a clothing store in the community market. She sells male and female clothes, including jeans, shirts, skirts and tops. Sabina currently needs a loan to be able to increase her supplies of male and female clothes and thereby expand her business. With increased income, Sabina hopes to be able to finance her child’s education at a university. She is a member of a loan group called Decency Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of male and female clothes

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Sophie V. was born around 1977 in the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Moïse Zabada, who works as a driver of vehicles of category B. She has 3 children, Juliette, Obidole and Arnaud, all three of which are going to school and are dependent on the parents.For about 10 years now Sophie has been selling women's clothing and various other goods in Kowebo, one of the most popular parts of Cotonou. This is the third loan for Sophie. She has successfully paid off her previous loans. Currently she needs a loan to purchase more goods in order to satisfy the demand of her clients as well as increase the variety of goods she has for sale. She would like to start selling baskets, jewlery and other items. 

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1977 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame V. Sophie est mariée à ZABADA Moïse conducteur de véhicule catégorie B dans un projet et mère de 3 enfants dont Juliette, Obidole et Arnaud tous scolarisés et à la charge de leurs géniteurs. Installée  à KOWEGBO l’un des quartiers les plus populaires de la ville de COTONOU depuis une dizaine d’années où elle exerce son activité de vente de vêtements de femmes   et  des produits divers. Dame V. Sophie est à son troisième crédit et s’est toujours montrée crédible. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité à d’autres produits tels que les pagnes, les bijoux et autres.

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of biscuits and 72 dresses.

loans.name: Solema

texts.es:
Solema is a woman who works raising livestock. She developed this skill as a child alongside her parents, and now it helps her meet household expenses. Solema raises her animals with great dedication in order to later sell their meat in town. She also meets certain special requests that she receives from the city, and these offer her the best income. In order to be sure of good earnings, since she is aware that the cost of living is increasing, Solema wants to acquire a few more animals in order to increase her income and the amount of her livestock. In order to accomplish this she needs a sum of 1300 soles ($475 US), money that she hopes you will be able to help loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Solema es una mujer que trabaja criando su ganado, actividad que desde muy pequeña desarrolló junto a sus padres, y que ahora le ayuda con los gastos de su hogar. Solema cría sus animales con mucha dedicación para luego vender su carne en el pueblo, también atiende algunos pedidos especiales que le hacen para la ciudad, siendo estos los mejores ganancias le traen.Para asegurar buenas ganancias, ya que entiende que el costo de vida va en aumento, Solema desea adquirir un par de animales más para incrementar sus ingresos y la cantidad de su ganado. Para ello necesita la suma de 1300 soles, dinero que espera usted le pueda prestar.

loans.use: To purchase livestock in order to increase earnings

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela belongs to the Enterprising Women Community Bank and lives in San Martín, Peru. She makes a living selling and distributing beauty products and also takes products in bad shape and repackages them, all of which she does out of her home. She has contacts around the city and the surrounding towns with people to sell these products. She started this job because of the need to generate her own income to provide for her two daughters since she is a single mother. For this work she needs to have capital, mainly to invest in the gasoline for the delivery of her products, money she later recuperates when the products are sold. She is requesting the $275 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, for this purpose. She will also invest in labor for delivering the beauty products, as well as buying product wholesale. Thanks to her transparency, responsibility and punctuality the company continues to have confidence in her.

Carmela is 54 years old and has two daughters her help her with her work. Her goal is for her youngest daughter to finish her professional degree and to have her own delivery force of two vans and two motorcycles.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmela pertenece al Banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (ESIKA) y a través de su Servis al Reparto de estos productos y recojo de los Productos en mal estado, funciona en su propia casa situada en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Nº 1270, cuenta con personal contratado para el reparto de las cajas alrededor de la ciudad y pueblos aledaños donde se encuentran las promotoras que venden dicho producto. Ella empezó en este trabajo ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijas ya que es madre soltera, para este trabajo necesita contar con un capital sobre todo para la gasolina de las motos por que primero invierte y luego recupera, y es para esto que ella usa el préstamo. El préstamo de S/.800.00 que lo cancelará en 6 meses, invertirá en mano de obra del negocio de reparto de productos de belleza, así como también en productos para luego venderlos, gracias a su transparencia, responsabilidad y puntualidad la empresa sigue confiando en ella. Tiene 54 años y 2 hijas mujeres que también le apoyan en esta actividad, su meta es que su hija menor termine su carrera profesional y tener su propia movilidad 2 combis y 2 moto taxis.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies and finance distribution / Compra de productos de belleza.  Pago a trabajadores (distribuidores),.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Dame L. Justine  est née le 26/08/1963 à Pahou et mariée à MITO Cosme agent comptable à ECDRA une Société privée de la place. Le couple a à sa charge quatre  enfants tous scolarisés. Dame L. Justine réside au quartier Ayélawadjè depuis bientôt 6 mois avec son époux. Elle mène depuis plus de 5 ans la vente des produits vivriers. Elle les vend par le système de distribution mais aussi à domicile devant sa maison. Actuellement elle a construit une boutique qui lui servira de lieu de stockage et d’activité. Elle a démarré ladite activité vers les années 2003 avec un fonds de démarrage de 80000 F CFA. Confrontée au problème d‘approvisionnement quelques mois après elle a eu recours au financement extérieur. C’est ainsi qu'elle obtient son premier crédit le 25/10/2004 d’un montant de 50000 F CFA qui lui a permis de commencer par acheter en gros. Elle vient solliciter pour son cinquième prêt de 250000 F CFA pour s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
Ms. Justine L. was born on August 26, 1963 in Pahou and is married to Cosme MITO, an accounting representative at ECDRA, a local private company. The couple have in their care four children, who are all in school. Ms. Justine L. has been residing with her husband in the Ayélawadjè district for almost six months. She has been selling staple foods for over five years, making sales through a distribution system but also out of the front of her house. Currently, she has built a shop that will serve as a storehouse and place of business. She started the aforementioned business around 2003 with start-up funds of 80,000 francs CFA. Confronted with the problem of inventory and supplies a few months afterwards, she turned to outside financing. This is why she obtained her first loan on October 25, 2004 in the amount of 50,000 francs, which enabled her to start buying in bulk. She has come to request as her fifth loan 250,000 francs for acquiring supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten 50-kg sacks of corn, five 30-kg sacks of rice, and the remainder for other staple foods

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Auroras En Acción, tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la manzana A lote 15D del sector Luis Alberto Sánchez del Pueblo Joven Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de  Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer año de secundaria y ya no pudo continuar estudiando por falta de medios económicas. Después de un tiempo se casó con Mauro Teque y tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella.
Recuerda que empezó vendiendo en un coche de bebe, donde colocaba su caja plástica para marcianos y vendía por donde se podía ir, luego cambió el cochecito de bebé por un triciclo y ella se trasladaba para poder realizar su negocio. Ahora tiene un puesto de madera rodante donde vende sus productos diversos.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en gaseosa y pasteles.
Con este crédito de 400 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, incrementará su negocio comprando gaseosa y golosinas.
Cristina sueña con crear una empresa muy grande para dar empleo a mucha gente que lo requiera.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel Cristina belongs to the Las Auroras En Acción Community Bank. She is 35 years old and lives in the Block A, Lot 15D of the area of Luis Alberto Sánchez, in the town of Joven Aurora Díaz, Salaverry, Trujillo in La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the third year of high school and could not continue her education because of a lack of financial means. After some time, she married Mauro Teque. She has 3 children that still depend on her. She remembers that she began selling in a baby carriage, where she put her plastic box for her products and sold them wherever she went. Later, she replaced the baby carriage for a tricycle, and she went forward in being able to carry out her business. Now she has a wooden, rolling stall where she sells her diverse products. She repaid her first loan of 300 soles in 4 installments. She invested it in soda and sweets. With this loan of 400 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will grow her business by buying soda and sweets. Cristina dreams of creating a very large enterprise that can employ many people who need jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soda and sweets

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Rorn N. is a 36-year-old villager who lives with her husband, Mr. Chhoem Chantha, in Pak Bang Ong village, Takeo Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Sa Rorn N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice, while her husband is a layman who arranges ceremonies in the Buddhist monastery. They have five children, one of whom is a construction worker; the others attend the local school. 

The family income is not enough to support them, and so Mrs. Sa Rorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow to start new business.

loans.use: To buy cow for breeding.

loans.name: I Ketut Jiwa

texts.id:
I Ketut Jiwa tinggal didesa Manistutu, Bali Barat. Lokasi desa ini berada di lereng gunung, sehingga untuk pengairan, baik untuk perkebunan atau untuk kepentingan rumah tangga cukup sulit untuk didapat. Pengairan hanya mengandalkan sungai kecil yang mengalir didesanya yang airnya akan cukup apabila datang musim hujan. Karena air yang sulit didapat, I Ketut Jiwa tidak bisa bercocok tanam atau mengolah persawahan. I Jiwa menanami kebunnya dengan pohon jagung.
Namun karena kurangnya pupuk dan bibit yang berkwalitas, I Ketut Jiwa seringkali tidak mendapat hasil yang maksimal dari kebunnya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Ketut Jiwa berencana untuk membeli pupuk dan bibit jagung berkwalitas sehingga kebunnya bisa mendapatkan hasil yang maksimal.
texts.en:
I Ketut Jiwa live in the village of Manistutu, West Bali. This village is located on a hillside, so for irrigation, sufficient for plantation or for household is difficult to be adequate. Irrigation is only dependant on the small stream flowing through the village where the water is only sufficient during the rainy season. Due to the insufficient water supply, I Ketut Jiwa cannot grow plant or cultivate rice. I Ketut Jiwa plant his farm with corn. And with inadequate fertilizer and quality seedlings, I Ketut Jiwa often did generate maximum yield from his plantation. With this loan received, I Ketut Jiwa planned to purchase fertilizer and quality corn seedlings so that his plantation generate maximum yield.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn seedlings, fertilizer and pesticide (Bibit jagung, pupuk dan anti hama)

loans.name: Silomiga

texts.en: Silomiga T., 44, is married and has four children.  She has many years experience in the fishing business. She sells to the passby traffic seven days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD and she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (333 USD).  SPBD loans are Silomiga’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a fishing net, fishing equipment and a torch. Her husband and son are giving their full support to the business.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net, spear, torch

loans.name: Karamatullo

texts.en:
Karamatullo is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily sheep, which he buys and sells in commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he has enjoyed since he was a young boy. Nevertheless he also has other jobs, and one of those is farming potatoes and corn in their respective seasons, taking in to account the bad weather that could damage his products. He requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his sheep. His goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income, and to be solvent in order to continue buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak L., 54, is married and lives with her husband in the Battambang province. She works in a grocery store, earning around US$5 every day. Her husband is a soldier and makes US$1.50 per day. They also get income from their child who works as a motor-taxi driver.

Mrs. Kak L. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Haydee De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Joven Hydee de los Ángeles M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Hydee es la venta de películas y comida. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y en un pequeño establecimiento exhibe sus productos el desafío que ha tenido que atravesar con su negocio es  la competencia con los otros establecimientos. Los propósitos de Doña Hydee son de obtener mas mercadería ya que así podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que ya que invertirá en la compra de videos, películas y granos básicos. Sus deseos son de proporciónale mejoras a su establecimiento ya que no presenta las condiciones adecuadas para sus clientes. La cantidad es de C$ 3.500 crodobas.
texts.en:
Young Hydee de los Ángeles M. is 58 years of age and is single. Ms. Hydee works selling movies and food. She has worked in this business for more than 10 years and in a small stand she exhibits her products. The challenge she has had to overcome with her business is competition with other establishments. Ms. Hydee's goals are to obtain more merchandise to be able to offer her customers what they request. The loan is for business capital that will be invested in the purchase of videos, movies, and basic grains. She desires to gradually improve her establishment since the current conditions are not suitable for her customers. The amount she is requesting is 3,500 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy capital

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas A. is thirty-five years old. He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in junior high and basic school. Thomas says that, as a family man, it is necessary for him to work very hard to make enough income to meet the family’s expenditures. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

He owns a corn milling machine in his locality. Thomas says that he also runs a cassava mill in addition to the corn milling machine. He sells his services to all, but especially to food vendors who need to have some of their products, such as maize, cassava, roasted groundnut, and vegetables, ground before they prepare their meals.

Thomas says he doesn't have a vegetable milling machine at the moment, so wants a loan to acquire one. Thomas has been running this business for three years.

loans.use: To expand corn milling business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 39 years old and is married with two children. She sells daily provisions, such as toothpaste, milk, and detergent. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions for sale. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Thilo

texts.fr: THILO B. EST NEE LE 26 JUIN 1967 A THIES .ELLE EST MARIEE ET FAIT DU COMMERCE DEPUIS LONGTEMPS.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET POUR ALLER ACHETER DES BOLS ,des tissus et des draps à ROSSO.CELA LUI PERMETTRA d'augmenter son stock de marchandises et d'améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Thilo B. was born on June 26, 1967 in THIES. She is married and has been working in commerce for a long time. She's requesting this loan to buy bowls, cloth, and bed sheets in ROSSO. This will enable her to augment her stock of merchandise and to improve her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Lip's Group

texts.en:
The five people requesting this small loan are all residents of the province of Battambang. The members have selected Mrs. Lip A., 56, to be the group leader. 

Lip A. sells kitchen materials in the busy local market. She has run this business for years and currently earns approximately $4 each day. Her husband earns a living selling fake jewelry. They have six children, all teenagers and under their care. Lip A.'s business is going very well and gaining much income. To make her business more successful, she is applying for a loan for capital to order additional kitchen materials to sell. 

Four other borrowers have joined this loan as follows:
M. is a used clothe seller. She will use the loan to increase her stock of used clothes to sell.

P. is a used clothes seller, who will expand her business.

P. is a local fruit seller who will buy more kinds of fruits to sell.

T. sells burnable rubber in the market. She will use her loan as capital for her business actions.

loans.use: To order additional kitchen materials to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice B. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has two school-aged children. Janice owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily buying and selling dried fish and Avon products. Janice has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month She has frequent customers who buy her products. Janice serves as bread-winner to her family. She works hard for the future of her two children. In 2008, Janice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Janice has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Janice is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Raufjon

texts.en:
Raufjon K. is a successful entrepreneur, father, and dedicated husband. He has two children who give him the strength to work hard. Raufjon opened a small grocery store 8 years ago with a small amount of savings for capital. He was assisted by his wife who helps him to serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown larger and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of $ 900 USD so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Raufjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food to increase the variety in his store

loans.name: Abdul Akbar

texts.en:
Abdul Akbar lives in Jalalabad, in Nangrahar province. He is married and has four children. He has been in the agriculture business for more than 6 years and he wants to make his business expand. He needs more money for his business capital to get a good monthly income and to better help his family. 

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani. He wants to expand and move his business forward, buying some necessary materials and completing his stock for his land so he can start working even harder. So Abdul Akbar is very happy with this process of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan and wants to thank those involved, especially Kiva and all lenders around the world and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying some necessary things for his farming

loans.name: Chhut

texts.en:
Chhut L., age 42, is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she is involved in a business selling palm sugar, typically earning approximately US$7 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband (pictured) who is raising pigs and buying cows to resell with an income of US$6 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, L. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase pigs and cows to resell. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to provide a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and pigs for her husband to raise

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en:
Meoun P., age 45, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she makes the wholesale of wooden beds, earning approximately US $4 per day. Her husband works as a soldier for the government, earning an income of US $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more wooden beds and windows to resell. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: buy more wooden beds and windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des produits de beauté

loans.name: Rejina

texts.es:
la sra. REJINA I. se dedica a la pasteleria y reposteria desde hace 3 años, trabaja solo por encargos, y tambien se dedica a la venta de Golosinas como ser: tacos, Enchiladas, Pastelitos, palomitas de maíz y refrescos, en la zona de Villa Santa de donde es ella, son pocas las personas que se dedican a este tipo de negocios, y doña rejina es la persona que mas demanda tiene de su producto, ya que los clientes quedan satisfechos con los pasteles que ella elabora por el sabor que les da; rejina es casada y su esposo se dedica a la Caficultura, tienen un hijo que depende a un 100% de ellos, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio contribuye a su esposo para el sosten de la 
familia y arreglos de la casa. 
ya que gracias a ello sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
necesita el credito para comprar mas ingredientes para realizar sus pasteles y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y salir adelente con su familia.

loans.use: compra de huevos, manteca, margarina, azucar, jalea, material para decorar, harina de trijo, cajas para pasteles, levadura, soda, colorantes y saborizantes.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Sreng S., 44, is a housewife and has a three-year-old child. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured). To make a living, her husband operates his motor taxi at the local markets in the town, earning approximately an income of US $2.5 in revenue per day to cover his household expenses. This couple tries to work hard every day to ensure good living for their child and family. S. is seeking to improve her husband’s business, so she is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike that will enable her husband to provide efficient services to his customers because the his current motorbike is old and not reliable enough to attract people. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income to make a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
Filomena V., es integrante del grupo Esmeralda, trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 12 años aproximadamente,  recuerda que después de tres meses de capacitación logró sacar el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, aspecto que en la actualidad ha cambiado mucho. Filomena con el  pasar del tiempo emprendió  diferentes negocios como la  costura de ropa, tejido de prendas de vestir y venta de calzados, en los cuales tuvo éxito, actualmente se dedica al tejido de ropa y necesita el préstamo para comprar lana.
Sus demás compañeras también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de plásticos, venta de alimento seco, venta de ropa,  y tejido de alfombras.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Filomena V. is a member of the Esmeralda Group, which has been working with Pro Mujer for approximately 12 years. She recalls that after three months of training she was able to acquire a loan to invest in her business. This has brought about many changes for her. Filomena now spends her time pursuing different business activities such as sewing clothes, weaving, and selling shoes. She currently produces fabric used for making clothing and needs a loan to buy wool.

The other members also have their own retail businesses selling plastics, dried foods, clothing, and woven rugs. They all need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & raw materials

loans.name: Sandra Jovana

texts.es:
La señora  SANDRA JOVANA A. O. tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria  y tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de te filtrantes de forma ambulatoria por todo Trujillo y con su crédito de S/ 300 nuevos soles compró cajas de te al por mayor.
Con etse crédito de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizara para comprar cajas de de te al por mayor para continuar con su negocio.
SANDRA sueña con tener una bodega en su casa para así poder vender mas tranquila y obtener mayores ganancias para la crianza de su hijo.
texts.en:
SANDRA JOVANA A. O., 24, lives in the MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SAN BORJA communal bank. She finished 11th grade and has a 3-year-old son, who depends on her economically. She sells tea all over Trujillo and with her 300 sol loan she bought boxes of tea at wholesale. With this 500 new sol loan she will also buy boxes of tea at wholesale in order to continue working. SANDRA dreams with having a grocery store in her home to sell more peacefully and obtain higher profits to use in raising her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of tea at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan R. G. tiene la edad de 26 años, es casado y no tiene hijos. Su esposa esta esperando el primer hijo. El quiere comprar dos cortadores de cesped para empezar un negocio a cortar cesped de casas por contracto.  Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una negocio productiva. También, el ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales como lo es el Banco Nacional de Costa Rica, pero  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene el deseo a superarse mas al recibir mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan R. G. is 26, married, and does not have children. His wife is expecting their first child. He wants to buy two lawn mowers to start a contract business mowing lawns for houses. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had problems with his property, but he does have the desire to make his business productive. Also, he has had other loans from state banks like the National Bank of Costa Rica. However, Fudecosur gave him a loan with easier payments and much lower interest. He has the wish to improve himself to get more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lawn mowers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. is from the city of Maloro, Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Lydia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Lydia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling barbecue. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lydia joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S., 28, is a single woman living with her old mother in Kampong Chhnang province. She is the oldest of the three siblings. To earn a living, Un plants rice and vegetable crops for selling. To help meet the needs of the family, her second sister works sewing clothes for industry. Un S. requests a loan to purchase piglets to breed, as well as to buy a bicycle to help with transportation.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: LLeny, es una mujer muy solidaria y puntual, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 40 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motocarros, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la apoya en el mismo negocio. LLeny forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra y posterior venta de repuestos de motos y motocarros, ahora ella necesita 500 soles, que utilizará en la compra y venta de repuestos.	El anhelo de LLeny es implementar mejor su negocio y así  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lleny is a very supportive and punctual woman. She lives in the district of Callería, in the Ucayali region. She is forty years old, and is the mother of three children, who are all young. She sells parts for motorbikes and three-wheelers. She has the support of her husband, who helps her in her store. Lleny has been part of the community bank "Las Orquídeas" for a year. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, and this was used to buy and later sell parts for motorbikes and three-wheelers. At this moment, she needs 500 soles ($200) that she will use to buy and sell parts. Lleny's wish is to better run her business and so to improve their income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy and sell spare parts for motorbikes and three-wheelers

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is 22 years old and has a vegetable and fruit farming business. She has an eight-year-old child. She does everything to lift up her family. This is the only way she can provide for their needs. She's now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy farm seeds and supplies. This loan is helpful for her to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. M. is 40 years old. He is married to a dentist and they have three children between fifteen and seven years old. They hope to give each of their children a good education at the university level.

His business is located at Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. He has been selling chains, spokes, bulbs, rings, oil, piston kit and other bicycle and motor bike spare parts. He sells to bicycle and motorbike riders mostly within Thika town.

James has been doing this business for five years now and has five employees. He says that his business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and that some spare parts are not readily available. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

James will use his loan of 20000 KES to buy more spare chains, bulbs, and spokes. He hopes to be a distributor of spare parts in future. He is very hardworking, humble and jovial.

loans.use: To buy spokes, bulbs and spare chains.

loans.name: Marare Nalwogo Kasifa Group

texts.en: Kasifa N. is a businesswoman who is 30 years old and married with three children all in school. She has a retail shop business that she has been operating for two years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, plastics or utensils, etc for sale. She is a hardworking woman whose future hopes are to obtain land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, plastics or utensils, etc for sale.

loans.name: Dominga Patrocinia

texts.es: Dominga, de 49 años, tiene 4 hijos, vive solo con los tres  menores y con su esposo en su casa propia.Durante todas la mañanas se dedica a su trabajo de niñera, cerca de su casa, hasta las  2 de la tarde; y a partir de las 3  saca su stand de ropa  a la puerta de su casa, donde  vende hace muchos años. Este negocio le agrada mucho, porque  le genera buenas ganancias; sobre todo al dar a crédito las prendas, a sus vecinas. Es por esta razón que durante todos los fines de semana se dedica íntegramente  a la comercialización de ropa, ya que son días muy transitados. El mayor anhelo de Dominga es tener una buena cantidad de prendas de vestir, y sobre todo que sean exclusivas, y muy cotizadas por las jovencitas de su barrio, ya que son las que tienen mayor salida.Es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ratifica la  puntualidad en sus cuotas programadas, porque desea seguir contando con posteriores créditos ya que busca seguir progresando.Con el dinero solicitado comprará  gran cantidad de prendas de vestir y también zapatos escolares, para atender el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
