Dominga is 49 years old and has 4 children. She lives with her husband and her 3 younger children in their own house. She makes a living as a nanny, and works near her home from morning until 2 in the afternoon. At 3 p.m. Dominga opens up a clothing stand at the entrance to her home, where she has sold clothing for many years. She really likes this business because it generates good profits; she gives most of the credit to the items she sells and to her neighbors. On weekends she dedicates all of her time to selling clothing, since those are very busy days for her business. Dominga’s greatest wish is to have a large quantity of garments, especially the ones that are sought after by young girls in the neighborhood, as those are what sell the most quickly. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she is known for making her payments punctually. She hopes to be able to receive additional loans, since she wants to continue making progress with her business. Dominga will use the money she has asked for to purchase a large quantity of garments as well as school shoes so that she can meet the orders of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a large quantity of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with two children. Her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she stays with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Sarah takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and feeding the family. Sarah owns a stall selling banana in Ntinda. She works six days a week. Sarah receives at least 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail.  Sarah has been in this business for 10 years and her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her 17th loan. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock of bananas. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start going to farmers directly. She joined MCDT because she could easily access loans so that she could solve her needs.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en:
Etidal is a mother of five daughters and two sons, and her husband is a construction worker. Etidal received her high school degree while she was married and continued her education to earn a degree in Elementary Education. She started sewing services five years ago to help her husband with household expenses and to try to save up money for her sons' and daughters' education.  Four of her sons and daughters are students under age 18, while the rest are over 18 and are helping their mother in her work until they have the chance to start college or university.

Etidal's business is sewing clothes for the neighbors in Al Ein refugee camp of Nablus city, where she lives. She started the project five years ago in her house, as shown in the picture above, using her mother's sewing machine. Now that the demand for her services is increasing, she has applied for a loan from FATEN to purchase a new and efficient machine.

Etidal hopes that she will be able to educate her sons and daughters and open her own workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Darling Vanessa

texts.es:
Junín es una ciudad cálida, hospitalaria y sus habitantes muy buenas personas, así es la señora Darling M., de origen guayaquileño pero  con raíces manabitas  está  casada y  tiene 2 hijos, se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos.

Se comprometió con un manabita, prácticamente desde que llego a Manabí se dedicó al trabajo, ella lleva 10 años con su negocio su mama tenia un bazar y por ello ella vino a vivir a Junín, para ayudar a su madre de quien recibió los mejores ejemplos.

A los oídos de Darling llegaron comentarios que había  una fundación que hacia prestamos  para personas que quisieran tener sus negocios propios, por eso se unió la Fundación Espoir lleva 10 ciclos en mi bankito  sus compras las realiza en Guayaquil y Perú su esposo es chofer de volqueta tiene 9 años de comprometida,  su forma de vender es recorrer y dejar a crédito por semana  cobra y con el dinero recogido hace sus compras y con los créditos que hace también reinvierte en su negocio , además de zapatos y ropa nueva también vende ropa de paca , la compra en Portoviejo, tiene 20 a 25 clientes fijos ella se dedicó a vender ropa por su mamá  y por el bazar que tenia, su madre falleció pero le dejo además del bazar esos buenos ejemplos que se reciben de una madre tan trabajadora como la de ella, ahora aspira tener a mas del bazar un almacén para incrementar  sus ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Junín is a warm, hospitable city and its residents are very good people. Darling M. is like this. She is from Guayaquil with roots in Manabi. She is married and has 2 children. She sells clothes and shoes. She got enagaged to a Manabitan, and practically since she arrived in Manabi she has worked. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her mother has a variety store and that is why she came to live in Junín, to help her mother who always was the best role model for her. Darling heard tell that their was a foundation that made loans to people who want to have their own businesses. That is why she joined Fundación Espoir. She has been in the bank for 10 cycles. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and Peru. Her husband is a dump truck driver, and she has been with him for 9 years. The way she sells is she goes out and sells on credit and she collects every week. With the money she has collected she makes her purchases and she reinvests the loans into her business. Besides new shoes and clothes, she also sells clothing in bulk. She buys it in Portoviejo and she has 20 to 25 regular customers. She began selling clothes because of her mother and the variety store she had. Her mother passed away but apart from the variety store she left her the good example of being a hardworking mother like she was. Now she aspires to having a store inaddition to the variety store, in order to increase her sales and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Jenny Annabelle

texts.es:
El banco comunal 22 de Julio se reúne en la parroquia de Picoaza, es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en diferentes ramas, como la venta de productos de material plástico, ropa, accesorios de teléfonos y muchos mas, los habitantes de esta bella parroquia se caracterizan por ser hombres y mujeres de grandes tradiciones y costumbres.

La señora Jenny  tiene  su hogar, el esposo se dedica al comercio ambulante de dulces, se caso cuando apenas tenia 18 años, ahora a sus 20 años ya es madre de un niño, con gran responsabilidad ha tomado el hecho de ser madre y es por ellos que se ha dedicado a la venta de joya en plata como collares y anillos, para abastecerse de las joyas tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Cuenca, una vez que tiene las joyas va a recorrer por el sector donde vive, ya tiene sus clientes fijos y muy responsables, cada fin de mes viaja para surtir su negocio.

En las tardes se dedica a vender y lo hace en compañía de su bebe que apenas tiene dos añitos, trata de estar siempre cerca de el.

 Con el nuevo crédito que recibirá la señora Jenny podrá hacer un nuevo viaje hasta la Ciudad de Cuenca para comprar más joyas ya que se acerca el mes de las madres y se incrementan las ventas.
texts.en:
Jenny has a home. Her husband sells sweets on foot. She married when she was only 18 years old, and at 20, she has a son. She has been very responsible about becoming a mother and for that reason she has started a business selling silver jewelry such as necklaces and rings. To purchase the jewelry she has to travel to the city of Cuenca. Once she has the jewelry she sells in the area where she lives. She already has established customers who are responsible. At the end of every month she travels to stock her business. She sells in the afternoons, accompanied by her baby, who is barely 2 years old. She tries to always be near him. With the new loan that she will receive, Jenny can make a new trip to the city of Cuenca to purchase more jewelry, since the month of Mother's Day is approaching and sales increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Silver jewelry such as rings, earrings, chains, and bracelets

loans.name: Uoch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uoch T. is 47 years old and is a resident of Siem Reap province. She earns a living raising some poultry and farming crops. Another source of family income comes from her husband's own small business: he fishes in and around T. river for a profit and he sometimes helps his wife in planting crops.

For T. coming rainfall season, in which it is possible to cultivate crops, Mrs. Uoch T. doesn’t have capital for T. purpose of supplying her farming business. This is why she has decided to look for a $1,200 loan from Kiva. She will use this loan to hire a laborer to plow her farmland and then buy fertilizers and crop seeds to plant. She hopes T. loan will generate additional income for her.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her farmland and to buy fertilizer and crop seeds

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Leilyn G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has a 2 year old child. To make a living, Leilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Leilyn has been engaged in her business for over 11 years already.

In 2007, Leilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Leilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Leilyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is a married woman living with her husband, who works as a palm wine tapper, and her seven dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Akua prepares waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and salted fish in Abura and uses her income to support her husband in paying school fees and utility bills.

Akua will use the loan to purchase more fish to salt to distribute to the market women in Abura. With the new earnings she is going to gain from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to salt to distribute to the market women in Abura

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. T. is twenty-six years old, single, and does not have any children yet. His business is located at Barsheba estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites--not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

He has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last year to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future and even open other outlets. He describes himself as very customer friendly.

loans.use: Expanding store inventory

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela, trabaja con un taller de lavado de autos y cambio de aceite y mantenimiento de transportes, ella solicito este crédito, ya que alquilo otro ambiente más favorable para su actividad por la zona de Cota Cota, ella vive en la casa de sus cuñados por la urbanización virgen de Copacabana, más conocida por Codavisa, allí tiene todavía parte de su mercadería y la atención de otros clientes, que antes atendía, este negocio lo atiende su cuñada, la Sra. Gabriela tiene un esposo que trabaja en el interior de la republica, tienen dos hijos que ella los mantiene y controla, la Sra. Es una persona muy trabajadora  e inquieta en sus actividades, con el dinero del credito comprara mercadería como lubricantes y también un motor para utilizar en el lavado de autos, la Sra. esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Miss Gabriela works at a car wash, oil change and maintenance shop. She lives in the home of her brother- and sister-in-law in the Virgen de Copacabana development, which is best known for the Codavisa area, and she rents a shop in the Cota Cota zone, a more favourable location for her business. She still has some of her merchandise and customers, but her sister-in-law now attends to them. Gabriela has a husband who works in the interior of the country. They have two children whom she cares for. She is a very hard-working woman who is eager to work. With this loan she will purchase merchandise such as lubricants and also a motor to use in the car wash. She is very grateful for the offered opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of lubricants and a car wash machine

loans.name: Belida Irene

texts.es: Belida es de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene cuatro hijos varones, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de arena de rio para construcción, en la actividad tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, con la ayuda de sus familiares han superado el negocio, solicita su primer crédito para capital de trabajo, compra de arena de rio el cual es una inversión rentable. Sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, con la ayuda de su familia pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Belinda is 37 years old, is single, and has four sons. She sells river sand used for construction and has been doing this for more than 10 years. Her business has been successful thanks to the help from her family. She is asking for her first loan, which will provide her with working capital to buy river sand. This is a profitable investment. Her personal references indicate that she is a hard working and responsible person. She will repay this loan with her family’s help.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo C. Zavala es un señor muy emprendedor a pesar de ser pensionado, el cuenta con un negocio donde repara automóviles cuando están en malas condiciones a causa de un choque, los cuales les arregla la parte y la pinta para quede mejor. Este negocio ya tiene dos años para así tener más ingresos y poder cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo C. Zavala is a hardworking man despite being on a pension. He repairs automobiles when they're in bad condition due to an accident. He fixes them and paints them. He's had this business for two years and has more income that helps to cover his expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Germana P., photographed at her farm with one of her grandchildren, is from the town of Trinidad. She is 66 years old. Germana is married and has seven children. Her eldest child is now 42 years old and the youngest is 25. Germana is a rice farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice since she was in her 20s. She says she continues to spend time tilling her farm because she wants to help provide for her children and grandchildren.

Germana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Germana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs and pay for the rent of the tractor she uses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta pan y también trabaja en la municipalidad de Anta, ahora que se acerca una fiesta de     la socia vende coronas y también vende pan llamado pan wuawua (es un acostumbre), la socia quiere tener un puesto para poder vender los panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, manteca y mantequilla para preparar el pan.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the Ricchary Anteña community bank. The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district in the province of Anta in Cuzco.

Mrs. Gladys is the group member. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children. She has two jobs. She works selling bread and also works in the Anta area. Since a holiday is approaching she sells coronas and wuawua bread (a traditional bread). She wants to have her own stall for selling breads. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, lard, and butter to prepare bread.

She is thankful for those who are part of making her dream come true through a loan and promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: Flour, lard, and butter for making bread

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr.  Abraham; el tiene 67 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de comidas, el juntamente con su esposa trabajan en este negocio, el socio trabaja en forma independiente, el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Abraham belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Abraham is 67 years old and is married with 6 children.  He has a food business.  He works together with his wife in this business.  He owns his own business and works from 8.00am until 6.00pm.  He would like to expand his business.

Abraham would like to thank those who are participating in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients such as rice and meat

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn G. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Genalyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Genalyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale.

loans.name: Lazaro Senon

texts.es:
Lazaro de 49 años, es taxista informal de las calles de Guayaquil. Tiene una casa de caña y cuanta con luz y agua en tanquero se encuentra en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas

Con la liquidación que le dieron en una empresa donde él trabajaba compro su un carro para convertirlo en un taxi. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm recorriendo las calles de todo Guayaquil y en ocasiones a las afuera de la ciudad. Unos de los inconvenientes es trabajar en las noches debido al índice muy elevado de la delincuencia. 

Para seguir trabajando en su carro él quiere comprar unos repuesto y llantas. En el futuro quiere comprar otro carro y así tener más ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia..
texts.en:
49 year old Lazaro drives a taxi in the streets of Guayaquil. He has a cane-built house with electricity and water that comes by tanker. His house is in a periurban area of the city called Paraíso De La Flor, which is in an area known for its dirt roads and mountains. 
He used the redundancy pay that he got from a company where he worked to buy a car and convert it into a taxi. Now he works from 7:00am until 10:00pm, driving through the streets of Guayaquil and occasional beyond the city. One of the disadvantages of this job is having to work at night because there is much more crime at that time. 
In order to be successful with his business, he wants to buy some spare parts and tires. In the future, he wants to buy another car and so increase his income so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Tires, spare parts

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim K., 43, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. All of her children are single; two of them are working in different jobs. Khim K. inherited farmland from her grandmother and she grows different kinds of crops, such as rice and vegetables on her farmland. Her husband is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few employees to help him provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. The main income in this family comes from her husband’s business. Khim K. would like to request a loan from Kiva to help her husband purchase construction equipment for his building service.

loans.use: To purchase construction equipment

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mork S., 36, is a farmer earning an income of 2 USD per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of 3 USD per day. The family has to spend 50 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity supply, and 7 USD on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a machine to cut firewood for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a machine to cut firewood for sale

loans.name: Shalom 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Teolinda is one of the members of the “Shalom 5, 6, 7” group, located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. In this town, as in many others, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants. Her principal economic activities are the sale of clothing. Teolinda is the mother of five children, four or whom live with her and their father. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is having sufficient money to cover the needs of her family and her favorite activity is serving in her business.

Teolinda is very moved by receiving her ninth loan from E. Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She has had her business for around four years. She set up her business when she saved enough money to started a business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of a different cloths for kids, women and men, also she sell shoes and cosmetics. She plans to use her profits to save. Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette is 32 years old. She is married and has five children aged 2 to 12 years old. All her children are in school apart from the youngest who hasn’t begun school yet. 

Marie Gorette sells and recharges batteries. She has done this business for 8 years while her husband repairs motorcycles and cars.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a motorcycle. She plans to save and buy a house in future.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Ramón de Punta del Este de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Norma G., vive con su marido y sus  hijos, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y en su horas libres vende empanadas en su despensa.
Ella y sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el segundo ciclo con sus 10 integrantes.
texts.en: The women of this communal bank are from the San Ramón de Punta del Este neighborhood in the city of Caacupé.  The president of the group is Señora Norma G..  She lives with her husband and children and works as a domestic employee.  In her free time she sells empanadas from her store.  She and her partners are very satisfied with the financial support from Fundación Paraguaya.  With the capital the women are expanding their businesses and  improving their quality of life.  The ten members of this group are in their second loan cycle.

loans.use: Baked goods, fruits and vegetables as well as expanding their businesses

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores A. is from the village of Simanoc, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 61 years old. Dolores is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Dolores owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, candies & beverages in the local community. She also buys and sells electronic load for several networks like GLOBE & SMART. Dolores has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dolores joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolores has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & beverages. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Dolores from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & beverages

loans.name: Chixacol Group

texts.en:
Felipe S. Chún is single, 51 years old, and lives in the highland region of Totonicapan. He has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Don Felipe earns a living by selling daily consumer products. He has a store and has ten years of experience in the business. He started with a small shop and has developed his business into what it is today. 

Felipe is requesting a loan as a part of the ¨Chixacol¨ group to purchase more goods to sell in his store. He hopes to one day run a larger store and sell a wide variety of household goods to his customers. 

The ¨Chixacol¨ group consists of five members, two women and three men. The loan they are requesting will be used to expand their capital so that they can increase their sales volume. Group members are involved in the following businesses: plastics sales, clothing sales, and general goods sales.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 53-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and 9 children. Ibrahim has owned an  entertainment shop since 2005, where friends, neighbors and relatives come and spend joyful time playing billiards. He also owns a small grocery store, catering to the same clientele. He used to work as a taxi driver but he insisted on changing his family's way of living by changing his business. Ibrahim is requesting his first  loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his grocery store capital and to add new entertainment machines to his shop. Ibrahim hopes to expand his business by adding more games such as Play Stations.

loans.use: to add new entertainment machines

loans.name: Amos Ntaika

texts.en:
Amos Ntaika P. is 29 years old and single. For the past five years, he has been a farmer. Farming is a good profession in his area due to favorable conditions.

Amos learned about KADET LTD through KADET advertisements. He is applying for his first loan of 50,000 KES to buy farm supplies. He has never borrowed money from any other microfinance institution and is honest man who will do well if supported financially. Amos will use the proceeds from his loan to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Sarepta Group

texts.fr: Kapinga N.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire « Sarepta »,  âgée de 64 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants dont le fils ainé a 46 ans et le cadet a 26 ans. Tous ses 10 enfants ont leurs  diplômes universitaires. Son mari est un comptable dans une entreprise publique « Office national du café (ONC)». La cliente Kapinga N.  est boulangère. Elle a aussi une boutique pour  maximiser assez des revenus. Il ya 33 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de boulangère. Elle démarra son business avec de fonds propre issu de production de récolte du champ. Cette récolte valait 6$ à l’époque. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des matières premières (20 sacs de farines, sucre, levures, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et surtout l’espace de production et initier ses enfants dans l’auto prise en charge.  La cliente Kapinga N.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Sarepta » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Kapinga N. is an entrepreneur and president of the "Sarepta" business group. She is 64 years old, married and mother to ten children, the eldest son being 46 years old and the youngest being 26 years old. All her ten children have got university diplomas. Her husband is an accountant in a public company, namely the National Café Office (Office national du café - ONC). The customer, Kapinga N. is a baker. She also has a shop in order to maximise her income. She has been carrying out her bakery business for the past 33 years. She started the business with a capital generated from the production of crop from the fields. This crop was worth USD 6 at the time. This new loan will allow her to get fresh supplies of basic products (20 bags of flour, sugar, yeast etc.). Her ambition for the future is to expand her business and, above all, her production space, but also to get her children started up in providing for themselves. Kapinga N. is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favour of poor people who are excluded from classic banks. It should be noted that the "Sarepta" business group is made up mainly of women.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of flour, sugar, yeast etc..

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom has been in the farming business for 13 years and he has much experience. He is married and has three children. His wife helps him in his business and together, they work hard to make a profit for the feeding of their children. Gulom would like to get a loan of $1,500 for purchasing fertilizers and pesticide, which allows him to get a good harvest and make a good profit. He will invest his profit for expanding his business and for celebrating the rite of the circumcision of his son. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Mila

texts.ar: ميلا عمرها 45 سنة هي امراة عزباء تعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية لها في عملها 26 سنة تحب العمل وكانت تطوره بشكل مستمر لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض السابق في دعم العمل حيث استطاعت ان تطوره من متجول الى محل ثابت لها تحلم بأن تصبح مالكت محل خاص بها حيث انها تعتمد على نفسها في تطوير الحياة الاجتماعية والعملية لها ولعائلتها فهي تسعى الى شد الروابط الاسرية من خلال التكفل بمصاريف والديها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة البسة واحذية مستوردة من الخارج حتى تكون متجددة وترضي جميع المطلبات حيث انها تعاني من منافسة قوية في محيطها
texts.en: Mila is 45 years old and unmarried. She works in a clothes and shoes store and has 26 years experience in this. She loves her business and is continuously developing it. She has good credit history with al-Majmoua and the last loan helped support her so that she was able to transfer her shop to fixed premises. She now owns her own store and is able to depend on herself to progress in social and business life, both for herself and her family. She aspires to strengthen her family ties by paying towards her parents living costs. With this loan she wants to import new clothes and shoes from abroad in order to be up to date and fulfil her customers' demands, as she suffers from strong competition in her local area.

loans.use: to import new clothes and shoes stock from abroad for her store.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto has been engaged in farming for 10 years in the Philippines. Currently, he earns PHP 20,000 for each crop he harvests. Alberto desires eventually to expand his farmland so as to provide an extra source of income for the family. He and his wife have three grown children.  

Alberto is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 in order to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy hybrid seeds of corn to be planted on the family farm. Alberto is confident that this loan will make his operations more productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy hybrid seeds of corn for planting

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 56 años, ella es viuda, cuenta con casa propia  la cual esta ubicada en el Caserío Totoral Bajo del distrito D. TambogranD.. Comunidad rural pequeña, con deseos D. superación.

Lucila se dedica ala venta D. leche fresca D. las 5 vacas D. su propiedad, ella realiza la distribución D. sus producto en el lugar donD. resiD., sale a vender a los alrededores la leche fresca que produce, además también se dedica a la crianza D. animales ovinos y aves D. corral.

Lucila está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1000 nuevos soles para poder realizar mejoras en los corrales D. sus animales, pues quiere ofrecer al público un producto D. calidad.

Lucila es una  mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás
texts.en:
Lucila is 56 years. She is a widow and owns a house in the village of Totoral Bajo, which is in the TambogranD. district. Totoral Bajo is a small, rural community that is hoping to develop and grow.

Lucila owns five dairy cows and sells fresh milk from her farm. She also delivers her dairy products to surrounding villages and raises sheep and poultry. 

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN to improve her livestock pens. Lucila is a hardworking woman who works every day to improve her life. Her friends and neighbors say she is friendly and always ready to help.

loans.use: To improve her cattle corral.

loans.name: Prim

texts.en:
Prim, 49 years-old, is making a traditional Khmer instrument she sells with her husband. One instrument costs $35 and she can make one instrument a day with her husband but this does not mean she can sell one per day. The income in her family is not regular because it depend on the tourist season. Most of her customers are foreigners. 

She has four children, all of whom are studying in school. Every month, she spends $110 on food, $115 on school fees, and $30 on other expenses in the family. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 in order to buy woods and materials for making the Khmer instrument to sell. She wants to extend her business and sell to customers herself which will bring more benefit then selling through others.

loans.use: to buy woods and materials for making a traditional Khmer instrument.

loans.name: Judith Clairemonde

texts.fr:
Cliente agee de 40 ans, divorcee et mere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 7 et 22 ans. N'ayant pas de soutien pour poursuivre ses etudes ,elle se lance dans le commerce en vendant du foufou ou farine de tubercule de manioc depuis 1997.Elle ecrase ces ecosses de foufou dans un moulin, qu'elle transforme en farine de foufou, c'est l'aliment de base ici au Congo , ses recettes sont considerables , car elle encaisse en moyenne 150.000 par semaine.

A l'octroi de son pret , elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 10 sacs de farine de tubercule (foufou)car, elle a une forte demande.

Elle envisage beaucoup epargner dans le but de voyager a l'interieur du pays pour acheter les tubercules, et de devenir grossiste et a la longue ouvrir un depot de foufou.Elle prend soin de ses enfants , supporte leur scolarite et entreprend des relations de bon voisinage.
texts.en:
A 40-year old client, divorced and the mother of three  children ranging between seven and 22 years of age. Lacking financial support for continuing her education, in 1997 she launched into  selling “foufou,” or manioc flour. She  mills peeled manioc yams and transforms them into    "foufou," which is a staple food here in Congo. She has significant income as her daily receipts average 150,000 francs.

Thanks to her loan, she will bolster her stock by buying 10 bags of “foufou” as she is facing high demand. She plans to keep saving money in order to travel to the interior of the country in order to buy yams so as to become a wholesaler and eventually to open a “foufou” warehouse. She supports her children, pays for their education and maintains good relations within her community.

loans.use: to buy ten 50-kg bags of "foufou" [yam flour]

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 28 años de edad, cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío José Olaya del distrito de Tambogrande, dicho caserío   se encuentra en la parte rural  de este distrito. Y no cuanta con servicio básicos

Rogelio se dedica principalmente a la crianza de ganado ovino y a la crianza de cerdos los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, adicionalmente cuenta con 1.5 has de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia donde tiene limón que cosecha semanalmente 

Rogelio esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales con su respectivo alimento balanceados que ayude al engorde de ovinos y cerdos logrando un mejor peso y tamaño, de esta manera el podrá venderlos a un mejor precio, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Rogelio  es un hombre responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo desea que su familia salga adelante y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 28 years old and owns his own home, which is located in the village of Jose Olaya, district of Tambogrande.  The village is in a rural part of this district and doesn't have basic services.

Rogelio is primarily engaged in raising sheep and pigs.  He breeds them and fattens them, and later places them on the local market.  He also has 1.5 hectares of agricultural land that his father has given him as an inheritance.  The land has a lemon crop that he harvests weekly.

Rogelio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 nuevos soles to buy more animals and animal feed to help fatten the sheep and pigs.  This will help them to achieve a better weight and size, so Rogelio can sell them at a better price.  This investment will enable his business to continue growing and improve his quality of life.

Rogelio is a responsible hard-worker who wants his family to succeed and give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, tiene la edad de 28 años, está actualmente casada y vive con sus 4 hijos y esposo. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de la siembra del café. Ella comprará abonos y  materia prima para la siembra de su cafetal en la mejores condiciones de prestamos. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para la siembra de este cultivo, por lo cual se sembrara para darle un buen provecho al terreno. Ella tiene como meta darle a su plantación una buena calidad de asistencia y así poderle sacar el máximo de provecho y generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her 4 children and her husband. With the loan she is going to buy materials to help her plant coffee. She will buy fertilizer and raw materials to plant her coffee field with the best lending conditions. She has land that is suitable for this crop, and planting it will be a good use of the land. Her goal is to give her crop quality assistance And in this way use it to its maximum potential and generate income for her family's wellbeing. This is the first loan she has taken out with FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans from regular banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with more ease of payment and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es: Damaso de 54 años es empleado de un centro comercial desde hace 11 años, realizando la función de despachador de pan, es casado y vive en una casa de interés social que su hijo  adquirio, estas casas son muy pequeñas y ellos decidieron ampliarla solo que como la mano de obra es muy cara con sus propios ahorros no alcanzaron a poner la losa, solicitan un préstamo para poder realizar su proyecto y ofrecer a su familia mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Damaso is 54 years old and has been employed in a commercial center for the last 11 years, where he has a bread store.  He is married, and lives in publicly subsidized housing which his son acquired.  These houses are very small, and they have decided to expand theirs, but as labor is very expensive, they can't stretch to laying the floor slabs with their own savings.  They are asking for a loan to be able to complete their project and provide more comfort for their family.

loans.use: to lay concrete floor slabs.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a single woman with one child who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Tabu dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 70,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and detergents. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and detergents.

loans.name: Rosemary Mariela

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosemary Mariela; tiene 24 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, la socia trabaja en el mercado vendiendo todo lo relacionado a bisutería, ella compra la por mayor aretes, collares, anillos, pulseras y los acomoda en una muy ingeniosa paraguas con tul para llevar de forma independiente al mercado y ofrecer sus joyas de fantasía. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de joyas de fantasía para la venta al por menor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de joyas de fantasía para la venta.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosemary Mariela is a member of the "Silkinchany" community bank which is located in Angostura community, in Cusco province and department.

Rosemary Mariela is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child who is 5 years old.  She works in the market selling everything to do with costume jewelry.  She buys earrings, necklaces, rings and bracelets wholesale.  She arranges them in a very ingenious tulle umbrella and then takes them independently to the market to sell.  She would like to invest this loan in buying costume jewelry to sell retail.

Rosemary Mariela is grateful for the support she is being given and pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Jenny Yadira

texts.es:
Jenny es una madre soltera de 34 años. Junto a sus tres hijas vive desde que nació en la parroquia de "Río Verde" del cantón Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. 

Jenny trabaja vendiendo ropa y cosméticos puerta a puerta y de esta manera sustenta económicamente su hogar. Aprendió esto de unas amigas y diariamente trabaja y también dedica tiempo a sus hijos. Ella desea invertir en un lote de ropa por lo que acudió a Fundación Alternativa en busca de un crédito. Con la inversión espera tener más ingresos y así poder solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ella sueña con tener una casa propia para sus hijos y sabe que trabajando duro podrá lograr su gran meta.
texts.en:
Jenny is a single mother, aged 34.  She lives with her three daughters in the "Rio Verde" parish where she was born in the Santo Domingo Canton.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is one of the youngest cities in Ecuador.  Currently it is the link between the Sierra region and the coast.  It is a privileged location, not only because of its rich ethnicity, but also because of the unusual landscape found upon entering this beautiful city.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was recently set up.  The main festivities of Santo Domingo are celebrated with crowds of visitors and many commercial and cultural exchanges.

Jenny sells clothing and cosmetics door-to-door and is able to support the household this way.  She learned her trade from friends and works every day, while also caring for her children.  In order to buy a bundle of clothing she has requested a loan through Fundación Alternativa.  With the investment she hopes to increase her income and be able to cover household expenses.

She dreams of having her own house one day for her children.  She knows that she will have to work hard to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 30 años, es un joven emprendedor y muy trabajador, es soltero pero tiene una hija de seis años, quien no vive con él. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y algunas hermanas con quienes comparte los gastos y tratan de mejorar su calidad de vida día tras día. El trabajo de David consiste en el transporte de pasajeros, el sale todos los días muy temprano en busca de sus eventuales clientes para movilizarlos de un lugar a otro. Cuando tiene tiempo, va en busca de unos motores que necesitan reparación, pues los años en este trabajo le enseñaron a reparar motores, generádole así ganancias extras. Asimismo posee dos unidades de mototaxis, de los cuales uno lo maneja el y otro da a otro chofer que le paga como alquiler. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad de poder trabajar a la hora que mejor le conviene, ya que cuando hay algunos trabajos eventuales para la reparación de motores, él se da el tiempo para hacerlo. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas para armar algunos motores y algunos repuestos para su moto que ya necesita mantenimiento mecánico.
texts.en:
David, age 30, is an enterprising and hardworking young man. He is single, but he has a six-year-old daughter who does not live with him. David lives at home with his parents and sisters. They share the expenses and try to improve their quality of life every day. His job consists of transporting passengers. He leaves early every day in search of customers that he can take from one place to another. When he has time, David will look for engines that are in need of repair. He spent many years learning how to repair motors, so this helps him to generate some extra income. David owns two motorcycle taxis, one that he operates and the other he rents out to another driver. What he likes about his job is the freedom to work at the time when it is most convenient for him. Whenever he has engine repair jobs lined up, he will set aside time to do the work.

This will be his first loan with MFP. He hopes to receive everyone’s support so that he can continue his work. With the amount he requested, David will buy some engines as well as a few spare parts for his motorcycle taxi since it is in need of maintenance.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi and a few engines that need to be repaired.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Sona qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge la famille da sa coépouse.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bouillie et de légume. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It consists of thirteen women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is commerce. 

Madame Sona is on the right of the photo raising her hand and is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She also takes care of her co-spouse's family. 

She is active in the sale of porridge and vegetables. She has good experience in this area of business which she has practiced for several years. 

This loan will permit her to build her capital and to better develop her business. 

The profits will permit her to improve the living conditions of her family (health, food, clothing etc...) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet and vegetables

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old and married with 5 children.

She works hard to provide for her family.  Celia buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has been in business for eight years.  She also sells charcoal.  She requests a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Celia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF.

Celia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Antoney

texts.en:
Anthony is a 40-year-old businessman, and he is married to Agnes who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged five and three years.  He has been in the sawmill business for the past six years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Anthony will use the loan to buy timber and a saw. 

With the anticipated profit he will expand his business. His hope and dreams are to buy a piece of land and plant trees which he will use in future for his business.

loans.use: To buy timber and a saw.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife, age 52, a resident of Dasmariñas City in Cavite Province in the Philippines. She is married to Melchor, her business partner, and she has three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Florife operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, 5 PHP of cooking oil, or an egg. Florife earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them retail. Aside from this, she also sells personal products for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in daily sales.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Florife hopes her business will grow in the coming years, and she dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jardin Maxima Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN MAXIMA II” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora María Luisa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de mantas, venta de tunta y papa, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio,  costura de polleras, venta de comida.

La señora María Luisa  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre  y tiene dos hijos.  

En la fotografía se no se encientra la señora Hercilia, ya que se encontraba en consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “Jardín Máxima II” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata central office. The group is made up of 12 members and is lead by a board of directors headed by Señora María Luisa. The members’ businesses are varied and include: knitting blankets, selling potatoes and freeze-dried potatoes, weaving bracelets, running a neighborhood store, sewing skirts, and selling food. 

María Luisa indicates that this is the first cycle that she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined because she was invited in a promotion. Currently, she has a neighborhood store that she has run for years. 

The loan that she will now take is to increase her capital so that she can purchase food items from la Ceja [a commercial area of the city of El Alto, Bolivia] and later resell them at her store. This line of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible. She lives with her partner and two children.

Señora Hercilia does not appear in the photograph, because she had a doctor’s appointment at the time it was taken.

loans.use: to purchase food items.

loans.name: Seterina

texts.en:
Seterina is a 30 year old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in buluk south Sudan for four years.
Seterina is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 27 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta comida en cual ella ya tiene establecidos sus clientes fijos que la vista y claro sus clientes eventuales. Maria Mercedes tiene 2 hijos que todavía están a su cargo y están estudiando y que los ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzos. Maria Mercedes está solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de la comida.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 27 years old. Her economic activity is selling food. She has established a customer base of regular clients and others who are viewed as eventual customers. 

Maria Mercedes has two children that are still in her care and who are studying and they have gotten ahead through her strong efforts.  

Maria Mercedes is asking for a loan in order to buy raw materials for the preparation of food.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the preparation of food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en:
Hamdan is a 41-year-old married man from Marka, Jordan.

Hamdan has his own vehicle paint shop. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase new tools and equipment and vehicle paints.

Hamdan is looking to purchase a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle paints, tools, and equipment.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.en:
Eladio boasts an exemplary family, household and farm. Eladio and his wife Virginia have brought up 15 children, of which the youngest Jahir will turn 5 in January and oldest, Adalia, is 34. Add to that some 13 grandchildren and spouses of the 10 live-in kids and you can picture this famous family from San Pedro Columbia. 

Most westerners have a hard time even imagining anything past a couple of children, but Eladio and Virginia have embraced each without fail and have worked out parenting to an art. Visitors from around the world have been visiting this beautiful family and their farm since they started a sustainable tourism enterprise. “It’s lucky to meet my brothers and sisters around the world just through a little garden,” Eladio says enthusiastically. Most of the family is trilingual, as Eladio comes from a Mopan Maya speaking environment and Virginia's background is Q'eqchi', and everybody also speaks English on top of the two Maya tongues. 

Beside cacao, they grow more exotic crops like mango, coconut, ginger, lemongrass and Jamaican lime. “I grow whatever the birds or the agouti [type of rodent]bring. That’s how an agouti works. I keep stashing the seeds also,” Eladio assures us with a huge smile. The 31-acre farm has been key in sustaining the numerous family and also served as a source of learning for the family and now visitors from abroad. Eladio and Virginia’s farm is a prime example of integrated farming, where timber and fruit trees abound in harmony and soil is enriched by composting underbrush cleared for pathways to access the crop. Integrated farming brings opportunities for soil enrichment, but also means more work cleaning, pruning and raking the underbrush to transform it to compost. Regular cleaning is indispensable for cacao farms on tropical lowlands as good soil, rain and shade make for prime conditions for growth. “Everybody wants to be a student these days. I want my kids to be farmers,” says Eladio.

loans.use: To hire help to clean 15 acres of cacao and rake cleaned underbrush for compost.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es:
Wendy está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para aprovechar las festividades de fin de año, en esta oportunidad específicamente comprara cosméticos y prendas de vestir para ambos sexos, así podrá mejorar la competitividad de su negocio, espera que las ventas se mantengan y le generen mejores ingresos.
Al invertir el crédito anterior en productos varios de revista su clientela ha aumentado, tiene nuevos ingresos y cumple con sus compromisos.

loans.use: comprara cosméticos y prendas de vestir para ambos sexos, así podrá mejorar la competitividad de su negocio

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is married with two children. Her source of income is from her secretarial job and selling of milk. She grows vegetables, maize, and beans for home consumption. Her monthly income is about $57; she is striving to save at least $40 a month. This cash inflow is not enough but adequate to improve her business and push her to save more. This will help her to buy another cow.

loans.use: She wants to buy a dairy goat to produce milk for her family because of its nutritional value.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy good quality seeds and watering equipment

loans.name: Asega

texts.en:
Asega O’Brien is a fisherman’s wife with five children. She participates in the business by pricing the fish and selling them at market. The family does not have a vehicle and relies on public transportation. She catches the early morning bus to take her fish to market.

She plans to spend the money she is borrowing from SBPD on fishing shoes and fishing equipment, such as fishing nets and coolers for storage. If the weather is good and the tide is calm, the fishing business will continue to prosper, and they will be able to meet their loan payments.

Asega envisions investing in a fishing boat in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing equipment and coolers

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en: Adamsay M. is a clothes trader in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Aged thirty two years with three children, she supports her husband to meet the family’s basic needs.  Her husband is a self-employed carpenter whose income is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses.  Adamsay has been able to use past loans from CCF-SMT to expand her business and would like to use the new loan funds for the same purpose.  She said she is determined to get her family out of their poverty situation.

loans.use: Increase inventory and selection of clothes

loans.name: Dunia Maria

texts.es: I have been making and selling tortillas for three and a half years. I have a loyal customer base among my neighbors.   With this business I support my two children so they can go to school.  This is the only means of support we have.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, firewood and water.

loans.name: Aurora María

texts.es:
Aurora is a loving mother who works diligently every day in her small grocery store that she opened three years ago. Here she grows professionally and feels very happy. Thanks to her job, she has been able to appease the needs of her family and to be an important source of support for Crisoldo, her husband. Crisoldo makes a living by farming small plots of land. With the sacrifices they make together every day, they can satisfy the needs of their nine-year-old girl, who studies in the modest school in their small city. Therefore, the little money they can save goes towards being able to buy a small house to provide comfort and security for their little princess.

Today Aurora is requesting an amount of $500 to finish implementing her grocery store, with the aim of obtaining greater income to be able to increase their savings and bring the day when they can sleep in a house of their own nearer. Let's help Aurora have a small place to live and a home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Aurora es una amorosa madre que diligentemente trabaja a diario en su pequeña bodega que aperturó hace ya 3 años y en la que se desempeña y siente muy feliz, debido a que gracias a su trabajo ha podido apaciguar las necesidades de su familia y ser un importante apoyo para Crisoldo, su esposo, quién se dedica a cultivar sus pequeñas parcelas de tierra. Con el sacrificio conjunto de todos los días pueden satisfacer las necesidades de su niña de nueve años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de su pequeña ciudad. Por ello el poco dinero que pueden ahorrar está destinado para que en corto tiempo puedan adquirir una pequeña casita para brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su pequeña princesita.

Hoy Aurora solicita la suma de 500 dólares para implementar su bodega con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos para incrementar sus ahorros y hacer más cercano el día de poder dormir en un techo propio. Ayudemos ha Aurora a tener una pequeña morada y un hogar para su familia

loans.use: Implementation of a small grocery store

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
I request a loan of $175 for my husband’s grocery store. He is a hardworking and a successful entrepreneur. He sells all the daily use items in his store. Last year, we took a loan for this business and increased the range of items in our store. The sale of our store increased significantly and generated decent profits for us. With the current loan he plans to stock various items adequately for his store.
I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes for my neighboring clients. Moreover, I am a mother of five, three boys and two girls. At present, only two of them attend school whereas the others are very small and do not attend school.

loans.use: Buy  various items for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment for his milk selling business.

loans.name: Gulu D 2002 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 40 year old widow with eight children. She has a grocery store. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children and also buy a plot of land.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru:
Sulton K. was born in 1953, works as a security guard in the co-op Somonkom. Sulton has 7 children. The oldest daughter has married and two of his sons have their own families, so currently he is only supporting 4 of his children who live at home. He has a black and white TV at home and would like to purchase a color TV. But since his salary as a security guard is not sufficient for a comfortable living he has turned for a loan to Microinvest. Sulton thinks that it is more economical to take out a loan to purchase the television.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Курбанов Султон 1953 года рождения ,работает охраником в совместном предприятии Сомонком, имеет 7 детей Старшую дочь уже выдал замуж, два сына тоже уже семейные.Сейчас у него на иждивении еще 4 детей.Он имеет телевизор не цветной ,и хочет купить цветной .Но т.к. у него заработной платы не хватает для хорошего проживания он обратился за кредитом в Микроинвест.Считает что ему выгодней купить телевизор в кредит..

loans.use: Purchase of a television

loans.name: Ernesto Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Ernesto is a man of 42 years, who lives in Laureles South with his wife and their 6 year old son who studies in primary school, like the stressed man who worries about his family, he works delivering bread by bicycle in different zones close to his house, he wants to take advantage of his work time so that he can obtain a better income that will allow him to care for his home, he is thinking of investing in his business by purchasing a motor that he can add to his bike so that he will be able to make deliveries faster and cover more ground and he will be able to work later at night, he can work between 5 and 9 PM that is the time when his clients are at home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Ernesto es un hombre de 42 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur junto a su esposa que es ama de casa y su hijo de 6 años que estudia la Primaria, como el hombre esforzado y preocupado por su familia que es, trabaja repartiendo en bicicleta el Pan en diferentes zonas cercanas a su casa, preocupado por aprovechar al máximo su tiempo de trabajo y obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan hacer unas mejoras necesarias para su casa que esta dañada por el tiempo, ha pensado en invertir en su negocio comprando un motor que le adaptara a su bicicleta para repartir mas rápido y abarcar mas territorio antes que se le haga muy noche, en vista que el empieza a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la tarde hasta las 9:00 de la noche que es la hora que sus clientes ya están en sus casas. Por lo que su crédito es para comprar ese motor como inversión en su negocio, así tendrá mayor velocidad en su trabajo

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his bicycle.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina started her business 3 years ago buying packages of clothing to sell among her relatives and neighbors. Her husband works as a bricklayer; as a result his earnings are small and she wanted to give her children better quality of life. Thanks to her effort the business has gone very well for her.

Now she is requesting a loan for $575 which she repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise, since her sales are increasing and she wants to have inventory in stock for all of her clients. With your contribution Ernestina will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ernestina inicio su negocio hace 3 años comprando pacas de ropa para vender entre sus vecinos y familiares, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil por lo que sus ingresos son pocos y ella deseaba darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo la ha ido bien con su negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, ya que sus ventas se están incrementando y desea surtirles a todos sus clientes. Con tu contribución Ernestina saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina M. is twenty four years old. She is not married. She sells porridge and groundnuts in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from boiled milled maize or millet grains eaten with sugar, milk and bread. Because of her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, and milk to increase production. She hopes to earn a good income to support her younger brother in school. She is a member of a group called Nyame Kye Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Heriberto A. is a 55-year-old married man who lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua.

His wife helps him run the general store. They have been in business for four years. Mr. A. is also a mechanic.

He is requesting this loan for home improvement, such as replacing part of the roof of his house. In the future, he wishes to finish building his house and to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Heriberto tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado, su esposa le ayuda en la pulpería.

El negocio de don Heriberto es una pulpería y lleva cuatro años de experiencia, a parte de eso el es mecánico.

Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras en su vivienda y cambiar parte del techo de su casa de habitación. A futuro es terminar de construir su casa y ampliar el negocio.

loans.use: Home improvement (roofing)

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
On average, the women of the Benkadi group are 42 years old and have six children. They are married and live in extended families that generally include their co-wives, in-laws, and children in the Moussabougou area of the city of Koutiala (Koutiala Prefecture, Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other because they are related, friends or neighbors. They engage in different commercial activities, from sales of small general-store type items to clothing (primary). In order to increase the size of their operations, they decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program, through which they are receiving their first loan.

They get their supplies from wholesalers at the main market in Koutiala exclusively and resell at retail prices for cash and credit primarily at the previously mentioned market, but also via traveling sales to households.

This loan will be used to purchase a stock of various items for general use and about a dozen outfits. With this loan, they estimate that each member will make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs per cycle, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, help with household expenses, and be invested in the business. Strengthening their business activities and network are the primary challenges of this group.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Les femmes du groupe benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles élargies avec généralement des coépouses, les beaux parents et leurs enfants dans le quartier Moussabougou de la ville de Koutiala (Préfecture de Koutiala Région de Sikasso République du Mali).

Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de parenté,d’amitié et de voisinage. Elles mènent differentes activités qui vont de la vente d’articles divers de petits commerces et sutout d’habillement. Afin d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premmier pret.

Ells s’approvisionent exclusivement au grand marché de Koutiala auprés des grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes en détail à crédit et au comptant, essentiellement au marché de la dite localité mais aussi de facon ambulante dans les familles.

Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter un stock d’articles divers de petit commerce et une douzaine d’habits. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen et mensuel 50 000 CFA par cycle.qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérets du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans l’activité. Le renforcement de leurs activités et des liens sociaux constituent le défi majeur des membres du groupe.

loans.use: Purchase of general-use items and clothing

loans.name: Maranatha 2 Group

texts.es:
The “Maranatha 2” Communal Bank has been working with investments from Agrocapital in its fourth cycle.
