It’s a very united group comprised of 14 members of whom three are men who are thankful for the inclusion of men in the communal banks. They use the money to improve their businesses and quality of life as is the case with Señora Segundani who works making bread. She tells us that it is helping her a lot with her invesment [in her business]. She opens her savings accounts with Agrocapital because she says that she wants to save the earnings from her business for the wellbeing and future of her children. In the same way, the other members, hopeful because of the economic support the institution provides, are willing to work for a much longer time with it. Corina, the president of this group, is a cook; Jaime is a mechanic; Felipa works as a baker; Lucy and Lucia are also cooks; Marta is a butcher; Dolly, Patricia and Miriam sell food; Germán and Adrian are mechanics.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco comunal MARANATHA 2 ya viene trabajando con inversión de AGROCAPITAL por su cuarto ciclo, es un grupo muy unido esta compuesto por 14 socios de los cuales tres son varones, agradecidos por permitir la inclusión de varones en los bancos comunales, los cuales utilizan el dinero para el mejoramiento de sus negocios y calidad de vida como el caso de la señora Segundani que trabaja con la elaboración de pan , la cual menciona que le esta ayudando mucho en su inversión y que en lo posterior esta Sra. Solicita a AGROCAPITAL la aperturas de cuentas de ahorro pues indica que todas las ganancias de su negocio quiere ahorrarlos para el bienestar y el futuro de sus hijos, y de la misma manera los demás socios esperanzados en el apoyo económico que brinda la institución es que están dispuestos a trabajar por mucho mas tiempo con la institución. Corina la presidenta de este grupo es cocinera, Jaime es mecánico, Felipa se dedica a la panadería, Lucy y Lucia también son cocineras, Marta es carnicera, Dolly, Patricia y Miriam venden comida, German y Adrian son mecánicos.

loans.use: Operating capital for various businesses

loans.name: Abibou Hamida

texts.fr:
Madame - I. Abibou Hamida est née en 1969 à Sokodé dans la région centrale. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a ouvert en 2003 une boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè situé à 12km du centre ville de Lomé. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et à bien remboursé. 
Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 10 sacs de sucre en poudre, 08 sacs de riz, 12 cartons de savon et 6 bidons d’huile. Elle compte avoir une grande part de marché par ce nouveau stock qu’elle aura à constituer.
texts.en:
Ms. Abibou Hamida I. was born in 1969 in Sokodé in the central region. She is married and the mother of two. She opened a shop in 2003 selling basic provisions in the Agoè district located about 12 km from downtown Lomé. She once benefited from a loan from WAGES and repaid it. She is requesting this second loan for supplies through the purchase of 10 sacks of powdered sugar, 8 sacks of rice, 12 boxes of soap, and 6 drums of oil. She intends to have a large market share by this new inventory that she will have to build.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic provisions

loans.name: La Roca Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotras somos el grupo LA ROCA, nos dedicamos al comercio, juntas hemos trabajado por varios años como grupo, somos mujeres luchadoras y tambien somos vecinas de nuestra colonia, nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Nitida A.: me dedico a la fabricacion de Nacatamales de pollo y cerdo, tengo varios años de vender este tipo de comida, que en nuestro pais la gente come mucho los nacatamales, 
Sara P.: ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en la cual le va muy bien, pero necesita tener mas productos en su negocio porque las necesidades de sus clientes son enormes. 
Magda G.: ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos, este negocio es muy bueno porque en nuestro pais todas las amas de casa y la gente de produce comidas utilizan mucho los condimentos que es lo que le da el sabor a las comidas.
en estos momentos todas nosotras necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios por tal razon estamos solicitando dicho credito.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the group "The Rock", and we work in sales. As a group, we have worked together for many years. We are fighting women and neighbors in our village. Our group works like this: Nitida A., I make chicken and pork Nacatamales, and I have been selling this kind of food for many years. The people of our country eat Nacatamales all the time! Sara P., She sells popular consumption goods. She has a store in her home that is doing very well, but she needs more products in her business because the needs of her clients are enormous. Magda G.: she sells condiments. This is a ery good business because in our county all the women of the home and people that produce food to sell use a lot of condiments to give flavor to their food. At this time all of us need loans to be able to move ahead with our business, which is why we are requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods to supply a store, Purchase of supplies to make Nacatamales and condiments.

loans.name: Mrs. Dorn Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which is located in Putthi Sam Village in Takeo Province consists of nineteen people and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Dorn H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Luy Pheng, have a 1-hectar field on which they cultivate rice. On this plantation, they now face a small problem because their field now has infertile soil which has a bad effect on their crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Dorn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and to make their crop more productive. Mrs. Dorn H. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Agali Awamu Tukole Group2

texts.en: Rose S. is one of the executive members of Agali Awamu Tukole group in Mityana. She is a farmer and has owned her bean, cassava, maize and matooke plantations for a very long time. When the produce is ready, she sells to her customers from her home and the market at a favorable price. As a result of getting loans, she has been able to buy furniture for her home, keep her kids in school and buy animals like cows and goats for milk and meat. Rose needs a loan to buy produce from other farmers to supply her regular customers.

loans.use: To buy more produce from other farmers

loans.name: Lagise

texts.en: Lagise S., 49, is married and has six children.  She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public four days per week. She has had previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala ($270 US).  SPBD loans are Logise’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase wheel barrow, chemicals, knives, electric saw

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Khuon S., 34, is married and lives in Kandal, Cambodia. She works in a grocery store while her husband is a mechanic and works as a construction worker.  They have three children and all of them attend school. Due to the her low income and school tuition she doesn't have enough money to expand her grocery inventory. Khuon would like to use this loan to add her grocery products.

loans.use: To add her grocery products.

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru: Абдугаффур серьёзный мужчина ,который уже кредитуется пятый год в Микроинвесте.Он каждый свой займ использует для увеличения ассортимента своего товара.Его товар в основном состоит из книг и канцелярских товаров.Товар привозит из Бишкека.По бизнесу в его отсутствии ему помогает его сын.Как отметил сам Абдугаффур благодаря кредитам у него увеличился оборотный капитал и улучшилось состояние семьи.Его жена нигде не работает ,домохозяйка.
texts.en:
Abdugaffor is a serious man who is taking out loans at MicroInvest for five years. He uses every loan to increase the assortment of his merchandise. His inventory consists mostly of books and stationary supplies. He brings in the items from Bishkek. His son helps him with the business when Abdugaffor is absent. As he pointed out himself, thanks to the loans his working capital has increased and the wellbeing of his family has improved. His wife does not work and is a housewife.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues a sus 54 años logró invertir en los estudios de sus hijas quienes después de acabar sus estudios tuvieron la oportunidad de ir a trabajar al extranjero, quedando tan solo ella y su esposo en su hogar. Su habilidad con los peinados y cortes de cabello la motivaron a seguir practicando y capacitándose en la moda que hace 20 años viene realizando. En un inicio practicaba con sus hijas, quienes la apoyaban de la misma forma en la atención de sus clientes, pues en su mayoría visitaban los centros comerciales donde debía peinar y embellecer a las promotoras, lo cual le resultaba muy rentable porque tenía un ingreso seguro. Pero con el tiempo, sus hijas tuvieron la oportunidad de trabajar en el exterior y doña Gladys se quedó sola, sin embargo con el respaldo de su esposo instaló un salón de belleza dentro de su domicilio, donde trabaja y atiende todos los días, ya que esta actividad la llena de alegría y la compañía de sus clientes cubren el vacío que dejaron sus hijas. Gladis desea tener una sucursal en el mercado, donde pueda incrementar su clientela y hacer reconocida su salón de belleza. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, su permanencia y esfuerzo la ayudaron a madurar en su negocio y salir adelante educando a sus hijas. La compra de  insumos para atender en un centro de belleza son costosos, pues requiere de varios productos, en los cuales invertirá Gladis 1000 soles para así seguir trabajando embelleciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very hardworking woman. At 54 years of age, she was able to invest in the education of her daughters, who had the opportunity to travel abroad after completing their studies, leaving just her and her husband at home. Her abilities with hairstyles and haircuts motivated her to keep practicing and training in fashion as she has been for 20 years. In the beginning, she practiced with her daughters, who supported her just as much in attending to her customers. They mostly visited shopping centers where they combed and styled promoters, which she found very profitable because it was a secure source of income. But over time, her daughters had the opportunity to work abroad, and Gladys was left alone. Backed by her husband, however, she installed a beauty salon in her home, where she worked every day because this activity filled her with joy and the company of her customers filled the void left by her daughters. Gladys hopes to have a branch in the market, where she can increase her clientele and make her beauty salon known. This is her seventh loan with MFP. Her tenure and effort helped her mature in her business and get ahead educating her daughters. The inputs for working in a beauty salon are costly, and she requires various products. She will invest 1000 soles in order to keep working to beautify her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and goods for beauty salon

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She has been married for ten years and her husband is a trotro (Urvan) driver.

She sells cereals, such as maize, and groundnuts (peanuts). She treks to the farming communities like Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, which you must visit one day soon. She has been selling food for ten years. She treks frequently to buy goods because she does not have enough money to buy larger quantities. To offset the risk involved, she is requesting a loan to buy cereal and store it. She believes this would save her from frequent traveling.

She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called Amazing Grace. She hopes to receive GH¢900 to improve her business.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy cereals, like maize, and groundnuts in bulk

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con sus tres hijos mayores que velan por su bienestar. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de diversos productos porque tenía que asumir  la responsabilidad de educar a sus hijos, quienes ahora son mayores y velan por ella. Sin embargo,  aun tiene fuerzas para seguir trabajando, y hace 4 años empezó a vender comida en el mercado que esté cerca de su casa, dicho espacio lo obtuvo con mucho sacrificio, pues no es fácil tener un lugar donde vender sin que la municipalidad lo impida. Gracias a esto, sale a vender  con su cochecito de comida todos los días desde el medio día hasta las 3 de la  tarde, para cumplir esta rutina tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar las compras necesarias y preparar los alimentos. A pesar de contar con un espacio donde vender, el deseo de Francisca es mejorar, cada vez más, la calidad de su atención al público. Ella es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal dentro de MFP, donde se siente muy  contenta, pues entre compañeros, tratan de ayudarse en lo necesario frente a los problemas que se les presentan a cada uno. Los 2000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina y víveres, para incrementar la cantidad de platos de comida que satisfagan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking woman who lives with her three adult children who take care of her well being. Since she was young she has worked selling a variety of products as she had to assume responsibility for the education of her children, who now care for her in their adulthood. She still has the strength to keep working, so 4 years ago she began selling food in the market near her home. She had to sacrifice a great deal to get this market spot, as it is not easy to have a location to sell where the municipality will not interfere. Due to this, she makes sales from her little food car every day from noon until 3 pm. To accomplish this, she must wake up very early in order to make the necessary purchases and prepare the food. Despite having a sales place to count on, Francisca's hope is to improve her service more and more. She is one of the founders of her village bank, where she feels very happy. The members try to help one another with the problems that come up for each of them. The money she has requested will be invested in purchasing cooking utensils and supplies to increase the quantity of dishes provided to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing utensils and supplies for her business

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
K. Naim is a married father of two. His family lives in Kanibadam where Naim runs a small grocery store selling food downtown. Naim's store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with work. Naim has been in business for 9 years. Currently he is seeking a loan of $800 US to purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods he offers. Naim had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing additional food to increase his store's inventory

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Рахимова Гузал- молодая женщина 38-ми лет,замужем, имеет троих детей.Занимается купля-продажей скота . Её муж Искандаров Абдурашид  покупает скот на скотных рынках кишлаков и сёл по низким ценам. Гузал  откармливает купленный скот дома в течении недели и продает на скотном рынке Спитаменского района. Кроме этого она и её муж работают в колхозе. Там они имеют небольшой земельный участок и выращивают овощи и пшеницу. Гузал и её муж рады, что кредитуются у нас и намерены продолжить сотрудничество с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
R. Guzal is a young 38 year old woman; she is married and has three children. She purchases and sells livestock. Her husband, Iskandrov Abdurashid, purchases livestock at livestock markets in villages at low prices. Guzal fattens the purchased livestock at home during the week and sells it at the livestock market in the Spitamen region. In addition, she and her husband work at a collective farm. There they have a small plot of land and grow vegetables and wheat. Guzal and her husband are happy that they are our borrowers and are determined to continue their partnership with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mr. C., 27, is a person living in the capital of Phnom Penh. He is married to Meach Thavrom, 21, and they have two children who are still young and attend school. This young couple currently work in the garment industry and they both get specific salaries of $180 per month to manage their family’s living expenses.

This family is facing difficulty with transportation to work because their motorbike is often broken. Because of this obstacle, Mr. C. has decided to ask for a loan to replace his old motor. He proposes to use the remainder of the loan to decorate his old house.

loans.use: To replace his old motor

loans.name: Angélica Del Carmen

texts.es: Angélica Del Carmen C. M. reside en el municipio de San Juan Opico ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad.  Angélica tiene 41 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas Verónica de 15 años de edad y Gabriela de 12 años de edad. Ambas niñas estudian en la escuela. Rigoberto el esposo de Angélica trabaja y aporta a la familia un promedio de 250$ mensuales. Angélica ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares trabajando en su negocio que es un tienda donde vende productos de consumo diario, Angélica posee ganancias diarias que le ayudan a pagar diversos gastos que adquiere con los proveedores de productos para su negocio, Angélica solita un crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando otros productos que son demandados frecuentemente por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Angelica Del Carmen C. resides in the municipality of San Juan Opico located in the state of La Libertad. Angelica is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their two daughters Veronica and Gabriela, who are 15 and 12 years old. Both girls are studying in a school. Rigoberto Angelica's husband works and makes an average of $ 250 a month. Angelica has a small grocery shop to help her husband with the family expenses, and with her daily earnings she helps to pay suppliers’ expenses as well. Angelica is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of some other products that are often requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tahira Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Tahira baji, wife of M. R., has lived the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala City is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a bread-making business. He makes bread on order and sells to the required customers. He sells each loaf for five Pakistan rupees because the flour rate is very high in Pakistan.

Tahira baji is a very caring and supportive lady. She runs her clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of flour to advance his bread-making business. Tahira baji is seated second from the left in the photo, sewing clothes on the sewing machine.

This loan group consists of four additional people: 

Jamila baji and Saeeda baji each want a loan to repair their tractors.

Razia baji and Mukhtayaran baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour for her husband's bread-making business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes Guardón M. vive en Lourdes, municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Junto a su esposo Héctor, manejan una tienda de productos de consumo diario, ubicada en su propia casa.  Tras años de existencia de la tienda, Mercedes se sienta segura, que es el momento de apostar un poco más y reinvertir en el negocio, es por eso, que solicita un préstamo para refinanciar la tienda y ampliar la gama de productos y mercadería.
texts.en:
Mercedes Guardon Mejia lives in Lourdes, a town in the "departamento" of La Libertad. With her husband, Hector, she operates a shop in her house selling everyday items. After years of managing the store, Mercedes feels sure that this is the moment to take a chance and again invest in the business so she's applying for a loan to refinance it and expand the range of products and merchandise on offer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is a 42-year old rice grower and at the sametime a mother of seven children. She is previously having  her 4th loan in CEVI and wishes to avail hopefully her 6th loan and be able to support the growth of her business.

She requested a loan of Php 11,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the laborers who  helped prepare the land.

She said, she likes the services of CEVI because its only 2% interest rate which she thinks very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and payment for farm laborers

loans.name: Arleni

texts.es:
La señora Arleni, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02  hijos, 01 que aun están a cargo de ella. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le motivó a crear su propio negocio de venta mercería, ubicada en el Mercado Central de Ciudad. Día a día fue ganando clientela y con el buen trato que les brinda y los precio bajos que oferta, tiene muy buenas ventas. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando con otros productos considerando la demanda que hoy en día se esta dando. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como cuadros, portafotos, artículos para regalos  como accesoR. de pulseras, anillos y collares, también algunos productos de higiene personal.

Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arleni belongs to the “Mujeres Decididas” (Decisive Women) Community Bank, in the Tarapoto District, in the department of San Martin. She has a partner, is 42 years old and is the mother of two children (one still lives at home and is a dependent) With the fortitude and perseverance that is part of her character, she was motivated to begin her own business selling merchandise. The business is located in the central market of the city. Her client base grows each day. With the good service she provides and the low prices she offers, she has good sales. Actually, she will continue with this business but will make it larger by offering other products. She is doing this after taking in account the current demands for her merchandise. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy a larger variety of products for her business such as notebooks, photo holders and gift articles such as accessories like watches, rings and necklaces. She will also offer personal hygiene products. Arleni is an optimistic worker, thankful for the opportunity to count on loans that help with women and small business development.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es:
Cesarea es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Cesarea es casada, tiene 43 años y 8 hijos, Cesarea tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Cesarea necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Cesarea son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Isaack Oyugi

texts.en:
Isaack is married to Wilkister and they have no children yet.

The client has been in the Kerosene business for five years. He is also a trained teacher and with this profession he gets his secondary source of income. His business is situated in an area where most people use kerosene lamps and stoves for cooking. 

He was introduced to KADET by group member and he is now servicing his fifth loan in KADET. He has not been in arrears for all the loans we have advanced him. With the extra profit he will add stock in the grocery shop.

His future hopes are to be able to develop a piece of land he had bought a longtime ago.

Issack believes he is very hard working.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to stock the kerosene pump with keresone for selling.

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es:
La señora María Ana G. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la venta de cobertores y sobrecamas, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía ya que en está temporada de invierno se vende más, tiene ya varios pedidos para entregar pero necesita pagarle al proveedor para que le entregue más mercancía y así poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá su esposo el señor Juan Zenon Hernández, con su empleo como vigilante de una compañía.
texts.en:
Sra. María Ana G. has been selling quilts and bedspreads for more than 10 years. This business serves as a source of income for her family.

María generates more sales during the winter season, but she is currently lacking a wide variety of merchandise. She has several orders to fulfill, but she needs to pay her supplier for the goods she requested. Otherwise, she will not be able to deliver her orders on time. She plans to repay the loan with the proceeds from her business. Her family expenses are covered by her husband, Sr. Juan Zenon Hernández, who works as a company security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quilts & bedspreads

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia tiene 40 años, es madre soltera con 4 hijos, dos de ellos que tienen la edad de 11 y 15 años y aún viven con ella en su casa.

Ella se dedica a la producción de papa y olluco en las tierras que sus padres le heredaron, ya que anteriormente vendía ropa, pero no le ha ido bien, por lo que tuvo que buscar otra fuente de ingresos, y con mayor razón porque sus hijos estudian en el colegio y tiene muchas necesidades.
Ahora Dionisia alterna los ingresos de la venta de sus papas y olluco; con la de ropa durante los fines de semana. En la foto, muy contenta nos muestra parte de su esfuerzo en sus manos, sus papas cosechadas. La calidad de papa que produjo fue muy bien cotizada en el mercado de la ciudad, sin embargo no logró sembrar lo suficiente debido a la falta de dinero para comprar más abono.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y hasta la fecha siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Asimismo, es responsable con las reuniones de su banco comunal, y las veces que llega tarde paga la multa impuesta por ellos sin ningún reclamo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para aplicar en su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 40 years old and a single mother of 4 children, two of which are 11 and 15 years old and still live with her in her house. She works growing potatoes on the land she inherited from her parents. She previously sold clothing, but it has not been going well, so she had to look for other ways to earn income, especially since her children go to school and she has many needs. Now Dionisia alternates her income from the sale of potatoes with the sales of clothing during the weekends. In the photo, she shows how she is very happy about her efforts with her harvested potatoes in her hands. The quality of potatoes she produced were worth a lot in the city market, however she wasn't able to plant enough because she did not have enough money to purchase more fertilizer. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP and to this day she has always been very punctual with paying her installments. Also, she is responsible attending the communal bank meetings and always pays the fine if she arrives late without a single complaint. The money she is now requesting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers to apply to her next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 48 años, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos adolescentes.
Desde muy joven incursionó en varios oficios para sacar a su familia adelante, actualmente se viene dedicando a su salón de belleza. Con mucho esfuerzo, Gladys logró implementar un espacio de su vivienda para su negocio. Desde entonces atiende a sus asiduos clientes, en su mayoría mujeres, quienes frecuentan mucho su local, pues Gladys es muy carismática y trata muy bien a su clientela, aconsejándolas y conversando con ellas cuando vienen a atenderse, y en algunas oportunidades su madre la apoya como su asistente. 
Para el futuro, Gladys desea seguir extendiendo su negocio y así lograr mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. 

Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, ella es considerada una cliente muy responsable, puesto que paga a tiempo todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos necesarios para su salón, además equiparlo para hacerlo más cómodo a la clientela.
texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years-old and lives with her mother and her two adolescent children. From a very young age Gladys worked various jobs to care for her family. Currently, she has a beauty salon. With a lot of effort, Gladys succeeded in creating a space for the business in her home, and since then she has been attending her regular customers, mostly women, who come often to her salon. Gladys is very charismatic and provides great service to her customers, giving them advice and chatting with them when they come in. Sometimes her mother helps her as an assistant. In the future, Gladys wishes to continue expanding her business and thus earn more income for the benefit of her family. This is Gladys' tenth loan with MFP. She is considered a very responsible client, as she has always made her payments on time. With the funds from this loan she will purchase more products she needs for the salon, and also make it more comfortable for her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi D. is 51 years old. He is married and has three children. In order to support his family Sadi is selling household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and other items. He has been in this business for eleven years. Having this much experience, Sadi is able to choose the goods that meet the requirements of his clients, whose tastes are different. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Sadi to improve the living conditions of his family and to make his kids happy. Sadi has been provided with one loan from the Kiva field partner, IMON. He has shown himself as a meticulous client and has a positive credit history. Today Sadi is requesting $800 for purchasing new household goods to sell, enlarging the extent of his goods. You can be an important part of the growth of Sadi’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new household goods to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., 43, is a married woman who is blessed with three school-aged kids. They live together in a wooden house located in Pursat Province, where she owns a small piece of farm land on which she grows a variety of crops to earn a living. Mrs. Chea S. got married many years ago to Mr. Chomroeun, who is 41 years old and currently sells fresh fish that he buys in bulk from fishermen. Mrs. Chea S. has requested a loan to buy a used motorbike, which will allow to her husband to pick up more fish to bring to the market. (Mrs. Chea S. and her husband are pictured above.)

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a fresh young 20-year-old bachelor. He graduated from intermediate school. 

The purpose of this loan is to develop his grocery store. He has a few employees and hopes to hire more employees to help him in the future. He has been working in this field since his was very young and recently has been able to build his own shop. 

His personal income will increase bit by bit and he hopes to marry when his income is high enough that he can support a happy family. He has a lot of customers, although he is in the blossom of his age. He also has a good reputation in his neighborhood. We foresee him to be a dependable customer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and freezer for his grocery store

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: K. Louise est née le 25 août 1960 à Allada, dans le département de l'atlantique au Bénin. Louise vit depuis 5 ans à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à LATCHOUKPO Bienvenu, un agent de la douane à la retraite, Louise est mère de 4 enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Louise a également un autre enfant à charge. Seulement quelques uns des enfants sont scolarisés. Louise vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Louise mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (maïs, couscous, conserves de tomate, savon, riz etc.). Louise achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Mais c'est à son domicile que Louise effectue la vente de ses produits. Louise a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire mais exerce son activité depuis bientôt 20 ans. Louise a déjà obtenu 2 crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de renforcer son activité, Louise souhaite obtenir un troisième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Louise K. was born August 25, 1960 in Allada, in Benin’s Department of the Atlantic. For the past five years she has been living in the Agla neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Bienvenu LATCHOUKPO, a retired customs agent, and is the mother of four children. She also has another child under her care, and only some of the children are still in school. Louise lives with her husband and children, and the couple share household expenses. To assist her husband, Louise sells a variety of products (corn, couscous, canned tomatoes, soap, rice, etc.) from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Louise has attended school up to secondary level, but has been in business for almost 20 years. She has already been granted two previous loans from ALIDé, which were fully repaid. She is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé, to increase her working capital and bolster her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, coucous, soap, rice, canned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a friendly and hard-working woman. She designs clothes for her customers. She makes both Nigerian and western designs. She also sells tailoring materials at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her home. 

Blessing hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is always happy when her customers patronize her stall. She is itching for expansion in her business. She is married with 4 children. She is 39 years old and her husband works to support the home. Her children are excelling in school. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor M. Bermúdez   realiza su trabajo como chofer de la ruta de bus Somotillo Rodeo Grande dándoles servicio de viajes a todos los clientes de las comarcas.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar de  30 bolsas de cemento  6 quintales de hierro para la construcción  de su casa de habitación y de esta manera tener una mejor condición de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. M. Bermúdez lives in the neighborhood of Germán Pomares in the town of Somotillo. He works as a chauffeur along the Somotillo Rodeo Grande bus route. Jose provides travel services to all of his customers from the region.

He is requesting a loan to buy 30 bags of cement and 6 quintales (1 quintal = 100 kg) of iron so that he can build his house and achieve a better standard of living for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & iron for the construction of his house

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Chaulisma Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen D. Chaulisma, inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Chaulisma, Distrito D. Ayavi, la población se dedica a la ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la crianza D. animales, venta D. abarrotes en general y cereales.
Como es el Caso D. la Señora Marta Eleuteria que es casada, tiene 5 hijos, Eleuteria tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar. Los sueños D. Eleuteria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ahorrar para la educación D. sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 4,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen D. Chaulisma Communal Bank starts its first cycle with ten members. The members are from the Chaulisma community in the Ayavi district. The population raises livestock. The members have different businesses like raising animals and selling general groceries and grains. Such is the case of Marta Eleuteria. She is married and has five children. Eleuteria has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. The loan she will get is to buy rice and sugar. Eleurteria’s dreams are that her children become professionals, to save for her children’s education, and to improve her business. The members need different amounts of loans like 200 PEN and 600 PEN. The total loan for the Communal Bank is 4,800 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is a single mother with six children. She lives in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine where she sells vegetables and fruit in the central marketplace.  She was forced to launch this venture four years ago when she was faced with the tough reality of poverty and a need to provide for her kids’ needs. She started very simply with a small vending stall in the market. Her children have been helping her with this venture as much as they could. Presently, Silviya has about 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Silviya is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her capital and purchase additional fruit and vegetables for sale. One of Silviya’s long-term plans is to open a second vending location and expand her trade. She says she is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices. and push to achieve her goals of being a successful entrepreneur. We believe her perseverance and clear vision will be key factors in her small business success.     
Note: In the photo Silviya is pictured with her son helping her with sales.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Sapamé Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Túcume, conocido por sus pirámides, uno de los principales puntos arqueológicos de la región. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que se casó apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economia familiar. Ella suele trabajar confeccionando pantalones en drill y poliéster, también cría animales para comercializarlos con sus vecinos y con los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. 

Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace seis años, empezó apoyando en un taller y poco a poco fue aprendiendo del oficio, actualmente trabaja con un vecino en la confección de pantalones para caballeros los cuales los vende a un acopiador que revende la mercadería en la sierra del país. 

Por otro lado, lleva dedicándole a la crianza de animales el mismo tiempo que a la confección, cría cerdos y vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han llegado a desarrollarse de manera correcta los ofrece en venta. Estas actividades le sirven para apoyar a su esposo que trabaja como agricultor.

Rosalía desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado para así poder mejorar la calidad de sus animales de modo que pueda obtener mas ganancias, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 25, is married and has three children; she lives with her family in the Sapamé Alto settlement, a rural area of Túcume district, an area known for its pyramids, one of the region’s main archaeological sites. The zone is part of Lambayeque province and it’s located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She has helped her husband support the family ever since she got married. She manufactures dril (a fabric similar to canvas or denim) and polyester pants and she also raises animals to sell to her neighbors and to merchants that visit the area where she lives. She has made clothing for the past six years. She started out helping out in a shop and gradually learned the skills. Currently, she works with a neighbor making men’s pants that are sold to person who gathers goods from several manufacturers to then resell in the country’s mountain settlements. On the other hand, she has raised animals for about the same amount of time since she’s been sewing; she raises pigs and cows in her back yard and when they reach proper weight she sells them. With these activities she helps her husband, who is a farmer, support their family. Rosalía wants to increase her business and needs to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed so that the quality of her animals will improve leading to better profits. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that will help her reach this goal. She is quite a responsible woman that is always watching over her family’s wellbeing and development. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has shown herself to be responsible and punctual when it comes to her installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Pictured here is Fatmata S., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This woman is seeking a loan of SLL 4,000,000 from SMT/Kiva in order to expand her business, make more sales, and consequently improve on her standard of living.

Fatmata is 40 years old and is married with six children – five in secondary school and one in primary school. She was born in Yele village. For many years now, she has been selling dried fish. With the help of this loan, she will be able to get at least four more baskets full of dried fish to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy at least four more baskets full of dried fish to add to her business

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie S. is from the village of Calaran in Calamba. She is 29 years old, married, and has two school-age children. To make a living, Jorgie owns and operates a retail business buying and selling charcoal and copra. Jorgie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jorgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jorgie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase one secondhand unit sidecar. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jorgie from PMPC. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand unit sidecar

loans.name: Erenea

texts.en: Erenea D. P. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in the selling of frozen products and the buying and selling of used materials (scrap). She lives in San Agustine Madredijos, Cebu City, with her husband and their four children, who are 23 to 29 years old. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her frozen products and used materials businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 3,500 Philippine pesos (Php). Erenea is now borrowing Php 18,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her 17th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Erenea aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon . Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 28 year old married lady with two children.  She owns and operates a retail shop in her local community. She has ten years experience in this business.  Josphine is a member of the Ngegu Small Traders group in Faulu Kenya.  In this group, she has learned how to save her money. 

She is requesting for 40, 000 KES for additional supplies of doughnuts, salt, toothbrush, sanitary towels and soap to sell.  Josphine believes that she will manage to meet her customer's needs with additional stock and hence earn a  better income.

loans.use: To add supplies of doughnuts, salt, toothbrush, sanitary towels and soap

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila nació en Ollantaytambo y vive en el barrio de San Isidro de la misma ciudad. Lucila lleva toda la vida rodeada de la ganadería y la agricultura. La mayoría de los pobladores de Ollantaytambo hoy en día ven en el turismo una forma de darse una mejor calidad de vida. 

Lucila en su domicilio a cómodos unos dormitorios para ofrecer servicios de hospedaje a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros que llegan a la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, cada habitación cuesta aproximadamente entre 15 y 20 soles. Ella en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo tiene una casa y lo alquila para un cafetín. Lucila desde muy joven aprendió la cosecha y siembra. La socia tiene una pequeña chacra, al lado de su casa, donde cultiva maíz, papas, cebollas, etc. Hace varios atrás falleció su esposo y se quedo con sus cinco hijos. Lucila desprende una imagen de una señora muy tierna y amable. 

Con su próximo préstamo de $150 USD. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” y es una de las socias fundadoras.
texts.en:
Lucila was born in Ollantaytambo and lives in the neighborhood of San Isidro. She has lived her entire life surrounded by cattle raising and agriculture. The majority of the residents in Ollantaytambo today see tourism as a way to help improve their quality of life. In her home, Lucila rents out a couple of rooms to both Peruvian as well as foreign tourists. Each room costs approximately 15 - 20 soles. Her home is located in the main plaza of Ollantaytambo. From the time she was young Lucila learned how to harvest and plant. She has a small plot of land, alongside her house, where she grows corn, potatoes and onions. Several years ago her husband died and left Lucila with 5 children to support. She exudes the qualities of a kind and friendly woman. With her loan of approximately $150US, Lucila would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is one of the founding members of the communal bank called "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo", or "The Friendship of of Ollantaytambo".

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Heydi Jose

texts.es: La joven de Heydi tiene 30 años.  Es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha salido adelante.  Pues sus inicios  fueron muy difíciles, pues desde joven empezó a trabajar, por lo que necesitaba mantener a su familia. Con esfuerzo y algunos ahorros decidió independizarse y trabajar. Poco a poco obtuvo clientela ahora ella tiene su negocio y trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche la venta de mercadería en general ha sido muy importante. Este financiamiento es para la compra de aretes, pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos y bolsos.
texts.en:
Heidy is 30, she is a single mom, has one son that she has been able to get ahead with great effort and dedication. It was hard from her from the beginning because she had to start working at a very young age to support her family. With hard work and after saving for a while she decided to become an independent worker. She gained clients slowly and now has her own business, she works from 6 am to 7 pm selling general merchandise. This loan is to buy merchandise such as earrings, lipstick, nail polish, perfumes, lotions, skin treatments and handbags.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “La Victoria”, están en el Séptimo Ciclo con 14 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. 
Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos, por lo que están muy interesadas en seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
La señora Rosa quien invirtió su crédito en la compra fideos, panificados, lácteos, arroz, aceite, embutidos y otros productos ya que ella tiene un depende donde vende productos de uso domésticos para generar ingreso para su familia.
La despensa lo tiene en su domicilio y sus clientes lo conforman sus vecinos quienes constantemente recurren a su negocio por la buena atención que ella les brinda.
Ella es una mujer luchadora y siempre esta en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades para su familia y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda crediticia.
texts.en:
The group called themselves "The Victory". They are on their seventh loan cycle and they have 14 members in the group. The group is operates in one district because they are very close and united, and they are very responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit and they are always on time with their payments. They plan on completing this cycle with equally as much responsibility. The loan they request will open many doors of opportunity and they will all progress in their business. They continue to be very intested in working with this organization. Rosa invested her loan in the purchase of pastas, breads, milk products, rice, cooking oil, and other products. She has a store where she sells her goods and this is how she earns an income for her family. She has her grocery store in her house and her clients are mostly her neighbors who constantly patronize her business because she always provides good service. She is a hard working person and she is always on the look out for better opportunities for her family. She is very grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they provide her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pasta, rice, canned foods, breads, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Margaritas L. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive la comunidad de Guacarrumi que  pertenece a la parroquia de Chican en el cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por tener un clima templado, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, en este sector de da una gran variedad de frutas.
 
Este es el séptimo crédito que Doña Rosa realiza en la banca comunal y está muy contenta de formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras.

Se dedica a cultivar lechugas, ajos y papas, también cría chanchos, pollos y cuyes que los son vende en su comunidad.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 26 años, es casada y  tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, sus niños asisten a la escuela de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja elaborando estucos (Cielos rasos), con mucho sacrificio han logrado construir su casa propia.

El nuevo crédito que realiza en la FUNDACION ESPOIR lo va a invertir en la compra de 2 toros para trabajar en sus tierras.

Su sueño es tener una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Margaritas L. is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (United Women) communal bank, and lives in the Guacarrumi community; part of the Chican parish of the Paute hamlet. This hamlet is known for its temperate climate. Its people are farmers and raise livestock and a large variety of fruit is grown in this region. This will be Rosa’s seventh loan through her communal bank and she is very happy to be a part of this group of struggling women. She raises lettuce, garlic, and potatoes. She also raises hogs, chickens, and Guinea pigs, which she sells in her community. Rosa is 26 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 5, who attend the local school. Her husband works applying stucco to ceilings and they are proud to have been able to build their home together. She will use the money from this loan, through Fundacion Espoir, to invest in two bulls which she will use to work her land. Her goal is to improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beasts of Burden

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen lives in a small city in Pakistan called Kasur, which is famous for its leather industry. She lives in the area of kulley wala in a three-room brick house with her family. She is a very talented lady who operates her embroidery business to share the financial burden with her husband. She doesn’t have any children yet. She is married to A. H., who also operates an embroidery business. In fact, all her family is involved in embroidery. Her brother-in-law and sister-in-law also do embroidery. Her mother-in-law embroiders clothes to increase their value. Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, clothes and laces in bulk quantity. The bulk items will enable him to make more embroidered dresses to improve his embroidery business. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years, and Perveen has great expectations that he will be able to successfully improve his business and increase his household income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years she has proved herself a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies for embroidery business

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
La señora Ema  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la zona de Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz; esta casada y  la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de cereales en un taller que instalo en su casa; el esposo trabaja como empleado en una fabrica donde percibe un salario mínimo.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos (quinua, soya, etc.) y seguir elaborando los cereales ya que esta actividad es la que le genera mas ingresos.

Es  cliente de Impro desde el año 2006 con un historial de pagos  bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ema lives in her own house along with her husband and sons in the Gran Poder zone of La Paz.  She works making cereals in a workshop she built in her home.  Her husband works in a factory where he receives minimum wage.

The loan Ema is requesting is to buy raw materials (quinoa, soy, etc.) and continue making cereals, since it’s how she generates the most income.

Ema has been a client of Impro since 2006 and has a good history payment, which is why she can request another loan.

loans.use: Compra de insumos como quinua y soya para la producción de cereales.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung T. is 22 years of age and a married woman. In order to fix the needs of the family, Mao Soung T. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has a few years of experience in this sector and is earning approximately of $4.50 per day. To help contribute towards the family's expenses, her husband operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboard.

This couple has been married for years and they have only one kid who attends school. Soung T. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for farming. Soung T. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for farming.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W. M., age 42, decorates vehicles for a living. His car decoration business is situated in Ngara market which is near the center of Nairobi. Many garages are located in this area, so he has a great opportunity for his business. He is married to Mary who is a business lady, and they have one child aged 12. Peter was introduced to Kadet by another Kadet client.

Peter has been running his business for twenty years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 9000. With this loan, he wants to use Kshs 25000 to buy stickers and Kshs 5000 to advertise his business. If the loan boosts the business, Peter will increase his stock of stickers and eventually will buy a piece of land for farming. Peter describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy stickers for car decorations to advertise his business.

loans.name: Melia

texts.es: Melia, de 42 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 2 hijos: Isbet, de 4 y Yordy, de 1 año de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven juntos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Esa mirada seria que muestra Melia, es reflejo de la vitalidad y fuerza que tiene, pues a pesar de las diversas dificultades que tuvo en la vida, logró sus objetivos. Terminó sus estudios de docencia, ahora es profesora en una escuela del estado peruano, donde enseña a leer y escribir a niños menores, su trabajo es muy bueno y sacrificado, por ello la nombraron supervisora del programa de alfabetización del estado, donde enseñan a leer y escribir a personas de avanzada edad que no pudieron estudiar. Pero la actividad que le enseñaron desde niña, es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años, dedicándose a la siembra de café, plátano y yuca, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa, en la cooperativa de su comunidad, como también en diversos mercados de su ciudad. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y agradece a su banco comunal, por darle la oportunidad de salir adelante con su negocio. Ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de una motocicleta que oscila entre los 4 mil soles aproximadamente. Con la compra de la motocicleta podrá trasladarse con mayor facilidad asía sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en: Melia, who is 42 years old, is a courageous single mother of 2 children: Isbet, who is 4 years old and Yordy, who is 1 year old.  The three live together as a family unit in their own home, which is located in the Sanchirio community (in the central Peruvian jungle). The serious look Melia has in the photo is a reflection of her vitality and strength.  In spite of the various difficulties her life has given her, she has achieved her goals.  She completed her teaching studies and is now a teacher in a Peruvian state school where she instructs young children in reading and writing.  Because she is very good at her job and self-sacrificing, she was appointed as the supervisor of the State Literacy Program, which teaches elderly people who never had a chance to go to school to read and write.  But the activity she was taught as a young girl was agriculture.  For 20 years, she has been making a living planting coffee, banana trees and cassava.  After each harvest, she sells her produce in the community cooperative and in the various markets in her city.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful to her communal bank for giving her the opportunity to move her business forward.  She is thinking of investing the loan in the purchase of a motorcycle that fluctuates in price around 4 thousand soles, approximately.  With the purchase of the motorcycle, she will be able to get to and from her farmland more easily.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle so she can get to and from her farmland.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 39 years old. Bebiana is married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 18 years old while the youngest is only 2 years old. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling banana ques and other delicacies. 

Bebiana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Mrs. Oeurng Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who live in Krang Chamraeun village, Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Oeurng P. to become the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes which  can improve their family's living conditions. 

Mrs. Oeurng P., a widow with a child who is five years old, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family and she also weaves silk. Since her weaving is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Oeurng P. is asking for a loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave.

loans.name: Margarita Bella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

Para la señora Margarita este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 41 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos de 23, 22 y 14 años, el menor de ellos estudia en escuela y es quien vive en su casa.

Es una gran ama de casa que para solventar los gastos de su casa y los de su hijo trabaja vendiendo productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además también vende ropa de todo tipo.  Trabaja tres días a la semana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, entre otros. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Av. Del Ejército" meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí. The city has been known for years for its Royal Tamarind trees.
 
This is Margarita's second loan with the communal bank, which she likes because of the way the bank works with her in helping her acquire the loans. She is 41 years old and is a single mother of three children ages, 14, 22 and 23. The youngest lives at home and is still in school.
 
Margarita is a great homemaker. To cover living costs and her sons expenses, she works selling Avon products (beauty products, makeup, perfumes and women's accessories). She also sells several types of clothing. She works three days a week selling her products door to door. Clients place orders and she collects payments either weekly or biweekly, depending on the customer's preference. The Avon products are delivered to her home and she picks up the clothing from a distributor located in the downtown area.

She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, pants, shirts, blouses and other related goods.  Margarita currently lives with her parents but she dreams of one day owning her own home.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, makeup, pants, shirts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
K. Rasul is 48 years old, married and has two children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Rasul is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. To do this, he needs $2500 USD to purchase additional young cattle. Rasul has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William de 36 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica a vender maíz, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, William trabajaba anteriormente como motorista de buses, luego decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de maíz, este negocio es el que cubre las necesidades del hogar.
Él actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz al por mayor, esta compra ayudara a tener más inventario y así mejorar sus ventas ya que dicha inversión al obtenerla por mayor cantidad también le darán buen precio como mayorista, quedándole por cada venta un margen de ganancia.
Su objetivo es trabajar por lograr una tienda fuerte, tener contactos de mayoristas, para crecer en el comercio, esperando aumentar cada vez más sus ventas, y velar por el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
William is a 36-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8, in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután, selling corn for a living. William used to work as a bus driver, then decided to buy and sell corn. This is the business that covers the household expenses.
He is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase wholesale corn. This purchase will help him increase his inventory, thus boosting sales because buying the corn wholesale will leave him a margin of profit for every sale.
His goal is to work hard in order to strengthen his store, have wholesale contacts, and grow in the business sphere, hoping to increase his sales each time, and monitor his family's well-being.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale corn

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio, 50 years old, lives in the town of Sto. Niño with his family. He is engaged in farming and primarily plants rice crops, selling his harvest to his community. Bonifacio wishes to succeed in his business and also hopes for the time when he will have his own money for capital. Right now, he is very thankful to be a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of 17000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Bonifacio says his previous loans helped a a great deal in sustaining his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, additional seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
Manuel soltero, tiene cuatro hijos ya todos mayores, planes que sus hijos salgan adelante para un mejor futuro. Tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoras en su casa para mayor seguridad, comodidad. Trabaja para una empresa privada como guardia de seguridad desde hace un tiempo, para realizar su proyecto ha tenido dificultades por falta de financiamientos. 
Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo ya que con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrín, laminas de zinc, clavos entre otros materiales para la entechar y repellar las paredes de la casa el tiene conocimiento de construcción siéndole de facilidad para iniciar a realizar las mejorar necesaria de mano de la financiera.
texts.en:
Manuel is single and has four children who are already grown. His plans include helping his children move forward so they will have a better future.

Manuel needs to make improvements to his home to provide greater safety and comfort. He has been working for a private business as a security guard for some time. Manuel wants to complete this home improvement project but he has had difficulty due to a lack of financing.

He is grateful for the financial support being provided through this loan. Manuel plans to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, sheets of zinc, nails, and other materials to install a roof and repair the walls of his house. He has construction knowledge, so he can easily complete the necessary work with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed for home improvements.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 34 years old and single. He has a mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley Kenya that produces milk and tea. He has been in the farming business for ten years now and employs one farmhand. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to expand his business. He faces the challenges of poor roads and not enough food for his animals.  He would like to improve his dairy farming business in future by building a dairy unit and planting more pastures.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James M. is 33 years old and  married to Rose who is a business lady. They live in the Bukenye area in Kakamega and they have two children aged 14 years and two years old.

James has a business selling chickens and has been in it for the past 10 years. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD and intends to use the money to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. His monthly profit is KES. 7,500 that he uses to cater for his family’s basic needs. 

He hopes to venture into a dairy business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen
