texts.es: Lilian del Carmen A. S. de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en San Juan Opico en el departamento de la Libertad. Ella vende productos de cosmetología en su residencia y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan, sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los vende a un buen precio; Lilian es muy amable siempre recibe a sus clientes con la mejor disposición. Quiere abastecer su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como tintes, shampo, acondicionadores, cremas, cosméticos entre otro, de esta manera ella podrá sacar adelante su negocio para Lilian la posibilidad de realizar su sueño de darle a su familia una vida plena ha hecho su vida más interesante pues le ha dado la oportunidad de superarse y además llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Lilian del Carmen A. S., age 36, lives with her husband and her two children in San Juan Opico, located in the department of La Libertad. She sells cosmetics from her home and recently has developed a very substantial client base because she always has what her clients need, because her products are of good quality, and also because she sells them at a good price. 

Lilian is a very kind person and always gives her clients great attention and positive attitude. She would like to purchase inventory for her business and is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that would allow her to buy products such as dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams, cosmetics, and others. For Lilian, the possibility to realize her dream of giving a better life to her family has made her life more interesting because it gave her a challenge and the ability to bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams, and cosmetics

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam P., 41, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She is married to Keit Rin, 43, who is a farmer, and they have four children. Three of her daughters work in the garment industry as sewing workers. 

She is a rice farmer who plants rice crops on her farmland. In addition, she also sells items such as sweets, vegetables, meat, cooked ingredients, soft drinks, and other inventory in her wooden kiosk. She earns an average of $2.5 a day. 

Sam P. is requesting a Kiva loan to buy some wooden poles for replacing the broken floor and to pay for mending costs.

loans.use: to buy some wooden poles for replacing the broken floor and to pay for mending costs.

loans.name: Calixte Lamidi

texts.fr: Né le 08 Octobre 1973, Calixte Lamidi est marié à Foumilayo une marchande. Le couple à cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont les leurs. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Calixte Lamidi et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Calixte Lamidi n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, mais a appris le métier de soudure ; activité qu’il exerce depuis dix huit ans et qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Calixte Lamidi  désire agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels de soudure (plieuse, fer, etc.). Calixte Lamidi s’approvisionne  au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Calixte Lamidi demande l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et  son revenu.
texts.en:
Calixte Lamidi was born on October 8, 1973. He is married to Foumilayo, a merchant. The couple supports five children, four of whom are theirs. The children are all in school. Calixte Lamidi and his wife live in the same house with their children. The various family expenses are covered by the couple. 

Calixte Lamidi only attended primary school. But he learned the trade of welding, an occupation he has been working at for eighteen years. It enables him to meet the requirements of his customers and to ensure the various family expenses are covered. He would like to expand his welding shop by acquiring welding supplies (a bending machine, iron, etc.)  He gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

This is the second time that has asked for financial support from ALIDé, so as to boost his level of business and to grow his customer base and his revenues.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies (a bending machine, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. He would like to develop his business by increasing his livestock and cultivating more land. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase sheep, special sorts of potato seeds and fertilizer.

With the loan’s help, Artak will increase his working capital and expand his business further. He lives together with his wife, pensioner mother, son and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for sheep, special sorts of potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Muema

texts.en:
Muema is a 37-year-old  married  man with four children.  To earn a living for his family, he sells vehicle tires.  He says he has engaged in the business for over ten years.  He has grown the business and employs two people.  
Muema works hard in his business so as to educate his children.  He is able to retain his customers in a very competitive environment because of his good services.  He hopes to buy a lorry for use in his business.  He has requested for 50,000 kenyan shillings to buy more tires.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle tires

loans.name: Huot

texts.en: Mrs. Huot, age 46, is a garment factory worker in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She has worked in this job for over a year, and gets a formal salary each month. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the farm field as a domestic rice cultivator. They have three children who are already married. Mrs. Huot will use the loan in the amount of $400 to plant a rice crop and repair her old motorbike which she always rides to her work but now it is broken down.

loans.use: to plant a rice crop and repair her old motorbike.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 35 years old, married and with four children in school.  She runs a tailoring business to earn a living.  Her business is only one year old.  

She was previously selling fabric to earn a living.  She also relies on her husband who is employed for financial support.  Jackline hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested a 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Edita Elirita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edita, ella tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos todos son mayores de edad, con ellos viven dos  nietos que los crió desde pequeñitos y que son como sus hijos ellos tienen 16 y 10 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es comerciante. 

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, carne, pescado, camarón, queso y también ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00. Nos cuenta que tiene  su tienda hace treinta años y  que esta le permitió  ganarse la vida y también estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de sus nietos. Los productos los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, artículos de papelería y otros productos. Lleva  12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido de la institución.
 
Su sueño es que su tienda siga creciendo.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita of the Portoviejo canton, we find a place known as Los Arenales. Here the Nueva Generación credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Edita. She is 58 years old, married and has 8 children. All of them are grown. Two grand children live with them whom she has raised since they were small and are like her own children. They are 16 and 10. The oldest is in high school and the youngest in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.   

She has a store in her house. She sells rice, sugar, meat, fish, shrimp, cheese as well as certain remedies and variety store items. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She tells us that she has had her store for thirty years and this has allowed her to earn a living and also keep up with her children's and grandchildren's needs. She buys the products in the city of Portoviejo although she receives most of them at her locale. 

This loan is to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, paper products and more. She has been in the credit group for 12 years and she likes the benefits she has received from the institution. 
 
Her dream is for her store to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, paper items and other products.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Ruth tiene 24 años de edad y nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella es profesora de informática y computación del instituto “INFORTEK”. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar sus estudios de la carrera profesional de Derecho.  Ella anhela realizarse como profesional y abrir una empresa consultora de informática.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Molinto II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

Ruth is 24 years old and was born in the city of Cusco. She lives in the city of Cusco, which is where she develops her business activities. Ruth is a professor of Information Systems and Computer Science at the INFORTEK Institute. She has been providing this service for four years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Ruth is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for her studies toward a law degree. She dreams of becoming a professional and opening a computer consulting firm.

loans.use: to pay for her studies toward a law degree.

loans.name: Maria Julieta

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Julieta le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y construir la barda alrededor de la casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que necesita y es (pintura, block, cemento, arena, varilla) y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Doña Maria Julieta tener mas seguridad, protección y con mejor calidad de vida de su familia. 
Planean pagar el crédito con las el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una agencia como encargada y su esposo el señor Pablo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como técnico automotriz de una compañía de carros.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Maria Julieta is lacking the exterior finishes and a security wall around her house. She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials such as paint, blocks, cement, sand, and rods, as well as pay to have someone perform the work. As a result, Doña Maria Julieta will be able to provide more security, protection, and a better quality of life for her family.

She plans to repay the loan with the salary she earns from her job working for an agency as a manager. Her husband Sr. Pablo will take care of the family expenses with the income he earns from his job as a mechanic of an automobile fleet.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to complete the exterior finishes of her house and to build a security wall.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a maize selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Elsa Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa es socia del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, este lugar cuenta con una gran belleza natural y su gente es muy hospitalaria, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. 

Doña Elsa tiene 51 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 28, 26, 24 y 15 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora Elsa se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, cerdos y cuyes, a los que los vende en su comunidad. También labora como empleada domestica.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para animales.

Su meta es hacer algunos arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the 'El Cruce hacia el Futuro' community bank.  She lives in Shinincay parish.  This area has great natural beauty and the local people are very hospitable.  The cuisine is wide ranging and the people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.

Elsa is 51 years old, divorced and has four children from her marriage who are 28, 26, 24 and 15.  Her eldest three children are married and live independently.  Her youngest (a daughter) is attending a high school in the city.  She owns the house in which she lives.

Elsa's business is raising and selling chickens, pigs and guinea pigs which she sells in her community.  She also works as a maid.

Elsa has been a member of her community bank for five years and she will invest her new loan in buying chickens and animal feed.  Her goal is to make some repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 48 años, esta casada con Mariano de 69 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Puerto Cocos, Pichari. Ella es una excelente cocinera, pues sabe preparar ricos potajes, que son del gusto del cliente. En un inicio le fue difícil tener un posicionamiento que ahora tiene, pero gracias a su paciencia, sazon y dedicación ha logrado ser la preferida frente a la competencia. Además es su esposo es quien más la ayuda en éste trabajo, él se encarga de atender a la clientela y dar la mejor cordialidad posible para hacerlos sentir cómodos; asimismo cuenta con una joven que la aydua en la cocina. Ella está contenta con el negocio que tiene, sin embargo de proveerse de toda clase de productos, pues tiene pedidos de un platillo típico, más de la sierra peruana, por lo que le resulta difícl conseguir ciertos insumos para tal comida. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles, podrá comprar sillas para implementar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Teresa is 48 years old and married to 69-year-old Mariano with whom she has two children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Puerto Cocos community, in Pichari.

Teresa is an excellent cook who knows how to prepare delicious stews which are to her customers' tastes.  At first it was difficult to achieve the positioning that she now has but, thanks to her patience, the good flavor of her food and her commitment, she has managed to become more popular than her competitors.  Her husband is the one who helps her the most in her work.  He takes care of serving the customers and providing them with the most friendly service possible in order to make them feel comfortable.  Teresa also has a young girl who helps her in the kitchen.  She is happy with the business that she has.  However, she must obtain all kinds of products.  For example, if she receives orders for a dish which is more typical of the mountain region of Peru, it becomes difficult to get hold of certain supplies she needs.

This will be Teresa's third loan from MFP and she pledges, once more, to make her repayments on time.  She will use her 2,000 soles to buy chairs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena, de 21 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa variada para Dama,caballeros,y niños, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 Años,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque apesar de las adversidades a podido salir adelante, y sus ventas aumentan dia a dia,a pesar de su corta edad piensa poner un local mas grande para surtir mejor a sus clientes,y ofrecerles mas variedad en estilos y asi de la misma manera seguir vendiendo y ayudar a su familia,el sueño de ella es ayudar a sus hermanos a que estudien y tengan su propio negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa por mayor y surtir un poco mas su local,en estilos y tamaños.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 21, and sells a variety of women's, men's and children's clothing. She has been in this business for five years. She tells us that she's happy, because in spite of hardships, she has been able to move forward in her life. 

Her sales increase day by day, and in spite of her young age, she is thinking of setting up a larger shop.  This will enable her to better supply her customers, and offer them more variety in styles, so that she can continue selling and helping her family. Her dream is to help her siblings continue their education, and have their own business.

She is applying for this loan to buy clothing at wholesale, and stock her shop with a few more styles and sizes.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her kiosk such as rice, sugar, wheat flour, eggs, cooking spices, etc

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed . 
Estrella has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy merchandise to sell in her shop.
Estrella is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 46 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past four years, Peace has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chickens. To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 1, 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more feed for the chickens and will help Peace to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. 

Peace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the chickens,

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El Sr. José es de Ciudad del Este, tiene 3 hijos, quienes aun están en la escuela. Nos comenta que tiene una pequeña carpintería hace más de tres años, cuya producción y venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Comenta que su esposa siempre lo ayuda en la administración de su negocio. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus obras es que cada día tiene más clientes. Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa.
El tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas terciadas para abastecer su carpintería.
texts.en: Jose is from Ciudad del Este, he has three children, who are still in school.  He's had a small carpentry shop for more than three years, production and sales continue to increase, generating good income for him.  He mentions that his wife helps him with the management of the business.  Thanks to the good quality of his products, he continues to have more clients.  Now he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with a loyal and growing client base.  He really wants to get ahead and requests a loan to buy plywood to supply his shop.

loans.use: to buy plywood for his shop.

loans.name: Wekhonya Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wekhonya Group in Western Kenya! Deborah is the facilitator of the Wekhonya group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Deborah takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Deborah had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Deborah was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Deborah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Deborah will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Wekhonya Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: El Huamuchi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el Huamuchi está  conformado por diez integrantes mujeres trabajadoras  con deseos de  superarse y hacer mas grandes sus negocio.
Sus integrantes dedicidieron ponerle así por que en su colonia hay  palos de huamuchi una futa dulce  y sabrosa.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Obdulia  una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de comida y  cuanta con un lavado de autos desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Simón  a quien quiere y le agradece por el apoyo que le ha dado para  seguir con su negocio ya que ella se dedica más a la venta de comida y descuida el lavado de autos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar  más material como es: cubetas, jabón liquido, aromatizantes y escobas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
María Magdalena- quien se dedica a la venta de
Blanca  Luz- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Inés – quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Amely- quien se dedica a la venta de guisados.
Carmen- quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
María Guadalupe- quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Elvira- quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
María del Carmen- quien se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Margarita Rubí- quien se dedica a la  venta de zapatos.
	Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha dado para  seguir triunfando en la vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Huamuchi” and is made up of 10 hardworking women with a desire to succeed and grow their businesses.

The members decided to name the group this way because there are Huamuchi trees in their neighborhood and the fruit is sweet and delicious.

Obdulia is one of the members.  She’s a hardworking woman who sells food and also has a car wash.

She’s happily married to Simón, whom she loves and appreciates for the support he’s given her to continue her business, since she’s been focusing more on her food business and neglecting her car wash.

She requested this loan to buy more supplies, such as buckets, liquid soap, air fresheners, and brooms.

The other members of the group are:

María Magdalena – sells things
Blanca Luz – sells clothing
Inés – sells Mexican food
Amely – sells stews
Carmen – sells bread
María Guadalupe – sells food
Elvira – sells fish
María del Carmen – sells livestock
Margarita Rubí – sells shoes

They want to thank the foundation for the support they’ve gotten that allows them to continue succeeding in life.

loans.use: to buy carwash supplies

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru:
Турсун 62 года, вдова. После распада Советского Союза , Турсун начала заниматься животноводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Турсун начала свой бизнес  со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), и смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 20 голов баранов, 9 коров и 1 лошадь,  с ежемесячной прибылью в 20,000 сом (KGS). Молочные продукты, такие как молоко, кефир, сметана, творог, а также мясо, Турсун продает на центральном рынке города Узген.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и кормов для них. Доходы Турсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота через покупку племенного жеребца, а в будущем  -построить дополнительный сарай.
texts.en: Tursun is 62 years old, a widow.  After the breakup of the Soviet Union, she became involved in animal husbandry, which grew into the primary source of financial support for her family.  Tursun started her business with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS) and was able to grow her business to currently have twenty heads of rams, nine cows and one horse, and yielding a monthly profit of 20,000 som (KGS).  Tursun sells dairy products, such as milk, kefir, sour-cream, cottage cheese, and meat at the central market in the town of Uzgen.  In order to further grow her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock and fodder for them.  Tursun plans to invest the profits into further increasing livestock headcount through a purchase of a breeding stallion, and wants to build an additional barn in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and fodder

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, 5 de ellos mayores de edad los mismos viven en Manta con sus familias los  2 menores aun viven con ella y estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su  esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos venden recipientes y otros productos de plástico, trabajan desde las 6h00 hasta las 16h00,  salen a ofrecer sus productos en los campos ya que por allá estos productos son muy solicitados y los venden muy bien. Ellos compran estos  productos en Picoaza en un lugar que le dejan a  buen precio  para que ellos tengan ganancias. Llevan más de 15 años dedicados al comercio y gracias a Dios siempre les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos y embases de plástico.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para vender sus productos con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know work and dedication to family.

We met María, 48, here.  She’s married and has seven children.  Five of them are adults and live in Manta with their families and two of them are minors living with her and attending school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She and her husband are merchants; they sell plastic containers and other plastic ware.  They work from 6am until 4pm.  They go out into the countryside to sell their items because they are in high demand out there and they sell well.  They buy their products in Picoaza at a place where the prices are good so that they can earn profits.  They’ve been doing this kind of work for more than 15 years and thank God have always done well.

She will use this loan to buy plastic ware and containers.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 cycles and likes it because of the ease in obtaining loans.  Her dream is to buy a car to sell her products more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy plastic products and containers.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Roberto es una persona muy trabajadora que desde hace aproximadamente 17 años viene vendiendo frutas a sus clientes, y con este negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde vive con su esposa y su hijo. Roberto viene trabajando en el sector hace unos 12 años y gracias a este tiempo ha logrado posicionarse en el sector y así captar cada vez más clientes para su negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas y crecer cada vez más generando mayores ingresos para su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital y su negocio requiere algunos mantenimientos, Roberto busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una nueva carreta y nuevas canastillas para ofrecer sus frutas y así hacer su negocio más atractivo para sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá ofrecer una mejor imagen captando más clientes y así aumentando sus ventas considerablemente; con lo que su familia gozará de mejores ingresos optando por tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Compra de una nueva carreta y nuevas canastillas para ofrecer sus frutas y así hacer su negocio más atractivo para sus clientes.

loans.name: Sabaly 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  SABALY 7sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOUGATIE, un des villages de Yanfolila, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  KARIATOU SEKOU, 5ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  FOUGATIE , après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Envigado desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es una cafetería.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Doris y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Doris desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats for the business

loans.name: Vakhid

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, Karakhanbeyli village. He settled in the Kayidish village, Fizuli region. He is married and has 2 children. He runs a small business selling clothes for men and women. He has been in the clothing business for over 5 years. His diligent, hard work has helped him to succeed in business.
He has rented a small shop in a fair.Now he needs a loan of $800 o buy this shop.

loans.use: To buy the shop that he now rents

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en:
Faapaia counts the land she lives on as a blessing. The soil is suitable for planting taro and bananas and raising cattle, and they own a lot of acres. Faapaia’s husband used to work for the Agriculture department but is now running his own business with the help they received from SBPD. Faapaia joined the program because she wants to extend water pipelines and fencing that separates the cattle from the plantation.

They weren’t qualified to apply for a loan at the local banks. The cows they raise are useful for faalavelaves (family events and obligations) and can also be sold when their money supply is short.

loans.use: Purchase of salt licks for cattle, nails, hammer, roll of copper wire for fence

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie L. is married with four children.  She sells hot peppers, peanuts, and beans wholesale and retail.  Although her husband is self-employed as a mobile trader, his income is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses. As with most families in Sierra Leone, both parents need to work to make ends meet to provide for basic needs.  At thirty-six years old, Marie is willing to work hard to provide for her family’s future.  She is requesting the loan to expand her inventory to increase profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory of agriculture products for wholesale and retail

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar P. and his wife have a stand along the highway Acceso Sur where they work every day. They sell all products that contain honey which includes syrup, pan de miel, and other types of sweet products. They wake up at 6 in the morning to travel to set up their stand and usually work until 6 at night. Weekends are their busiest days. The number of people that buy from them each day varies. Most of their customers are people that pass by on the highway.

Before starting their stand, La Paraguayita, they used to make their own products to sell at their house. Now, they simply buy their products from Oscar's father-in-law's factory, Fruteria Paraguari, to resell.

Oscar is very happy with his business and thankful for the opportunities that his previous loan has provided him. Due to the nature of his business, his capital is very small. Thus, with his new loan, he seeks to invest in his business and be able to buy his merchandise in larger quantities. He is also thinking of new ways to expand his business and perhaps to build a sturdier stand.

loans.use: Buy pan de miel, syrup, and other honey products.

loans.name: Tuhtajon

texts.ru:
Tuhtajon was among the first MicroInvest clients/borrowers in Spitamen. Since then for the last 5 years she has been one of the best clients for MicroInvest in the region. It was her example that helped many others gain trust in the loan program and to become clients themselves.

Tuhtajon is 55 years old, married and has 4 children. All her children now have families of their own. Her husband also works and helps her out in the stall on weekends. Loans play a big part in Tuhtajon’s business, allowing her to buy her inventory wholesale. The profit she makes significantly helps the family budget and Tuhtajon considers it her duty to help her husband support the family. The extra money also allows her buy sweet treats for her grandchildren when they come to visit their grandmother.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Тухтажон одна из первых клиентов Микроинвест в Спитамене. С тех пор в течении 5 лет она является одной из лучших клиентов Микроинвест в этом регионе. Следуя ее примеру многие предприниматели поверили в займы и стали активными клиентами. В бизнесе Тухтажон займы играют немаловажную роль. Она имеет возможность закупить товар оптом. Тухтажон 55 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Все дети имеют свои семьи, а ее муж тоже работает. По выходным дням он выходит помогать торговать. Прибыль от бизнеса вносит весомую лепту в семейный бюджет Тухтажон. Она считает, что этим должна помогать мужу содержать семью. Кроме этого она имеет возможность покупать сладости своим внукам, когда они приходят навещать бабушку.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar is 50 years old, married to Delia. They have three children, one is married and the other two are university students, one is studying medicine and the other law.

Oscar worked for a few years in a jewelry shop where he learned how to make jewelry, then after acquiring enough experience he decided to become independent and he opened his own shop.

Today he makes and sells gold and silver jewelry, such as hoop earrings, rings, necklaces, bracelets, watches, etc. Oscar is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of silver and gold to make his jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Oscar tiene 50 años, está casado y su esposa se llama Delia. Tienen tres hijos, uno de ellos ya esta casado y los otros dos son estudiantes universitarios, uno de ellos de la carrera de medicina y el otro de derecho (leyes).

Oscar trabajó varios años en un taller de joyería donde aprendió el oficio de joyero, luego de adquirir bastante experiencia decidió independizarse y abrio su propio taller.

Actualmente se dedica a la fabricación y venta de joyas de plata y oro, como aros, anillos, cadenas, brazaletes, relojes, dijes, etc. Oscar solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de plata y oro para la fabricación de sus joyas.

.

loans.use: Purchase silver and gold to make jewelry.

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.en: Mahsudjon M. lives in B.Gafurov. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and recommends himself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial services and trade. He is a taxi driver but is engaged in the business of selling meat products (salami, sausages, meat and other products). Mr. M. works in the Friday bazaar, where his shop is located. He is also engaged in fruit selling and has a wide assortment and permanent clients. Being a straight supplier, he has the opportunity to work with clients of different income levels. But working in the bazaar he has stiff competition, which is why he wants to widen the existing sales outlet. Now he requests a loan of 2,800 TJS (US$825) for business support and to widen the existing sales outlet .

loans.use: business support and to widen the existing outlet

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 35-year-old Stumai K.. She is married with one child, age 3, and has one other dependent who is her younger sister. In 2004 Stumai established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $175 in order to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a married mother with one child. She has been a trader for the past four years. Her husband is a carpenter.

She is requesting $525 to buy cement and plywood. She would also like to expand her product range so she can sell cosmetics as well.

Mary is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy cement and plywood.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelida is 41 years old. She has advanced studies and she specialized in accounting. But she never excercized her career because of personal reasons. She has three children who depend on her. She lives in the district of El Cortijo, in the province of Trujillo, in the department La Libertad in Peru.

Nelida has a small stand in the marketplace “El Cortijo” where she sells beauty products, and gifts like: ornaments, stuffed animals, dolls, etc, and she has also installed a small bookstore where she sells notebooks and school supplies. Before she invested in this business she used to sell clothing that she bought in Lima. She stopped selling clothing because she got pregnant and so then she was unable to travel to Lima. She then began selling various products from her stand.

Mrs. Nelida belongs to the communal bank “ Nuevo Peru” where she received her firt loan of 300 Soles and with that money she bought several products that were on sale in the catalogs of “Esika.”

With the loan of 800 soles, wich she will repay in six months, she will invest in buying school supplies uniforms for the school campaign.

Her biggest dream is to have a stand in the city of Trujillo where she will sell beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelida tiene 41 años de edad, ella cuenta con estudios superiores en la carrera técnica la especialidad de contabilidad pero no ejerció su carrera por motivos personales. Tiene tres hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

En su pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado zonal El Cortijo vende productos de belleza, regalos como: adornos, peluches, muñecas, etc., además, ha instalado una pequeña librería en el que vende cuadernos y útiles de escritorio. Antes de ingresar en este negocio se dedicaba a la venta de ropa por el cual viajaba a Lima para traer algunos pedidos que le hacían anticipadamente pero abandono el negocio porque salio embarazada y no podía viajar; por lo cual consiguió un puesto en donde ofrecer varios productos.

La señora Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos en oferta de los catálogos de “esika”.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en seis meses lo invertirá en comprar útiles escolares y uniformes de colegio para la campaña escolar.

Su mayor sueño es alquilar un stand en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo, en el que venda productos de belleza.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell.

loans.name: San Juditas 1 Group

texts.es:
Teresa is 40 years old and has been running a small clothing business for the past 10 years. She sells clothes mainly to women and children. She buys the merchandise in the state capital, and with the loan she receives she will purchase more clothing to sell. This way she will not have to travel so much. The income will help support both the business and Teresa's two children. The other members of the group are: Maria Margartia R. R. (sells quilts and bedspreads), Fabiola Isabel R. R. (sells groceries), Petra Paola R. G. (breeds chickens), and Hilda J. G. (sells frets).

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

TERESA TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE DIEZ AÑOS DE EDAD TIENE UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO DE VENTADE ROPA EN SU MAYORIA PARA NIÑOS Y MUJERES, LA MERCANCIA LA COMPRA EN LA CAPITAL DEL ESTADO, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA Y ASI NO VIAJAR TAN SEGUIDO, LAS GANANCIAS SIRVEN PARA MANTENER EL NEGOCIO Y MANTENER SUS 2 HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. MARIA MARGARITA R. R. VENDE COLCHAS, SABABAS Y COBIJAS POR CATALOGO, FABIOLA ISABEL R. R. VENTA DE ABARROTES, PETRA PAOLA R. G. CRIAZA DE POLLOS Y HILDA J. G. VENDE TRASTES.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products to resell in her community

loans.name: Tawakaltu Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the group leader of Tawakaltu. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband also has a small business and both are working hard to make their family to poverty-free.

The group members sell dried fish and assist each other in purchasing the fish from the supplier in turns. Before their previous loans, the members purchased the fish on credit and thus earned less profit, but the loan enabled them build their capital. The group members would like to increase their stocks and are therefore requesting a loan of Le.2600000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To increase stock of dried fish

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata B. is a 50-year-old woman, she's married and the mother of 2 children. With this first load, she intends to bolster her food-serving business, which will enable her to make a better living and to help provide for her children's school expenses. It will also help her improve their living conditions and health status. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Aminata B. est une femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle envisage avec ce premier prêt, s’activer dans le domaine de la restauration. Elle pourra ainsi bien gagner sa vie et aider à l’amélioration des conditions de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To bolster her food-serving business

loans.name: Eloisa Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la cuidad de León en Nicaragua, la señora Eloisa S. se dedica desde hace 35 largos años al negocio de sastrería el cual atiende con el proposito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que tato necesita de su apoyo.

Debido a que se ha desempeñado desde hace varios años a esta labor, ha logrado salir adelante gracias a los creditos proporcionados por Ceprodel. Hoy en dia, una vez mas solicita un credito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo como lo es hilos, telas, agujas y botones. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado para asi salir adelante en su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

In the municipality of Nagarote in the city of Leon in Nicaragua, Mrs. Eloisa S. has worked in the tailoring business for 35 long years; she works with the purpose of improving the living conditions of her family that need her support.

Since she has worked for several years in this business she has managed to succeed thanks to the loan given to her by Ceprodel. Today she is once again requesting a loan for the purchase of material for her work. These materials include thread, fabric, buttons and needles; she hopes that the loan is approved since it will allow her to succeed in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sweets and cookies to sell in her community.

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es: La señora Mireya habita en el barrio habita en el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 33 años, se encuentra casada con el señor Sergio  Rivera de 37  años de edad el es electricistas y trabaja como responsable de mantenimiento, ambos tienen 4 hijos de 16, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Actualmente la señora Mireya se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos,  donde esta actividad la inicio con capital propio y con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, hace 10 años que se dedica a este actividad y tiene el propósito de seguir creciendo con su  negocio, por tanto solicita el crédito de C$ 6,000 para la compra de mercadería y poder ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mireya lives in he Hialia phase III neighborhood located in the capitol city of Managua. She is 33 years old and married to Mr. Sergio Rivera, who is 37 years old and is an electrician and works in maintenance. They have 4 children, 16, 11, 9, and 7 years old, who are all in school. Mireya sells clothing and cosmetics, a business she started with her own capital and with the goal of helping her husband with the costs of the home. For ten years she has performed this activity and intends to continue growing her business. As such, she is requesting a loan of $325 in order to purchase merchandise and to be able to offer more products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhcase cosmetics and clothing to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mrs. Shinat Sat Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal Province have formed a village bank and all the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Shinat S. is the village bank president. She is a breeder who is raising  thirteen pigs. Since her pigs are growing bigger, she does not have enough money to purchase pig feed. She asking  for a loan to buy pig feed for her pigs. She wants to sell her pigs at a reasonable price to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Shinat S. is 49 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Akumcha

texts.en:
M. was born in 1963, and is happily married with 6 children, among whom one is less than 15 years old. Life was so miserable for her when she became an orphan. Because of this M. thought her own life had come to an end without the presence of her parents. In the year 2004, she came to know of GHAPE, became a member, and received her first loans in 2005 and 2006, and all the repayments were successful.

With this next loan, she plans to buy a grinding mill and a peeling machine, install the machines and a SONEL meter, and pay rent. She is convinced the business will succeed, because she has been doing the business for a very long time. M. promises to use the profits from her loan to educate her children and provide good food and shelter for them. She prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE, because the organization is trustworthy, and the system of repayment is comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy a grinding mill and a peeling machine

loans.name: Feviiai

texts.en: Feviiai E. is 37 years old and married with three children.  She has many years of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells kava bowls (traditional carved wooden bowls) to the tourists 3 days per week. She has had six previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow will be 1600 Tala with this loan.  SPBD loans are Feviiai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase traditional kava bowls in different sizes for resale

loans.name: Parveen Patras Group

texts.en:
My name is Parveen and I've been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 25 years. I couldn’t continue my education after 8th standard due to the little financial resources of my parents. I am married to a man whose name is P. and he is a driver by profession, driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been driving this for the past 16 years.

I am a mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of my kids are getting education from a local school. I stay at home and sew clothes of my neighbors. I sew clothes to help my husband to meet the financial expenses of the household. I have successfully repaid my two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to change the body of my husband's auto-rickshaw so that he is able to continue his work.

I’m a group leader of some more women of my locality. Rozina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khairan baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies to sell. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To change the body of the auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat M. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She breeds chickens and ducks. Since breeding ducks is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more ducks and duck feed to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Pach Ngem, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Additionally, he is a construction worker.

Mrs. Phat M. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and duck feed

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina B. is married and the mother of one boy. Her son has completed junior high school and is currently learning a trade. She is 39 years old. Faustina lives with her son and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband is a mason by profession and a farmer as well.

Faustina is into trading activities. She sells textile materials and other fashion accessories, such as dressing bags, wristwatches, footwear, etc. She sells in her community by hawking.

Faustina procures her goods from Accra and other nearby cities. She has been in this business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy variety of accessories. It is her dream to help her child to have access to the best education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and fashion accessories

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa en su rostro, todos los días la señora Marta B. atiende a sus clientes en su pulpería ubicada en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua donde habita.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos para continuar ofertándolos en su propia pulpería cuyo sueños es crecer en su municipio.
texts.en:
With a smile on her face every day, Mrs. Marta B. serves her customers at her store located in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua where she lives. She has been characterized as a very hardworking person and has now turned to Ceprodel because she requires a loan for the purchase of products she will continue to offer in her own shop. Her dream is to grow her business in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her shop

loans.name: Vacilia

texts.es: Vacilia es una mujer de 44 años, y todo este tiempo ha luchado por ser feliz. Ahora, a lado de su familia; integrada por su esposo y sus  tres hijos, ha podido conseguir paz y alegría en su casa que terminó de construir, junto a su pareja, hace poco. Dedicarse al comercio fue algo con lo cual soñó desde muy joven, ya que siempre le atrajeron las ventas, desde que se caso fue dedicándose a múltiples rubros; como la venta de ropa en las calles donde tuvo diversas dificultades por el peligro y delincuencia que hay en los mercados y ferias donde vendía. Pero hace 9 años  tuvo la oportunidad de invertir en la instalación de una pequeña tienda, desde entonces, está dedicada a mantener adecuadamente su negocio, tratando siempre de contar con los productos necesarios y brindando a sus clientes una atención de calidad. A pesar de tener este negocio en casa, no deja de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, pues sus clientes le hacen pedidos, los cuales son cumplidos por doña Vacilia, quien está muy contenta de seguir creciendo económicamente, pues esto le permitirá lograr ampliar su negocio  y convertir su bodega en un bazar con mayor diversidad de productos. Vacilia es nueva en MFP, y está muy emocionada por la oportunidad de lograr sus metas a través de este crédito, y con el tiempo ser una cliente de confianza. Los 3000 soles que solicita los usará en la compra de la mercadería que requiere para su tienda, con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos y clientes.
texts.en:
Vacilia is a 44 year old woman, and has fought her whole life to be happy. Now, together with her family of a husband and their three children, she has been able to be at peace and happy in the home that she and her husband recently finished building. Working in sales was something she dreamed about as a young girl, and she was always drawn to sales. Since marrying, she has worked in many arenas, like selling clothing on the street, where she had many difficulties because of the danger and delinquency that exists in the markets where she lived. Nine years ago she had the opportunity to invest in starting a small store, and since then has been dedicated to maintaining her business, always trying to have the necessary products and to give her clients good customer service. In spite of having this business in the home, she does not neglect to sell clothing, and her customers make requests which Doña Vacilia works to fulfill. She is very happy to continue to grow economically as this will allow her to expand her business and change her store to one with a greater variety of products. Vacilia is new at MFP, and is very excited for the opportunity to achieve her goals by means of this loan, and, in time, to be a trusted client. The 3000 soles she requests will be used to buy the necessary merchandise for her store, with the purpose of satisfying the needs of her neighbors and customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Lerio

texts.en:
A hardworking and determined person, Mr. Lerio B. is 54 years old, married and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Lerio really works hard to earn. He has two children. His source of income derives from his piggery, where his wife is his partner. They have good chemistry with his wife. Because of the benefits of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, he decided to join and has already taken loans. He’s happy that with the cooperative's help, he was able to build a concrete pigpen with variety of pigs to raise. He started with a small beginning, with two piglets.

Seeing that his business grows is what he calls his greatest achievement with God’s help. He wants to buy feeds in bulk, that’s why he applies for a PHP 14,900 loan.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feeds

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde T. is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells cosmetics, clothes, and footwear by hawking her goods within her community in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more cosmetics and footwear. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S., 33, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Ung, 39, live along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. The eldest son is a garment factory worker.

Phalla has been selling groceries for four months. She buys grocery items from Korky market about 2 kilometers from her village for resale at her shop, which is in front of her house. She is able to get a gross income of about $2.50 per day. Besides selling groceries, Phalla is also a farmer. Her husband has been a construction worker for 15 years. 

She is requesting her first loan of $700 in order to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Mrs. M. resides in Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and has three children. Carmelita raises crops. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns PHP 5,000 monthly.

In 2004, Carmelita became a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has successfully repaid her previous loan for 15,000. She's now requesting her fourth cycle loan in the amount of PHP 20,000, which will be used to invest in her rice field. She will use the profits to improve her family's living conditions by providing for their basic needs.

loans.use: To invest in her rice field.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
The women who have applied for this loan from Kiva’s partner HKL are poor, but also determined to use their portion of the funds to help improve their lives. 

The group leader, C., was born in 1984, is married and has two children who are enrolled in primary school. Her husband is a security guard for a small firm located in Siem Reap Province. Since early 2008, C. has made a living selling groceries out of her home and is currently earning around $3 a day to meet family expenses. Her customers are villagers who live nearby as well as people passing through the village. Recently, C. has virtually sold out her stock of groceries, and lacks the money to buy additional supplies. She will use this loan to restock her small store. 

Among the other members of this loan group:

K. will use her portion of the loan to buy wood to finish building her house.
S., a grocery seller, is looking for a loan to expand her business.
C. will use her loan to buy a motor vehicle to ride to work.
C. will use the loan to buy a machine for her husband’s blacksmithing shop.
S. will use the loan to buy a boat for fishing.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: María Reyna

texts.es: María Reyna R. Q. vive en el municipio de San Martin en el departamento de San Salvador. Desde hace ya varios años, maneja una tienda de productos varios, junto a su esposo y con la colaboración frecuente de sus dos hijos. La disciplina y dedicación de los R. ha dado frutos, pues la tienda es conocida en la comunidad y los alrededores. En este momento María Reyna solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio y aumentar la mercadería de la tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
María Reyna R. Q. lives in the San Martin municipality in the San Salvador department. She has had a store selling various products for several years. She runs the store with her husband and with frequent help from their two children. The R.’ discipline and dedication have born fruit. The store is well known in the community and neighboring areas. María Reyna is now asking for a loan to stock her store and increase the merchandise that the store sells. She wants to do this to offer her customer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is 35 years old. She is a wife and mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot peppers and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making kenkey (Ghanian dish)

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
When Helen’s husband, a tenured U.S. Army veteran, passed away in 2003, she was left wondering how to make ends meet. Through her volunteer work with the genealogy library in Oakland, California, Helen discovered that a large number of people had an interest in exploring their ancestry. Given this demand, as well as her own personal interest in genealogy, Helen founded “My Genealogy” in order to provide family history research services. The business provides her with the supplement to her social security income that she needs.

Helen needs a $2,000 loan to purchase an all-in-one printer, copier, scanner and fax; a used computer; subscriptions to online databases for genealogists; and a desk for her part-time employee. Without the loan for the equipment and Opportunity Fund’s business advisory services, she doesn’t think her business could survive. 

Helen dreams of one day moving her business from her home to a small storefront and adding three employees to accommodate the demand she sees for genealogy services. Learn more at  www.mygenealogyonline.net.

loans.use: To buy equipment and subscriptions to online databases

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA ROSIBEL C. tiene una pequeña pulperia en donde vende productos de consumo popular, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de  de Pulpería "Los 3 Hermanos" ella tiene 5 años de haber iniciado con este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, en la 
comunidad que ella recide no tiene competencia de otro negocio es la unica que se dedica a este tipo de actividad y su pulpería luce un poco vacia.- su esposo se dedica a la agricultura; tienen 3 hijos que todavia dependen de ellos.
Siendo ella la unica persona que tiene este tipo de negocio en la zona quiere comprar muchos productos al por mayor para poderla surtir mejor y asi cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Rosibel C. has a small grocery store where she sells common grocery items. Her business operates under the name 'Pulpería "Los 3 Hermanos" (The Three Brothers' Grocery Store). She started her business 5 years ago and it is important to note that during this time she has known how to manage it. She has no other competition in the area where she resides as she is the only one making a living with this sort of business. Right now her grocery store seems a bit empty.

Her husband works in agriculture. They have three children still dependent upon them.

Being the only person with a business of this type in her neighborhood, she wants to buy many products in bulk to better stock her store and be able to satisfy her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, soups, bread, dairy products, salsas, noodles, razors, batteries, toilet paper, rice, beans, eggs, coffee, crackers, sugar, salt, tortillas

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en: Mrs. Srorn H. lives in Ta Norn village in Takeo province. She is a grocer and a weaver at home. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products and raw materials to improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Menh Chai Thav, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srorn H. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more grocery products and raw materials to improve her business.

loans.name: Santos Idulbina

texts.es:
La señora SANTOS IDULBINA S. S., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LASAURORAS EN ACCION II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Santos  es madre soltera por lo cual desde joven tuvo que trabajar arduamente para criar, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad quienes no dependen económicamente de ella; cuenta con el apoyo de ellos.
La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cerveza, gaseosa y gas en su domicilio. También vende menús y cenas. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro cajas de cerveza al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 1,200 nuevos soles comprará productos alimenticios para preparar sus menús como: arroz, aceite, menestras, fideos, etc. Y también comprará cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor para vender en su domicilio.
Santos sueña con tener su restaurante en su domicilio para así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Santos Idulbina S. S. is 58 years old and lives in the district of Salaverry, a province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the community bank Las auroras en Accion II. Santos studied until Year 11 at secondary school. As a single mother she had to work arduously from a young age to raise her four children. They are now all adults who are no longer dependent on her and who she can count on for support. Santos buys and sells beer, soft drink and gas from her home. She also sells set lunches and dinners. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought boxes of beer in bulk. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles she will buy food products to prepare set menus such as rice, oil, vegetable stews, pasta, etc. and purchase boxes of beer and soft drinks in bulk to sell from her home. Santos dreams of running a restaurant in her home to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products and beverages in bulk

loans.name: Vilma Hermelinda

texts.es:
Vilma es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis meses se dedica a la cria de aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza en el corral de su casa. Las aves las ofrece en venta en el mercado del distrito y eventualmente a sus vecinos desde su casa. Ella empezó a trabajar en este negocio debido a que su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, trabaja como peón agrícola en una cooperativa agroindustrial y los ingresos que perciben no le abastecen para mantener a su familia.

Debido a la proximidad de la campaña navideña Vilma está pensando en adquirir pavos para criarlos y ofrecerlos en las fechas cercanas a la nochebuena. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.

Vilma desea hacer mejoras en su casa que está construida de material rústico y poder seguir apoyando a la economía de su hogar. Ella es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y muy amable.
texts.en:
Vilma, 51, lives with her husband and two sons in the Cayaltí region, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past six months she has raised barnyard fowl in her yard. She sells the fowl in the district market and sometimes to her neighbors. She began this business because her husband, like many of the men in the area, works as a laborer at the local agroindustrial cooperative and his earnings are not sufficient to support the family. Because of the nearness of the Christmas season, Vilma is thinking of getting turkeys to raise and sell on the days prior to Christmas Eve. For this reason she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan of 1,000 new soles to reach her goal. Vilma would like to make improvements to her home which is built with rustic materials and to continue to contribute to the family's income. She is a very nice, responsible, hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy turkeys to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE de 3 ans et y a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D., aged 53, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the village bank Kounkané for three years and received six loans which she managed well and repaid on schedule. She produces and sells peanut butter. She participates in the improvement of the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira T. is from the city of Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Elvira is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cooked foods in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.en:
Miroslava is married with a baby son. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo where she owns a little store selling fabrics, tulle, curtains and drapes. Miroslava basically has no competitors which makes it easier for her to run her small venture. She has been in this market for 5 years. Currently, she has 60,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Miroslava is seeking a 6,500 Grivnya loan to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. The loan will enable her to significantly expand her business by attracting new clients. Miroslava is hoping to reinvest generated income into further expansion of her business. She believes that consistent growth will help her provide a stable source of income and continue to secure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To increase the variety of items she sells.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Felipa es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Felipa compra y vende neumáticos usados, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además vende accesorios para neumáticos.
Felipa necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos usados.
Los sueños de Felipa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa y tienda propia.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Pura Vida ("Pure Life") communal bank. She is 37 years old and single, with two children. Felipa buys and sells used tires, which she acquires in the city of Lima. She also sells accessories related to tires. Felipa needs a loan of 1250 Peruvian soles; she will use these funds to purchase used tires. Felipa's dreams are to see her children become professionals and to have a house and a store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing used tires

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio G., 36 years old, is a sari-sari storeowner. He desires to have a bigger store someday so that he will be able to offer his customers more selections and augment his income as well to buy the needs of his family. He started his business in September of 2009. Now, he is still selling a variety of goods because he thinks that he has a better future in this business. He would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 34 years old and the owner of a business that bottles mineral water.  She is single and owns her own home in the General Diaz neighborhood.  Laura relies on basic amenities to run her business.  Thanks to the credit she obtained through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, Laura has purchased supplies for her water-bottling plant, and has been able to boost her income.

Now, her income has increased and her clients are increasingly satisfied with the excellent service and high quality water she offers in her area.

Laura is thankful for the loans she has received through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva as they have helped her boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her water business

loans.name: Yanis Mercedes

texts.es: Yanis tiene 34 años de edad, no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. Su actividad económica es una tienda en general, por lo que tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella inicio porque quería encontrar la manera de ayudar a su Mama, pero después de obtener cierta experiencia. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos para seguir manteniendo a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Yanis is 34 years old. This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación León 2000, since she has always been concerned about making her payments on time.
