For more than eight years, she has been managing a general store. After gaining some experience, Yanis decided to start this business because she was looking for ways of supporting her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. Her desire is to increase her earnings so that she can continue supporting her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Cristóbal Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Cristóbal Antonio A. es comerciante desde hace 18 años, su trabajo lo desempeña por toda Chinandega, tiene su taxi propio que es su medio para trabajar y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que estan en edad escolar y todavía dependen de el y su esposa.
Ambos son trabajadores se esfuerzan por el pan de cada día y estudios de sus hijos los financiamientos obtenidos con ceprodel le han ayudado al señora A. a mejorar tanto su negocio como su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Cristóbal Antonio A. has been a businessman for 18 years. He performs his work throughout Chinandega. He has his own taxi, which is his means of working and advancing his three children, who are of school age an still depend on him and his spouse.

Both are workers. They strive for their daily sustenance and their children's education. The financing obtained through CEPRODEL has helped Sr. A. improve both his business and his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his home and his means of transportation

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey B. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 18 years old and is single. Jeffrey owns and operates a specialized retail business selling toy products in the local community. He is just starting this business. In 2010, Jeffrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Jeffrey plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional toy products to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng P., 50, is married and resides with his wife and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. He works as a construction worker for an income of about USD 2 per day. His wife is a farmer, growing rice in her village, earning an income of USD 1 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to fix his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s wife is pictured because P. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Irangani

texts.en:
Irangani is a 49-year-old married woman living in the town of Telijjawila, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has six children: four sons and two daughters ranging from fourteen to twenty-three years old. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Irangani has requested a 50,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her husband's business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband's business

loans.name: Mariuxi Agustina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Mariuxi es una joven madre de 20 años  tiene una niña de apenas año y medio, mantiene una bonita relación con su esposo, ya tiene en el Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejercito dos ciclos.

Mariuxi junto al esposo tienen un negocio de Flores naturales en el sector del mercado central de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ha transcurrido un año desde que iniciaron con su negocio y les ha ido muy bien se siente muy contenta nuestra socia, con los créditos que ha venido recibiendo por parte de la Fundación ha ido incrementando su local y ahora está bien surtido, ella por semana invierte 200 dólares en flores que les las traen directamente desde la sierra, en este local atiende de lunes  a domingo y aparte tiene otra venta de flores en las afuera del cementerio central de la localidad, en ese día es el esposo que se traslada hasta el lugar desde la 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde que termina su venta.

Nuestra socia comenta que para fechas especiales como el día de los enamorados y día de la madre es cuando más se vende por eso con este nuevo crédito invertirá el total del dinero para surtir su florería.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is a young mother, age 20, with a daughter who is just a year and a half old. She and her husband have a beautiful relationship. She has been in the "Av. del Ejercito" ("Army Avenue") communal bank for two loan cycles. Mariuxi and her husband have a business selling flowers in the central market area of the city of Portoviejo. They started the business one year ago; it has gone very well for them, and Mariuxi is very happy. With the loans she has received from the Foundation, she has expanded her shop, and now it is well-stocked. Each week, she invests $200 in flowers, which are delivered to her directly from the mountainous part of the country. She works in her shop from Monday through Sunday, and she also maintains another flower stand outside her town's main cemetery. On that day, her husband is the one who travels there, working from 7 in the morning until he closes the stand in the evening. Mariuxi tells us that she sells more flowers on special dates such as Valentine's Day and Mother's Day. She will invest all of the funds in stocking her flower shop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flowers (roses, carnations, daisies, chrysanthemums, etc.)

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita G. is from the village of Bucana,Sicayab. She is 63 years old. Pablita is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Pablita owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Pablita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Pablita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Pablita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Judie

texts.en:
Judie L. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Judie is married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Judie owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Previously, Judie had been engaged in making and selling food. Judie has been engaged in her seafood business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Judie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Judie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 51 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre, Mariana de 84 años, a quien cuida debido a su avanzada edad, asimismo convive con su hermana Kely de 17 años. Hace más de 35 años que se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando papa, arveja y habas en terrenos que posee y que los heredó de su madre. Por otro lado cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y sobrinos, siendo una familia unida, siempre están dispuestos a darse la mano. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es seleccionar la papa que cosecha, de acuerdo a la calidad y el tamaño, para luego ser comercializados en el mercado de Tarma, donde ya tiene compradores mayoristas que conocen la calidad de sus productos. Los terrenos con los que cuenta, quiere cedérselos a sus sobrinos para que se generen sus propios ingresos económicos, que les ayudará a independizarse. Su anhelo es comprarse un auto, ya que mas adelante desea brindar servicio de transporte público. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y está contento porque la entidad de su confianza, otra vez le ayuda a contar con el capital de trabajo que requiere, además continuará laborando en su grupo  comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 51, is single and lives in his mother Mariana’s, 84, house. He takes care of her due to her advanced age. He also lives with his 17-year-old sister, Kely. He has been a farmer for over 35 years. He farms potatoes, peas and broad beans on land that he inherited from his mother. His sister and nephews help him out since they are a very united family; they are always willing to provide a helping hand to each other. What he likes best about his work is selecting the potatoes he will harvest according to size and quality to be sold in Tarma’s market where he has wholesalers that recognize the quality of his products. He wants to pass on the lands he owns to his nephews so that they will have the means to generate their own income and help them become independent. His dream is to buy a vehicle so that later on he can provide public transportation services. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He is happy because he has the institution’s trust and that it will once again help him with capital his work requires. In addition, he will continue to work in his communal group. He will use the funds he receives to buy several sacks of organic manure that he will spread onto his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Félix Pedro García labora para la UNICA (universidad Católica de Nicaragua).como carpintero se encarga de realizar reparaciones y elaboraciones de todo tipo de artículos de carpintería en la universidad
Es casado tiene un niño .Este crédito lo solicita a CEPRODEL para realizar gastos personales comprar una cocina para uso personal y solucionar un problema en la famiia.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro García works for the UNICA (Catholic University of Nicaragua) as a carpenter. He does repairs and makes many different items as a carpenter in the university. He is married and has a son. This loan that he is requesting from CEPRODEL is for personal expenses: to buy a kitchen for his family and to solve a problem that they have have.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Use: To buy kitchen appliances that are needed for his house

loans.name: Las Artesanas Paquip Group

texts.es:
Doña CATARINA V. P., tiene 34 años,es casada, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales están a su cargo y se dedica a la elaboración D. telas y fajas D. mostacias, típicos D. la región, para la venta por mayor y menor actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 12 años atrás y con el afán D. mejorar su cálida D. y la D. su familia deciden organizarse con otras vecinas D. la comunidad para solicitar un crédito que les servirá para incrementar el capital D. cada persona y así generar más ingresos para cada familia, teniendo en cuenta que las integrantes del grupo se dedican a varias clases D. actividades productivas como: Elaboración D. fajas D. mostacias, venta D. pan, elaboración D. Bordado a mano en güipiles típicos y compra D. ganado vacuno.

Los integrantes son 11 personas que residen en la Aldea Paquib Santa Clara La Laguna. Esperan mejorar sus canancias.
texts.en:
Doña Catarina V. P. is 34 years old, married, and has four children under her care. She earns her living by making beaded fabrics and sashes that are traditional for the region. Catarina has been selling in bulk and in small amounts for 12 years and she wants to improve the quality of her products. She and a few of her relatives decided to organize a group with other neighbors in the community to request a loan that will increase the capital of each member and help generate more income for their respective families. The members of the group are involved in different types of business activities which incluD. making beaded sashes, selling bread, making traditional embroidered blouses, and buying cattle to raise.

This group consists of eleven individuals who resiD. in the neighborhood of Paquib Santa Clara La Laguna. They hope to improve their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire materials used in making beaded fabrics & sashes

loans.name: El Cocal Group

texts.es:
La señora Lorena Juárez, vive en la Ribera el Aguacate, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con el señor Roberto Juárez Pérez, en donde procreo dos hijas la mayor es Gisela Guadalupe de siete años y keily Paola con cinco años  de edad,  que están en primaria y preescolar.

      Ella se dedica a su mini tienda de abarrotes desde hace  cuatro años en donde comenta que la  ido bien cuando menos para sostenerse con su familia  y mantener en surtida su tienda, a u así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en el campo  y  en otros  trabajitos que le parece para que también aporte en su hogar.
      Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue su comunidad ya que no había tiendas donde comprar lo más necesario y para ello tenían que bajar al pueblo a comprarlo, para eso se animo y hoy gracias a dios le va bien con lo poco que obtiene de su mini abarrote.

     Con las ganancias que obtiene de su pequeño negocio, lo ahorra para comprar más  mercancía de los que le hace falta y que su clientela  requiere comprar, como también ella se sienta satisfecha con sus atenciones  que les brinda del diario.

    El sueño que ella tiene es ampliar su negocio, comprando más mercancía de mejor calidad, como también a horrar para construir un local donde su negocio se vea mas surtido y las personas se interesen en comprar su producto.
     
    Se unió al grupo por  una invitación que le hizo la señora  Efrocinia quien es la representante del grupo, el grupo se llama el cocal la razón del nombre es porque cuando se izo el levantamiento de solicitud  fue baja la sombra de un árbol de coco.
     
   Las personas que integran el grupo son  las siguientes:

  Efrocinia A. Pérez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos para venderla aliñados.

  América Pérez E.: invierte e préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas como son: pantalones, playeras, trajecitos para bebe, entre otros.

  Lorena Juárez A.: lo invierte en la compra de mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes como son: aceite, harina, frijol, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Lorena Juárez lives in la Ribera el Aguacate, in the town of Copainala, state of Chiapas, México. She lives in common law marriage with Mr. Roberto Juárez Pérez. She has two daugters. The oldest is Gisela Guadalupe, seven, and the younger is Keily Paola, five. They are in primary and pre-school. She has worked in her mini grocery store for four years. She remarks that it has gone well for her. She has been able to support herself and her family and keep her srore stocked. She also has the support of her husband, who works in the fields and in other odd jobs to support the household. What motivated her to do this activity was that in her community there were no longer any stores where people could buy their necessities and they had to go down to the town to buy them. That is why she was motivated and today, thank God, it has gone well for her with the little she has been able to get from her mini grocery store. With the earnings that she obtains from her small business, she saves to buy more merchandise that she needs and that the customers require. She also feels satisfied with the service she gives them everyday. Her dream is to expand her business, buying more and better quality merchandise, as well as to save and build a locale where her business can be more diversified and people can be more interested in buying her products. She joined the group via an invitation from Efrocinia, who is the group's representative. The group is called El Cocal. It is called that because when the application was filled out, it was done under the shade of a coconut tree. The people who make up the group are: Efrocinia A. Pérez: She will invest the loan in purchasing chicken to sell them already seasoned. América Pérez E.: She will invest the loan in buying and selling slothing, such as: pants, t-shirts, baby outfits, and more. Lorena Juárez A.: she will invest it in purchasing merchandise for her grocery store, such as: oil, flour, beans, and sugar, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store, such as: oil, sugar, flour, beans, and more.

loans.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa is a 52-year-old lady who has been in dairy farming for last 15 years in Kiambu. She is married to Daniel Mashehu who is also a farmer. They are blessed with four children, ages 35, 32, 26 and 22. Her monthly income out of this business is 12,500 Kenyan shillings.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by a church member. She is applying for her second loan with KADET, which she plans to use to buy a dairy cow. Because she does farming on her own piece of land, there is great potential to expand her business with the extra profit she receives.

Truphosa dreams to have the dairy farming activity secure her retirement. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Faïda sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Zambougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de parenté et de voisinage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente du niébé, du mil, du lait, des condiments alimentaires et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le but de s’approvisionner au comptant en marchandises, elles ont  décidé d’adhérer  à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sanata  D.  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de niébé. Elle se ravitaille en niébé à la foire de Konodimini et de Konobougou. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à domicile et à la foire du village à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Sanata  D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres membres du groupe de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The five women of the Faida group are all married and living mainly in polygamous families.  On the average, they are 36 years old, with four children. They live in Zambougou village in the rural community of Sanando in Seégoou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They sell niébé [a type of black-eyed peas], millet, milk, food condiments and wax “pagnes,” [traditional colorful cloth]. In order to be able to pay cash for a new stock of goods, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Mrs. Sanata D. plans to use her loan to purchase two bags of niébé. She stocks up at the Konodimini market in Konobougou. She sells for cash and on credit out of her home and at the village market to a customer base composed generally of women. 

Mrs. Sanata D. hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 28,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover some everyday household needs, with the rest reinvested in her business. Like other group members, she would like to start raising sheep and goats.

loans.use: Purchasing black-eyed peas

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem M. currently makes rattan cupboard furniture. She is 56 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, located about 250 km from the capital, Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a construction worker. She has five children: four are married and one is single.

Sem M. saves up over 8 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Sem M. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings in order to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming.

loans.name: Selly Jepketer

texts.en:
Selly is a fifty-two year-old mother of five children and married to Mr.L.. Three of her children are married and two still go to school. She is in the business of selling new clothes at her village. She also practices dairy farming and sells milk at the town center where some of her neighbors also buy from her.

She plans to use her first loan to buy additional new clothes so that she can sell to her customers at a profit.  Her future plan is to own a shop at the town center and stock it with new clothes as she has a good number of customers who visit her and make orders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana es una persona muy alegre y dinámica. Ella vive en la zona D. Villa Salome que se encuentra a cuarenta minutos del centro D. la cuidad.  Mariana se dedica a la venta D. comida y su especialidad son los silpanchos con huevos y los asados. VenD. la comida solo por la noche pero uno D. sus anhelos es ampliar su negocio para vender almuerzos en el día. Ella tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales los tres primeros ya son personas mayores y profesionales, solo vive con su pequeña hija la cual esta en edad escolar. Su esposo esta D. viaje por motivos D. trabajo y por eso mariana tiene el trabajo D. llevar adelante su hogar. Ella es una persona respetuosa y muy responsable, con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes como arroz, fideo, papa, aceite para la elaboración D. riquísimos platillos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Mrs. Mariana is a happy and dynamic person. She lives in the Villa Salome zone, which is located forty minutes from the center of the city. Mariana sells food and her specialty is “silpanchos” with eggs or grilled meat. She sells the meals only at night. One of her desires is to grow her business in order to sell lunch during the day. She has four children. The older three children are grown and have professions. She only lives with her youngest child who is still in school. Her husband travels to find work and because of this Mariana has to work to support their house. Mariana is a respectful and responsible person. With this money she will buy groceries such as rice, noodles, potatoes, and oil in order to make her delicious dishes. She is very thankful for the institution that provides this assistance.

loans.use: She will buy rice, potatoes and noodles.

loans.name: Procura

texts.en:
Mrs. Procura B. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Procura is married to Antonio B. and has two school-age children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a direct sales business particularly beauty products and also operates a mobile sound system for hire. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Just this year, Procura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP for her 2nd loan which will be used to purchase additional equipment for her sound system. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially for their basic needs, savings, insurance and for possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional equipment for her sound system

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun K., a 42-year-old farmer earning an income of USD 1.5 per day, is married and resides with her husband, a factory worker earning USD 3 per day, in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 2 on electricity supply, and USD 50 on other necessary expenses every month.

Khun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase two cows to improve her farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy two cows to improve the farming business

loans.name: Maricela Del Consuelo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Maricela lleva seis años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre han estado para ayudarla tanto sus compañeras como también la institución. Tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una linda niña de 5 años la cual está en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante. Ella estudia Ing. En  sistemas.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar en algo a los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, el cual es vendedor mayorista de boletos de lotería, el esposo entrega los boletos de lotería en su casa a comerciantes minoristas que  a su vez los venden a las personas por las calles de la ciudad, trabaja los jueves, sabados y domingos. Realiza semanalmente los pedidos a la matriz en Guayaquil.
 
Este crédito es para comprar boletos de lotería ya que él tiene que cancelar allá al contado y entrega a crédito hasta por una semana. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
The Comunal bank "El Pedregal" holds meetings every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in Portoviejo. Portoviejo is known for being a very commercial area as well as for it's traditional "fiestas" in honor of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and the happiness of its people.
 
Maricela has been a member of the communal bank for six years.  She likes the bank because, both its members and the institution as a whole, have always been there to support her. She is 24 years old, married and has a five year old daughter who is now in kindergarten. Her husband works as a merchant. Maricela is studying Systems Engineering.
 
Maricela is a homemaker and she wishes to help with the household expenses by requesting the loan to invest her husband's business. Her husband sells wholesale lottery tickets, which he orders weekly from Guayaquil. Retailers pick up the tickets from their home and then sell them to people in the streets of the city. He works on Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays.
 
Maricela is requesting the loan so she can purchase lottery tickets given that her husband needs to pay for them in cash but allows up to a week to receive payments from customers. Maricela dreams of finishing college.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets

loans.name: Sibiri

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Sibiri C.  est âgé de 57 ans et vit avec ses 13 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame à Banankoro, un des villages de la préfecture de Kati, relevant de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignant de son état à l’école fondamentale de Banankoro, Sibiri C.,  afin de subvenir aux charges de sa famille nombreuse, est  devenu le promoteur d’un restaurant depuis maintenant  5 ans. Il jouit d’une forte renommée et réputation auprès de la population locale et des routiers. Sibiri est à son deuxième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso, le premier ayant été remboursé sans aucune difficulté. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, Sibiri décida de continuer à collaborer avec l’institution. 
Il compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 2 tonnes de riz et quelques colis de condiments alimentaires en gros  à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Il vend ses plats alimentaires (riz au gras, riz à la sauce arachide, tomate et aux feuilles vertes) dans son restaurant sis au marché se trouvant aux abords de la route internationale reliant Bamako à Abidjan, essentiellement  au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement pour les fonctionnaires de la localité.
Sibiri C. envisage réaliser avec ce prêt, un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 70.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt,  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et le reste  réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Sibiri C. is 57 years old and he lives with his 13 children and his wife in a monogamous family in Banankaro. It is a village in the Kati prefecture in Koulikoro (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Originally a primary school teacher in Banankoro, Sibiri C., in order to support his large family, became the owner of a restaurant 5 years ago.   He enjoys a high reputation by the local population and visitors. Sibiri is on his second individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner), after the first loan was repaid without difficulty. 

In order to satisfy his ever growing and demanding clientele, Sibiri decided to continue on with the organization.  He plans on using this new loan to purchase 2 tons of rice and a few packages of condiments in wholesale in Bamako (capital city of Mali). He sells his foods (fried rice, rice with peanut sauce, tomato, and green leaves) from his restaurant in the market. It is located along the international route linking Bamako to Abidjan. He completes his sales in cash and on credit, payable on a monthly basis by the officials of the region. 

Sibiri C. expects, with the help of this loan, to earn a monthly income of 70.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan, to provide for his family's expenses, and to reinvest the remaining portion in his business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his restaurant.

loans.name: Vidal De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Vidal, tiene 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, ella trabaja con la ayuda D. sus hijas Gloribel D. 23 años y María Luisa D. 28 años D. edad, este negocio nació hace mucho y tiempo, hacen las tortillas en su casa por las mañanas y al mismo tiempo las comercializan, su inconveniente es que rápidamente se les agotan el maíz y la leña.
Doña Vidal está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en leña, maíz, gas, ya que con esta inversión quiere tener una gran cantidad D. materiales para disponer D. ella, lo bueno en esta inversión es que son materiales que no se dañan y que se pueden almacenar por vario tiempo.
Con el préstamo espera mejorar el negocio, e ir avanzando para lograr algún día un local donD. puedan sus hijas ofrecer las tortillas, para mantener sus propios hogares.
texts.en:
Ms. Vidal is 40 years old and lives in the Guatajiagua department of Morazán. She sells tortillas and works with the help of her daughters Gloribel, 23, and Maria Luisa, 28 years old. This business was born many years ago. They make the tortillas at home in the morning and market them at the same time. Their problem is that they quickly run out of corn and firewood. 
Ms. Vidal is requesting a loan to invest in firewood, corn, and gas since with this investment she would like to have a large quantity of materials at her disposal. The good thing about this investment is that they are materials that don't spoil and can be stored for a long time.
With this loan she hopes to improve her business and continue advancing to one day obtain the premises where daughters can offer tortillas and be able to support their own homes.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood

loans.name: Ndyomugyenyi

texts.en:
Ndyomugyenyi L. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 30 years old and married with three children aged 8, 7, and 2 years. L. owns a car that he uses to transport people to their desired destinations. He has been in business for over five years and he is grateful that he is able to make an average profit of 620,000/=. This is in addition to the profits he gets from the sale of coffee. 

He works with his wife especially in the buying and selling of coffee. L. says that he is also a farmer and this he has done since he was very young since it is a family thing to be involved in agriculture. He needs a loan to be able to repair his car.

loans.use: His car maintainence and repair

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Norma es una de las 7 integrantes de la Alcancía Comunal “Señor de la Esperanza” ubicada en la zona rural  de Matucana y tiene el cargo de presidenta. Norma tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos de los cuales uno esta a su cargo y actualmente esta estudiando, gracias a su esfuerzo. Últimamente adquirió un pequeño quiosco que lo ha ubicado en la puerta de su vivienda y vende comida, frituras como: anticuchos, panchos, pollo a la parrilla. Trabaja arduamente pues tiene clientes que trabajan en la carretera realizando mantenimiento. Norma desea invertir el capital obtenido en útiles escolares para la campaña2011, pues sabe que obtendrá ganancias extras para su economía. Además de seguir en la venta de comida. Su sueño es llegar a tener su propia bodega en casa. En la Alcancía Comunal Señor de la esperanza los socios participan activamente y son puntuales en sus pagos, y están agradecidos por las atenciones a su solicitud. Por motivo de horario de trabajo la Sra. Ileodora no llego a tiempo pues trabaja en un hospital san Juan de Matucana como cocinera. La señorita adjunta C. labora como cosmetóloga en la ciudad de Chosica y la distancia hacia Matucana la imposibilito para estar puntual en la reunión de desembolso.
texts.en:
Norma is one of the 7 members of the "Señor de la Esperanza" (Lord of Hope) community bank which is located in the rural area of Matucana.  She is the group's president.

Norma is 53 years old, a single mother, and has two children, one of whom is in her care and currently studying thanks to her hard work.  Norma recently acquired a small kiosk which she has located outside her home and there she sells meals and fried food such as kebabs, hot dogs and grilled chicken.  She works hard because she has customers who carry out maintenance work on the roads.  Norma would like to invest her loan money in obtaining school supplies for the 2011 school year since she knows that this way she will make extra profits.  She will also continue selling meals.

Norma's dream is to one day have a grocery store in her home.  The members of the "Señor de la Esperanza" community bank are active participants and they are punctual in making their repayments.  They are grateful for the attention people pay to their request.

Owing to her working hours, Ileodora did not arrive in time for this photo.  She works in San Juan de Matucana Hospital as a cook.  The lady whose photo is added to the main photo is Miss C..  She works as a cosmetologist in the city of Chosica and the distance between Chosica and Matucana made it impossible for her to be punctual in arriving at the loan disbursement meeting.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for the upcoming school year

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., 57, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces wooden furniture to sell, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 90 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband's furniture.

loans.use: to buy more wood to produce wooden furniture.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 53 años; vive con Adolfo desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 6 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Tiambra. Su principal actividad económica es “la agricultura”, donde siembra desde hace 8 años papa, arveja, habas, maíz y olluco, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los cuales cuida con la ayuda de su esposo, quien es su compañero incondicional. Según menciona en campaña agrícola arrienda hectáreas de terrenos en el caserío de San Juan, para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades. Ya que comercializa su cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde tiene buena demanda. De igual manera prepara queso con la leche de las 3 vacas que posee, vendiendo 5 quesos diarios a un promedio de S/. 3 soles cada uno. Ahora tiene sembrado papa y habas que cosechará en el mes de mayo, con lo que espera obtener una buena ganancia para poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos menores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa rosa de Tiambra”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde trabaja arduamente para poder mantener la unión y progreso de su asociación, como miembro de la junta directiva. María, con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que oscilan entre S/. 90 soles cada uno. Los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
María, 53, has lived with Adolfo for 15 years.  They have 7 children but only six of them still live with them in their own house located in the hamlet of Tiambra.  Her main economic activity is farming.  For the last 8 years she’s farmed potatoes, peas, lima beans, corn and olluco (an Andean tuber) on her own farmlands.  She cares for her crops with help from her husband who is her unconditional companion.

According to what she told us, during the planting season she leases land from third persons in the San Juan hamlet in order to plant larger amounts because she sells her crops in the city of Tarma’s wholesale market where demand is high.

She also makes cheese with milk from the three cows she owns selling on average 5 cheeses daily for 3 soles each.  She currently has potatoes and lima beans planted that will be harvested in May.  She hopes to obtain good profits to cover educational expenses of her younger children.

She’s a member of the “Santa Rosa de Tiambra” communal bank and this is her 6th loan with MFP where she works hard to maintain her group’s unity and progress as a member of its governing board.

María plans to use the requested loan to buy sacks of organic manure that run about 90 soles each that she’ll spread among her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Tufaidi Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is in her late thirties and married with four children who are still going to school. She has been running a pharmacy for three years and works from 8.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Elizabeth's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the stock with whatever medicine was out.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more medicine.  Her dream is to one day own a small dispensary as she is a qualified nurse.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group "Tufaidi" which has a total of 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture, Elizabeth is wearing a light blue dress in the middle.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Tomato Group

texts.en:
Yahaya N., is in his mid-forties and married, with two children who are still at school. He has been selling bricks for three years now.  He works from 9.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Yahaya's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes to buy more bricks to sell.  His dream is to one day open a hardware shop.

Yahaya will share this loan with his loan group "Tomato", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Yahaya is 1st on the left, 3rd row.

loans.use: to buy more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Joli Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JOLI est constitué 3 femmes mariées et  d’une célibataire, qui ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits  avec  FATI. 
FATI, compte acheter avec son  prêt,  750 Kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de MEDINE. Les pommes de terre sont revendus  à la gare et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The JOLI group is composed of 4 women (3 married and 1 single) who average 27 years of age and 3 children. They live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU II, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is the first time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is in the fruit business with FATI.
With this loan, FATI intends on buying 750kg of potatoes. She buys them at the market in MEDINE. The potatoes are then sold retail and for cash, both at the station and door to door, to a clientele of men and women.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 30.000FCFA, which will be mostly used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and an orchard. He lives together with his mother. His father passed a few years ago. The son inherited the farm and the fruit orchard, and thanks to his hard work, managed to increase the business. 

He wishes to increase the livestock and develop his business further. The increased income will allow Simon to create better living conditions and create his own family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara is 28 years old, married and has three sons. None of them is able to attend school because Babara and her husband are unable to afford their education. Babara is a housewife. She stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her routine tasks very well. Her husband has a spare parts business. His shop is located in the market and he sells spare parts for different vehicles. Babara’s father-in-law also lives with her family. He is 50 years of age and works with his son in the spare parts business. 

Babara has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts of different vehicles which will allow him to offer more to his customers and increase his sales. He has eight years of experience in his business and Babara hopes that a loan investment will be very productive for him. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Babara.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Mergen

texts.ru: Мерген проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он вместе со своей семьей занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сеет рис, пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mergen lives in the Jilikul region. He is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Together with his family he grows crops. He rents out a plot of land where he sows rice, wheat and grows vegetables. He has been in this business for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 21 years old and single. She is involved in a furniture-making business with her mother and sister. Together, they operate a family-owned furniture store for which they make all their own products. Alicia and her family are very devoted to their business and wish to begin making even more furniture. With this loan, Alicia plans to buy more wood so that she can produce more furniture. She will also buy any other materials that her family needs for their business. Alicia and her family are committed to making all the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her family's furniture-making business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladis is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has one daughter who is two years old. Her occupation is selling various types of sandals. She has her own stand where she sells her sandals in a large  market in the city of Cusco called Mercado Molino. She has had this business for over eight years. 

Gladis is asking for a loan so that she can buy more sandals to sell. In addition, she wants to buy a greater variety of sandals and more recent styles. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme Suzanne est la représentante du groupe FILWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, des jumeaux. Ils ont 04ans et personne ne va à l’école. Elle à deux personnes en charge.

Elle vend des paniers depuis 06 mois. Mme s’approvisionne à Banfora au BURKINA FASO. Ses clients sont les femmes; les hommes; ses voisins et tous ceux qui fréquentent le marché.

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 15 gros paniers, 60 moyens et 200 petits paniers.

Ses économies vont servir à acheter une parcelle. Elle a comme ambitions changé de métier et embrasser la carrière de l’élévage.Et aussi assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mme Suzanne is the representative of the group called FILWENDE. She is married and the mother of twin sons. They are four years old and don't go to school. Suzanne is responsible for two persons.  

She has been selling baskets for six months. She buys her wares at Banfora in BURKINA FASO. Her customers are women, men, her neighbors and all those who come shopping at the market. 

With the loan money, she wants to buy 15 big baskets, 60 medium-sized ones, and 200 little baskets. 

Her savings will be used to buy a plot of land. Her ambition is to change jobs and take up raising livestock. Also, she must ensure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy 15 big baskets, 60 medium-sized ones, and 200 little baskets.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a rice farmer.  He is married and has four children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old.  He has done rice farming for the past seven years.  He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice growth.

loans.name: Uhuru

texts.en:
Uhuru is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a farming business, selling farm produce at the market and from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He dreams of establishing a larger farm in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase maize seeds and manure for planting. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and manure for planting.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en:
Pek is located in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She is 53 years old, a married woman, and has seven lovely children. All of her children are singles.

Currently, Pek is a rice farmer.she is the one person who works hard for covering her family's expenses. From this business activity, she can earn approximately 1 USD per day. To assist her income, her son works as a telephone repairer in a market near her community. From this sector, her son can earn about $4USD per day. 

To upgrade their living, her son wishes to purchase additional telephone materials, but he lacks money, so he asked his parent to borrow some funds through HKL, a Kiva partner. 

Her son hopes that this loan will make his business gain more profit per day and live in good situation.

loans.use: to purchase telephone materials.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana de 24 años, es soltera, vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Tununtuari. Ella es una señora de corazón noble y muy trabajadora; se dedica al cultivo del cacao. Actividad que lo realiza en compañía de sus padres y hermanos. Bien sabe que esta planta del cacao es perenne, y que con el pasar de los años el suelo va perdiendo sus nutrientes, razón por la que se requiere fertilizarlo constantemente. Cuando es temporada de cosecha debe contratar jornaleros para que la ayuden en la recolección de los frutos, y del que luego serán comercializados en la comunidad de valle esmeralda. Ella esta conforme con esta labor que realiza por que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, de esta manera puede apoyar a sus hermanos menores pagando sus estudios. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Juliana is 24 years old, single, and lives in her own house located in the city of Tununtuari. She is a lady with a noble heart and she is a hard worker. 

She works growing cacao. She does this work alongside her parents and siblings. She knows very well that cacao is a perennial plant, and that as the years go by the soil will lose its nutrients, and so the soil requires fertilizing constantly. 

During harvesting season she hires laborers to help harvest the crops and then later she sells the product in the community of Valle Esmeralda. She is happy doing this work because it provides a good income, so she can support her younger siblings and pay for their studies. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the loan of 2500 soles to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Emprendiendo Sin Fin Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Emprendiendo Sin Fin”, lo conforman 22 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confitería, repostería, amasandería, venta de ropa interior y mascotas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Marta integrante del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón color azul y una polera rayada, se dedica al rubro de la repostería, desde hace 5 años. Ella realizó algunos cursos de repostería impartidos por la Municipalidad e instituciones de solidaridad.
Comenta que le ha ido muy bien con la venta de sus productos y conserva clientela antigua. Sus productos los realiza en su casa y los reparte en los domicilios de sus clientes fijos. Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Temuco. Su cocina está implementada por una cocina a gas, microondas y una batidora. 
Actualmente se dedica a la preparación y venta de postres, por lo que con el crédito comprará envases de plástico, cucharas de plástico, vasos y leche. 
Sus metas en su negocio son prosperar y surgir económicamente. 
Marta vive junto a sus padres y sus sueños a nivel personal son ahorrar para postular a una vivienda propia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios y créditos otorgados por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirán invertir en su negocio y organizarlo. 
Respecto al grupo del banco comunal comenta que ya se conocían con los demás integrantes y la relación ha sido muy buena. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Emprendiendo Sin Fin" (Endless Enterprise), and is comprised of 22 entrepreneurs who are involved in different activities such as bakery and sweets products,  underwear sales and pets.  They all live in the city of Temuco.

Marta is a member of the communal bank and is pictured sitting in the first row second from the right.  She is wearing blue jeans and a striped sweater.  She has been making bakery products for five years and has taken several bakery classes offered by the municipality and support institutions.

Product sales have been going well and she has many customers.  She makes her products at home and delivers them to a fixed customer base.  She buys her ingredients in the city of Temuco.  Her kitchen has a gas stove, microwave and mixer.

Currently she makes and sells desserts and wants to use the loan to buy plastic containers, plastic spoons, cups and milk.  Her goal is for her business to prosper and become successful economically.

Marta lives with her parents and her personal goals are to save enough money to buy her own house.  She is very happy and grateful for the services and loans received from Fondo Esperanza, which have enabled her to invest in and organize her business.

Regarding the communal bank she says she already knew the other members and the relationship has been a good one.  Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  There are several lake spas (Pucón, Villarrica) in the area and colorful flora and fauna in the nearby natural parks.  Around 50% of the Chilean Mapuche indians live here.

loans.use: To buy plastic containers, spoons, cups and milk.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a young man age 23 years old and single. He supports one member of his family in paying school fees. He owns a retail shop, and has been in this business for a period of two years earning a monthly income of 9,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

Joseph has borrowed a second term loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD after he successfully paid the previous one.  He wishes to use this money to purchase more industrial goods for his shop.  

With the anticipated income, he will invest back the into the business and also improve his stock. His dream is to prosper in business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his shop.

loans.name: Ulziihishig

texts.en:
Ulziihishig is 45 years old and lives with her family in a ger, which is a Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband drives a truck for a mining company, her daughter works for a cosmetics company, and her son is a high school student. 

Ulziihishig started her business in 1996 by selling meat at the local market. She has since moved her business to a new market. She has many years of work and business experience in her field. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who says, "The price of meat is going up, and I need to have more meat." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and increase her turnover capital. She purchased new land and thus lacked turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells paper. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more paper for resale, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to increase capital.

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faridah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more paper for resale

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse et a 01 enfant de 12ans scolarisé.
Kossi travaille comme imprimeur depuis 2007. Il travaille seul et achète les outils de travail à Lomé.
Kossi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des machines d’imprimerie. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Kossi is a 44-year-old man. He is married to a hair stylist and has a 12-year-old child who attends school. Kossi has been working as a printer since 2007. He works alone and buys tools in Lome. Kossi needed a second loan from WAGES in order to buy printing machines. He wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, Kossi would like to grow his business. He says that with the profits, he foresees having a happy family.

loans.use: to buy printing machines

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Jubbo a été crée depuis l'ouverture du banc villageois. Il compte 15 femmes et qui habitent pour la plupart dans le même village.

Daba,debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 06 enfants.	
	
Son prêt reçu lui permettra de mieux développer son petit commerce de mil, de l'huile et de l'arachide. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.	
	
Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter son niveau d'épargnes et participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vies de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Juboo solidarity group was set up after the opening of the banc villageois. The group has 15 women members, most of whom live in the same village.

Daba, standing on the right in the photo, is head of the group. She is 47 years old and married, with six children.
	
Her loan will allow her to develop her small business selling millet, oil and groundnuts. She has been working in this field of activity for many years, which has given her a lot of experience.
	
The profits from the business will allow her to increase her savings and improve her children's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy millet, groundnuts and other supplies.

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es:
La señora Magdali es casada con el señor  José Ariel y con quien procreo  tres hijos quienes  a un están  a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  tacos en donde lleva  trabajando  tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a mejorado mucho sus ingresos para su familia.

  Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que también  quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa   y darle lo más necesario  a su familia.

   Lo que más desea es que con su pequeña actividad vaya  aumentado más y más su actividad para seguir adelante hasta que dios les preste vida.
texts.en:
Magdali is married to José Ariel and they have three children still in their care.  She asked for the loan to buy ingredients to make tacos.  She’s been working for three years and she comments that she does well since she’s improved her family’s income very much.  

Her inspiration for this activity started because she also wants to help her husband with household income and to provide what’s necessary for her family.  What she most wants is that her small activity grows more and more to continue forward as long as God grants her life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village of Giorgitsminda in the Kakheti region. He is 33 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Tamar, two daughters (5 and 3 years old), mother, and 24-year-old sister. All adult family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for them. The family has 2 milk cows and sells milk locally. The family also has a plot of land where various vegetables are grown. They sell harvested vegetables locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Levan requested credit for hiring a tractor for cultivation of the land. After properly completing seasonal work, Levan will count on good income for the next year. He will sell harvested vegetables for a good price and get the income which will be spent on the family's daily needs during the year.

loans.use: to pay the owner of a tractor for land cultivation service

loans.name: Shayamie

texts.en:
Shayamie is from D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. 
To make a living, Shayamie owns and operates a business venture serving a variety of different products to customers in the local community. Shayamie has been in this business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2010, Shayamie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Norllis Elena

texts.es:
Norllis es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.
Todo comenzó hace unos meses cuando trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección; hoy en día, a sus 49 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina a doble aguja, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Norllis sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.

loans.use: compra de una máquina a doble aguja, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old married with 3 children. She is an active member of Christian Women Association in her local church. Her contribution to the community is mainly helping the needy people– i.e. the elderly, the orphans and HIV\AIDS victims. Grace and the other members makes visit the needy and give them food, clothing and do the homestead chores that are at times left unattended to. They do bible study with the needy and encourage them using bible teachings.

Grace has a small retail shop which she operates. She works in the shop together with her younger brother who has completed secondary school. She sells retail items like sugar, salt, soap, etc. She also stocks polythene bags and sells mainly to the market vendors who operate from the nearby Kiserian market. Her dream is to operate a small kerosene depot. She would be buying her stock from the kerosene distributors and selling to the local residents. During the market day she will be selling paraffin to the maasai community who come to the market.

loans.use: Grace would like to buy paraffin in drums at wholesale price from the distributors and sell the same at retail price at her retail shop.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
This 47-year-old woman provides for her family with her business. She has been engaged in this business at home. She has a lot of clients.
Tahmina is a well-known laundress in Yenikand village, Salyan region . She is tidy, clean and frank. 
She tries to increase the number of her clients.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy a washing-machine.

loans.use: To buy a  washing-machine

loans.name: Savili

texts.en: Baking has always been Savili’s first interest. So, when she became responsible for a family of ten, she decided to put her talent into action. Her four children are still attending school. Savili’s husband works six days a week while she tends to the baking from home. Two of her children  are working but their incomes cannot accommodate their growing family.

loans.use: To purchase flour, wheat, bananas, labor, and rent fee for stall

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is a very hard-working woman. She is married and her husband is a traffic policeman. She used to work selling jewellery but decided to change trade to something that she enjoyed more, so she started selling hot dogs which she has now been doing for ten years. She started doing this to help her husband to pay the household costs and to provide for their children and this is something they have acheived. She wants her business to keep growing and she will keep working hard at it as she has a lot of motivation and she enjoys what she does.

Eugenia would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 3 months. She would use it to buy the raw materials she needs to make her products and cover her clients demands. Her and her husband thank you very much for your support which will enable the business to grow and improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenia es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, esta casada y su esposo trabaja como policía de transito, ella antes de su negocio se dedicaba a la venta de joyería, pero decidió cambiar de rubro a algo que ella hace mejor y le gusta más, así fue como incursionó en la venta de hot dogs, llevando ya con su negocio más de 10 años, el cual inició para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante, lo cual ha logrado pero ella quiere continuar creciendo como microempresaria y seguir trabajando por que es una actividad que le da mucha motivación y gusto hacerla.

Eugenia está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses y con esto poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos y poder cubrir la demanda que tiene, ella y su esposo te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les das para poder continuar creciendo como microempresaria y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida is 36 years old. Her partner, Roque, works in masonry. They have 2 children of 9 and 8 years, respectively, and both go to school. Aida comes from a very humble family, which is the reason why she began to work at the age of 13 as a nursemaid to help provide basic sustenance for her already large family. Being very young she already had many responsibilities, such as household chores and work, and because of this she had to put aside her studies while having only an education up to the first year of primary school. Aida invests herself in the sale of jewelry in the Municipal Market of the city of Itá, an enterprise which has developed over 10 years to account for a large clientele. She works every day so that her family will not want for bread and so that her children have the opportunity that life denied her, that her children should have access to a university career and that they be well prepared for life. She needs this loan to increase her stock of merchandise, that is, to buy more hoops, hairbands, rings, bracelets, clasps, etc. At this time, her sales have already increased and she requires money to carry out further purchases.

Translated by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Aida tiene 36 años, está en pareja con Roque quien se dedica a la albañilería. Tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 8 años respectivamente, ambos hijos van a la escuela. Aida proviene de una familia muy humilde motivo que la llevó a comenzar a trabajar a la edad de 13 años como niñera para ayudar al sustento familiar ya que su familia era muy numerosa. Siendo muy joven ya tenía muchas responsabilidades, tanto con las labores del hogar como en el trabajo, debido a eso tuvo que renunciar a sus estudios teniendo una educación solo hasta el primer año de la primaria. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bijouterie en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Itá, actividad que desarrolla hace aproximadamente 10 años contando ya con una gran clientela. Trabaja todos los días para que de esta forma a su familia no le falte el pan de cada día y para que sus hijos tengan esa oportunidad que la vida le negó, que es el que sus hijos tengan acceso a una carrera universitaria y que sean personas de bien. Necesita el préstamo para ampliar su stock de mercaderías, es decir para comprar más vinchas, pulseras, anillos, hebillas, etc. ya que en estos tiempos las ventas han aumentado y requiere de dinero para llevar a cabo sus compras.

loans.use: Purchase of hoops, hairbands, rings, bracelets, and clasps.

loans.name: Aiubjon

texts.ru:
Aiubjon and his wife sell household goods. They have been in business for a long time and are quite successful entrepreneurs. Recently, they rented a small shop where they are currently located. Aiubjob is 45 years old and he has two children. He received his first loan from MicroInvest in order to bring in a wider range of products and it improved his turnover. Currently, he wants a new loan to further expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Аюбчон и его жена продают хозяйственные товары. Занимаются они этим недавно и уже являются успешными предпринимателями. Недавно они арендовали маленький магазинчик где и ведут свой бизнес. Аюбчону 45 лет, у него 2 детей. Чтобы приобрести больше товара он получил займ в Микроинвест. Это заметно отразилось на его бизнесе в лучшую сторону. Сейчас он хочет получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother with a 6-year-old son. Her primary business is selling clothing from her home in Lima, and a year ago she started selling cosmetics as well to earn more money.

Rosa is very interested in fashion and enjoys selling the clothes and the cosmetics. She purchases the clothes in bulk from a wholesaler in Lima, and sells them from her home to friends and relatives who have come to count on her for their clothing needs. She can buy a pair of jeans for 30 Soles ($10) and sell them for 50 Soles ($17). As a single mother, she needed to increase her income, and a friend recommended she begin selling cosmetics for the company Esika, similar to Mary Kay or Avon. It was easy for her to jump right into this, because several of the regular customers from her clothing business were also interested in purchasing cosmetics from her.

Rosa lives in a house with 12 other people. She comes from a family of eight children, and lives with all of her siblings and their children. Unfortunately, one of her siblings recently passed away, and that has left a deep sadness in their home. She would love to be able to someday purchase her own house where she and her son can live. Her son is in school, and even at the young age of six has a dream of becoming an engineer!

Rosa’s dream for her business is to open a store where she can display and sell all her clothing, but it is very expensive to do this: the initial investment would be around 5000 Soles (about $1700). With this loan of $150 Rosa will buy 10 pairs of jeans to sell, and the profit from this will go towards her dream of opening her own store.

loans.use: To buy 10 pairs of jeans to sell

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mawussé A. is 38 and a married mother of four children. She is the owner and manager of a small roadside restaurant located next to a photography studio. She has been running this business for ten years, and she earns enough income to help pay her family’s expenses and help her younger sisters, who are in apprenticeships. With this loan, she would like to increase the size of her restaurant and make it cleaner and better ventilated so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Mawussé A. est agée de 38 ans , mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est propriétaire et gérante d'un petit restaurant installé au bord de la route à coté d'un studio de photo.Elle exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans et lui procure des revenues pour contribuer aux charges familliales et aider ses petites soeures qui sont en formation. Avec cet emprunt elle désire agrandir et rendre le cadre du restaurant plus propre et plus aéré afin d'attirer plus de la clientèle.

loans.use: Improving her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S. and her husband have been married since 1990. They have five children; one son and four daughters. Three of her children are studying in the local school, the two youngest children stay at home. Her family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. S. and her husband have been in the business of selling fruits for many years. They purchase the fruits from a market in Phnom Penh and resell the produce in front of garment factory near their village. She is requesting her third loan in the amount of $300. This money will be used for buying fruits to resell.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Mrs. Iv S., age 40, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land planting vegetables and normally she earns around $4 in revenue a day. Her husband Mr. Buntha, 36, is a taxi-driver with a daily income $5 a day. They have 3 children.
One is married and lives away from home and one other is a student. Another  stays at home to help her planting the vegetables.
She needs to request a loan from Kiva to hire a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To hire a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Celinda G. J., is associated to the Comunal Bank "Unidad Calzadina". She lives in the region of San Martin, Province of Moyabamba, district of Moyobamba. She sells chicken in an environment built specially for this acivity. Her business is located in one of the main streets in the city, where many clients attend daily to consume the delicious roasted chicken that she prepares.

She started her business selling assorted items, but her attitude of visionary brought her to the roasted chicken business, a very demamded business in her community.
